loans.name: Eddy Gerardo

texts.es:
Eddy Gerardo P. S. es un señor de 33 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Eddy vive con su esposa Xinia que es ama de casa y con sus dos hijas Maricruz y Yirlany. 

Don Eddy se dedica a la agricultura mayormente se ha especializado en lo que es la horticultura, dice que ha trabajado casi toda su vida en esto. Él tiene una finca en donde ha sembrado diferentes  hortalizas y tubérculos. Los productos que tiene sembrados ahorita son tomate y papa. 

En estos momentos lo que desea es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢650,000 (seiscientos cincuenta mil colones) para comprar  diferentes insumos, fertilizantes, y contratar mano de obra ya que se le hace muy difícil realizar todo el trabajo solo. Con esto espera que la cosecha sea grande y los productos de calidad también desea que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Don Eddy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente. Comenta que gracias a estos créditos ha podido desarrollarse mejor y crecer como persona, así también se siente muy feliz ya  que les ha podido brindar la oportunidad de estudiar a sus dos pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
Eddy Gerardo P. S. is a 33 year old man living in a rural community of Costa Rica called San Cristóbal Norte, 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a hilly area where people work in areas such as trade, agriculture (vegetables, coffee, and other crops), handicrafts, livestock farming, and many other areas. Eddy lives with his wife Xinia, who is the homemaker, and with their two daughters Maricruz and Yirlany. Eddy works mainly in agriculture specializing in vegetables. He says he has been doing this almost all his life. He has a farm where he has planted different vegetables and tubers. At the moment, the products he has at his farm are tomatoes and potatoes. Right now, he wants to request a loan for ¢650,000 (six hundred fifty thousand colónes) to buy different foods and fertilizers, and to hire a farmhand, since it is very difficult to get everything done himself. With this he hopes that the harvest will be big and of good quality; he also wishes that his business will grow and help him to succeed in generating income to improve his standard of living. Eddy belongs to Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. He has received 5 small loans and has repayed them responsibly. He says that, thanks to these loans, he has been able to better develop himself and grow as a person. He also feels very happy that he has been able to provide his young daughters with the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing  consumables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary started selling fish six years ago in her neighborhood. She takes delivery of fishes from Yeji, in the eastern region of Ghana. Because she stocks tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. Mary is 46 years old, married, and she has six children. She is currently taking care of four children who are in school; the other two are working. 

Mary plans to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make more sales and income to support her children’s education and to grow her business. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more assorted fish

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen S. is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and two daughters in the central part of Mongolia, in the province of Arkhangai.  He started his business in 2005 with 800,000 (~$555) tugrugs. He buys clothes in Ereen, a Chinese border city, and sells them at a market stand. The business is growing sustainably and his working capital is now 1,500,000 (~$1040) tugrugs. 

With his business profits, he bought a traditional small house with a yard. In addition to his market stand and he is doing a mobile trade. Therefore, he is planning to buy a car for the business in the future. His ultimate goal is to help his children to get a better education. He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 ($1525) tugrugs to bring more and different types of clothes from Ereen.

loans.use: To purchase more types of apparel

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is a 39-year-old business owner. She is married to Armando, age 41, and has one son and one daughter. She lives in the busy town of Jala-jala in the Rizal Province of the Philippines.  She is the living picture of a mother whose dream it is to give her children a decent life.

Alma joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2001 with dreams of acquiring capital for her planned reseller business. She has been in the reseller business for nine years now.  It brings her enough earnings and continues to grow and she wants to further invest in her business.

Alma proposes an amount of 45,000 pesos for her 9th loan to use as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 15 sacks of commercial rice, sacks of rice grains, and sacks of charcoal all for resale.  She dreams of expanding her business. She also aspires of having a personal restaurant and a car for service. Also to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy for rice and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda de productos comestibles, donde vende todos los días con una atención muy esmerada en sus clientes. En algunas oportunidades su madre la apoya con las ventas cuando Sofía tiene que salir. Y debido al buen trato y a los precios cómodos que ofrece ha notado el incremento de su clientela, es por eso que para el futuro desea seguir implementando su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y el dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Sofía is 33 years old, and lives with her partner in a rented house. For 5 years she has had a grocery store, where she sells every day with very careful attention to her customers. At times, her mother helps her with the store when Sofia is not able to be there. Because of the good deals and low prices that she offers, she has noticed growth in her clientele. For this reason she wishes to continue improving her store and offering a greater variety of products. This is her 5th loan with MFP and the money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Victoria es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Victoria se dedica a procesar cereales, en maíz pelado, trigo pelado, harina de trigo, quinua lavada, actividad que realiza en su casa.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tengan un negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been selling generic medicines for four years. She purchases her products at RTL, located in Ilagan, Isabela. She sells her products in her village with a higher price for her to earn an income. According to her, she needs additional capital to further expand her business. She believes that the more capital she has, the more income she will gain that is why she wants to borrow a loan of Php13,000 to be used as additional capital for her to expand her generic medicine vending.


At the age of 59, Josefina is still working hard. She sees her business as a hobby. She lives in the village of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela together with her husband and two children. Four of their children now have their own families. Josefina hopes for their good health and a peaceful life.

loans.use: Additional capital to further expand her generic medicines vending

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina Q. is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sabrina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fish. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Sabrina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sabrina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase fish for sale. Sabrina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fish for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar C. est âgé de 35 ans marié et père de deux enfants. Il habite dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Kaboïla I- Kélétiguila, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Boubacar, après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, décide de s’installer dans le commerce de l’habillements depuis maintenant six ans.
 Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter ce premier prêt individuel afin d’augmenter son fonds propre. 
Il compte acheter avec ce premier prêt, 5 paires de chaussures “Ferardine”, 3 complets de vestes “Abacos”, 4 paires de souliers, une douzaine de ceintures, 6 pantalons de qualité différentes, 8 chemises différentes etc. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (auprès des grossistes) et effectue ses ventes essentiellement de façon ambulante entre les différentes structures professionnelles étatiques et privées de la ville de Sikasso.
Ce présent prêt lui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice de 80 000 FCFA qui servira à augmenter son fonds de commerce, honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar C. is 35 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in a polygamous family in the Kaboïla I- Kélétiguila district, the downtown of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses unsuccessfully, he decided to settle on commerce in clothing six years ago. Given the increase in customers and the fact his own resources are not able to meet their expectations, he thought it useful to come to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to request this first individual loan, so as to augment his own funds. He intends to use his first loan to purchase 5 pairs of “Ferardine” shoes, 3 “Abacos” suits with jackets, 4 pairs of basic shoes, a dozen belts, 6 pants of different grades, 8 different shirts, etc. He supplies himself in Bamako (from wholesalers), and he makes his sales essentially door-to-door among various professional organizations both governmental and private, in Sikasso City. The current loan will enable him to realize a profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to augment his working capital, to honor his commitments with regard to Soro Yiriwaso, and to cover additional family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish in large quantity for her business.

loans.name: Douglas Shukuru

texts.en: Douglas Shukuru K. runs Deltech Electronics where he repairs and installs electronics and has charged batteries for churches and walk-in customers for the last 10 years.  He has one employee and does face business challenges from lack of funds and new spare parts.  He will be using the proceeds of a KES60,000 loan to add more stock of new electronics.  Douglas' goal is to open other outlets.  He is married and has six children ranging from 9 months to 19 years. Douglas describes himself as dedicated to his work.

loans.use: To add electronics stock

loans.name: Mrs. Sengly Tun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of eleven members who are located in Chek village, Kandal province. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Sengly T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a laborer in a garment factory while her husband, Mr. Veany Nam, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Currently, her husband’s field has infertile soil. Therefore, Mrs. Sengly T. has decided to ask for a third loan to buy both fertilizers and rice seed. The couple has two children who are too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Anais

texts.es:
Anais, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
La librería que con mucho sacrificio ha puesto Anais, se ha convertido en una de las principales de su barrio, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales saben que pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan, pues además de librería también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, lo cual le da una ventaja sobre su competencia. Todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para atender, ya que sabe que mientras más horas atienda, más ganancias obtendrá.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche en su negocio.
Con el tiempo, desea arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda para poder brindarles a sus clientes una mejor atención.

Este es el primer préstamo de Anais con MFP y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su librería.
texts.en:
Anais, 19, is a hard-working, sincere young woman, who lives with her parents and is willing to work hard in order to improve her quality of life. Anais has set up a bookstore, which has become one of the main ones in her neighborhood, because she has many customers who know they will be able to find everything they need. In addition, the bookstore also offers photocopying services, which gives her an edge over her competitors. She rises very early every day to tend to her shop because she knows that, the more hours she's open, the higher her earnings will be. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers; this makes the long work days go by pleasantly. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and she considers the most difficult part of it to be having to stay open until very late at night. In time, she would like to improve her shop's infrastructure so that she can offer better customer service. This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to work very hard to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank and she's always well aware of the agreements reached by the group. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more stock items for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her bookstore.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malick T. est un jeune chauffeur de 32 ans qui a exerce ce métier depuis plus de 5 ans. Mais il évolue  aussi dans le domaine de l’aviculture depuis 2004 pour maximiser ses gains et diversifier ses sources de revenu. Il ne dispose pas de son propre taxi  mais il travaille en collaboration d’un propriétaire qui lui cède  par moment son véhicule. Le choix de son métier a été influence par les conseils de son frère chauffeur. Il habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou et est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff seulement depuis Aout 2009.
Il est marie et père d’un enfant âgé d’un an 3 mois. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’aspect lucratif car avec la réalisation de profits il parvient à entretenir sa famille et améliorer le cadre de vie avec l’acquisition d’un prêt qui pourra augmenter ses possibilités d’investissement.
Par conséquent il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs pour renouveler  ses poussins et renforcer son activité d’aviculture
texts.en:
Malick T. is 32 years old, and has been a taxi driver for the past five years. Since 2004, he has also gotten involved in poultry farming, to maximize earnings and diversify his sources of income. He doesn’t own a vehicle, but works in cooperation with a taxi owner who lets him use it occasionally. His choice of business was influenced by his brother, himself a taxi driver. He lives in the Ngaporou neighborhood and became a member of the Yoff branch of U-IMCEC in August 2009. He is married and father of one child. He is most interested in the lucrative aspects of his activities, since by realizing profits he is able to support his family and improve their living conditions. A loan will increase his investment capabilities, which is why he is requesting a loan for 200,000 Francs, to renew his supply of chicks and bolster his poultry business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Dellys Andrea

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús lo conforman un grupo de mujeres muy alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan en el día a día la superación personal, familiar y en sus  trabajos siempre con optimismo  y visión de un mejor presente y futuro para todos los miembros de sus  familias, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca tercera  más importante del Ecuador ubicada en la región centro sur del país que goza de clima frío permitiendo a su población dedicarse al cultivo de diferentes frutas y verduras  para abastecer tanto su mercado local como para el resto del país.  
 

Para nuestra socia  Dellys V. fue de gran ayuda formar parte del banco comunal por los creditos recibidos  que le permitieron estabilizarse económocamente y ésto fue gracias a su amiga otra socia del banco que la invito a formar parte del mismo, ella es una socia que cautiva por su carisma y amabilidad vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca por la vía a Nulti  con su pareja en  unión libre  y su única hija de 14 años, su  esposo trabaja en su propio taller de mecánica industrial  ubicado en su casa propia ahorrandose el gasto de arriendo.

Dellys es comerciante de ropa y  calzado, lleva varios años en esta actividad recorriendo  todos los pueblos de la ciudad de lunes a viernes y sobre todo los días feriados, gracias  a su trabajo tiene  muchos conocidos y clientes fijos a quienes les deja a crédito su mercadería.  Nos comenta que se encuentra dos años trabajando con  los préstamos obtenidos junto a su banco comunal y con el dinero del credito solicitado va a comprar pantalones, camisas, sacos, blusas, calzado deportivo y casual para damas, caballeros y niños para ofrecer un stock surtido para su exigente clientela e incrementar su negocio.

Tiene como  meta terminar  de construir su casa ya que le faltan algunos acabados.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús communal bank is made up of cheerful, hard-working, charismatic women, who daily seek to become better both as individuals and as workers, always with optimism and a view toward a better present and future for their families. This bank is in the city of Cuenca, Ecuador’s third most important. Cuenca is located in the south-central part of the country and its climate is cold, which permits its inhabitants to farm various fruits and vegetables both for the local market and for the rest of the country. To be part of the communal bank was a great help to our member, Dellys V., because of the loans received that helped her to stabilize economically. This was thanks to her friend who, as another member of the bank, invited her to become a member. She is a member that enchants other with her charisma and kindness. She lives in Cuenca’s outskirts, along Vía a Nulti, with her life partner and their only, 14-year-old daughter. Her husband has his own machine shop that is located in their home, thus saving on rental costs. Dellys is a clothing and footwear merchant; she has been in this line of work for several years. She goes to all the city’s neighborhoods from Monday through Friday but especially on holidays. Thanks to her work, she has many acquaintances and regular customers to whom she sells her merchandise on credit. She relates to us that she has worked with communal bank loans for two years now. She will use the funds requested on this occasion to buy pants, shirts, coats, blouses, sports and casual shoes for women, men and children so that she can have a varied stock available for her demanding customers, thereby increasing her business. Her goal is to finish building her house because it’s still lacking a few finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, coats, blouses, sports and casual shoes for the entire family.

loans.name: Diotilia

texts.es:
La señora DIOTILIA A. I. tiene 50 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios superiores hasta 5to de Secundaria, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia  se dedica a la confección y venta de calzado para damas como: sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas. Para la confección de este calzado ella utiliza insumos como: cuero, cuerina, plantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, suelas, etc., ella compra estos productos al por mayor en  el distrito del porvenir y cuando  finalmente tiene listo el calzado viaja a las ciudades de CHIMBOTE, HUARAZ, HUARMEY Y CHICLAYO a venderlos, ella refiere que prefiere vender el calzado fuera de Trujillo porque actualmente hay mucha competencia y las ventas han bajado.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de insumos como: pegamento, plantillas, hilo, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 250.00 nuevos lo utilizará para la compra de plantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, suelas, etc.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas, ahorrar y empezar a fabricar y vender zapatillas.
texts.en:
Diotilia is 50 years old and lives in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is the single mother of three children, one of whom depends on her for support. She manufactures and sells ladies footwear, such as sandals, shoes, and slippers. She uses materials such as leather, insoles, glue, thread, buckles, soles, etc… She buys these items mostly in the “Porvenir” district. When she has made her shoes, she travels to the cities of Chimbote, Huaraz, Huarmey, and Chiclayo to sell. She admits that she prefers to sell away from Trujillo because there is a lot of competition there now and her sales have dropped. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy supplies, such as glue, insoles, thread, etc. She will use the money from this loan of 250 PEN ($100) to buy more insoles, glue, thread, buckles, soles, etc. She hopes to increase her sales, save some money, and begin making and selling slippers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe making supplies

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group 2, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Teo, shown at the bottom right in the small photo, also appears in the group photo as the group leader. She is a veteran local brew seller with monthly cash inflow estimates bordering close to 200,000 shillings a month. With an experienced business resumé spanning over twenty years, Teo’s confidence has skyrocketed despite the disparaging nature of her business.

Meet 50-year-old Teo. She is a married woman with thirteen children of her own and five dependents, all under her support.

The continual price fluctuations in the local brew products that Teo sells in Lutengo, Mukono district, have often negatively affected her financial gains. This happens most especially when the prices increase. Despite this, her level of optimism has not plummeted at all. Instead she is one woman who takes a long view of things.

As such, Teo has drawn up future plans to make her business grow to an even bigger magnitude than it is now. Her thoughts for now, though, are focused on obtaining this loan to help her reinvest in this project.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans (containers) and brewing materials

loans.name: Bernarda Del Carmen

texts.es:
doña Bernarda P. es muy conocida en su comunidad y es un ejemplo para su familia. Tiene 58 años de edad, esta viuda y tuvo 9 hijos de los cuales ya todos estan adultos, casados y en sus respectivos hogares.
desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de las marcas avon, jackelin karol entre otras.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cosmeticos de otras marcas que los clientes le estan solicitando, en la actualidad con las compañias que trabaja le dan credito de un mes, pero ya con las nuevas que quiere ingresar tiene que comprar de contado. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Bernarda P. is well-known in her neighborhood and an example for her family. She is 58 years old, widowed and has 9 children who are all adults, married and living in their own homes. She has sold Avon, Jackelin, Karol cosmetics, among others, for the last 23 years. She will use the funds to buy other brands of cosmetics that her customers are asking for. The companies she works with now give her one month credit but the new ones she wants to start working with insist on cash. She needs the profits from her sales to meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, perfume, deodorant, nail polish, lipstick and eye liner.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Ramirez es propietario del Taller Mecanico V y R especializado en motos, cuenta con el respaldo de la marca TAIGA en Villa Hayes, es soltero, cuenta con más de cuatro años de experiencia, también hace trabajos de gomería y auxilio las 24 Hs.
El aprendio esta profesión ya que le gusta mucho desde muy joven. 
Cuenta con un personal que trabaja a destajo con el en taller.
El trabaja y le ayuda muchisimo a su familia.
El mismo solicitó nuestra asistencia financiera para la compra de repuestos para motos porque desea ampliar su negocio a venta de repuestos para motos.
texts.en:
Miguel Ramirez owns the V and R Mechanic’s Garage, which specializes in TAIGA brand motorcycles. The garage is in Villa Hayes. He is single. He has over four years of experience. He also fixes tires and provides 24 hour assistance. He learned this profession, which he really likes, when he was very young. He has people who do piecework with him in the garage. He works and helps his family a lot. He asked for our financial assistance in order to buy motorcycle replacement parts because he wishes to expand his business to sell motorcycle replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motorcycle replacement parts to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol  C. is 30 years old and lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns 1.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. 

To supporting her farm crop, Mrs. Thol  C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed, and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. 

Her husband, Mr. Mom Toem, is a construction worker and also a farming laborer so he can receive a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children, who all are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed, and to pay a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo tiene 46 años, esta casado con la señora Antoliana Areco Aquino desde hace 20 años, tienen 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años.
Leonardo anteriormente era el encargado del mantenimiento del jardín de una empresa del estado. Así fue que en un momento dado decidió alquilar un terreno para poder plantar algunas semillas de plantitas de jardín, una vez que las mismas crecían  quería comercializarlas en  la empresa donde trabajaba.
Hace 9 años aproximadamente decidió salir de la empresa y dedicarse de lleno al vivero donde le lleva todo el tiempo tanto a él como toda su familia.
Leonardo lo que mas anhela es seguir ampliando su vivero y también mediante sus ingreso sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
46-year old Leonardo has been married to Sra. Antoliana Areco Aquino for twenty years. They have three children aged 19, 17, and 15 years. Leonardo used to be in charge of the gardens at a state enterprise. Then one day he decided to rent a piece of land and sow garden plant seeds. Once they had grown, he would sell them to the business where he was working. Approximately nine years ago he decided to leave the business and devote himself full-time to the plant nursery. Leonardo and his whole family now work there all the time. His greatest wish is to continue expanding the nursery and also to have enough money for his children to finish university.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for his plant nursery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy zinc, nails, wood, and pay for  labor

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 45 años D. edad resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, es casada vive con el esposo y tiene dos hijos D. las edades de15y 14 años, tiene una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Hace dos años inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, los hijos le ayudan a vender,  y el esposo trabaja en agricultura, Zoila regularmente atienD. el negocio en horario D. 6:00am-7:00pm, le va muy bien en las ventas, pero se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar un préstamo que le permita adquirir productos como son: aceite, café, azúcar, leche en polvo, frijoles, arroz y otros productos que le demandan los clientes.
Las aspiraciones D. Zoila son Ampliar el negocio, apoyar a los hijos, mejorar las condiciones económicas D. la familia,
texts.en:
Zoila is 45 years old and lives in Concepción Batres, within the Usulután department. She is married, lives with her husband and has two children, ages 15 and 14. She has a store where she sells basic needs products and started her business two years ago and on her own initiative. Her children would help her to sell and her husband worked in agriculture. Zoila normally attends to business from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. Her sales have been doing well, but she has seen the need to request a loan so that she can buy items such as: cooking oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, beans, rice, and other products that her requested by her customers. Her aspirations are to expand her business, support her children, and improve her family’s economic status.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Assiba Félicité

texts.fr: A. Assiba Félicité est née le 21 octobre 1976 à Covè au Bénin. Mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Félicité est mariée à DJOSSA Mathieu un électricien bâtiment. Félicié vit avec son mari et ses enfants depuis près de six ans à Womey un quartier dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Félicité a fréquenté l'école et a fait les cours secondaires. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Félicité exerce comme activité principale la vente de fruits, d'arachide, de biscuits et bombons et quelques boites de conserves. Félicité s'approvisionne au grand marché international du Bénin Dantokpa et revend ses produits à domicile. Félicité avait déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son commerce et satisfaire sa clientèle Félicité sollicite un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Assiba Félicité A. was born on October 21, 1976 in Covè, Benin. The mother of three children attending school, Félicité is married to Mathieu Djossa, a building electrician. She has lived with her husband and children in the Womey neighborhood of Abomey Calavi for about six years. Félicité went to school and completed secondary courses, and the couple pays the family’s expenses together. Félicité’s primary business is the sale of fruits, peanuts, cookies and candies, and some canned goods. She buys her stock in Benin’s large international market, Dantokpa, and resells her products at home. She has already obtained three loans through ALIDé, all of which have been repaid in full. With the goal of growing her business and satisfying her customers, Félicité is requesting a new loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bags of oranges, 10 boxes of biscuits, and 5 cartons of milk

loans.name: Petita Marivel

texts.en:
Petita Marivel M. C. is 40 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. Petita has 2 children who are 14 and four years old.

Petita is a member of the rural loan group San Jose del Eden. The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Petita works in agriculture and raises pigs. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Petita plans to use the loan to grow corn and cacao. With the help of the loan, she hopes to become more productive in her agricultural production. Her goal within the next 5 years is to have her own house. 

When she is not working, she spends time in the house doing domestic chores.

loans.use: To grow corn and cacao

loans.name: Veronika Vine

texts.en:
Veronika Vine B. is 22 and married with 1 child.  She is starting a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $162 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2010, Veronika Vine joined SPBD, and this is her 1st loan with them. SPBD's loans are Veronika Vine's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria I. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing  business.  She lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daanlungsod, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. Maria is now borrowing PHP 12000 so that she can purchase fishing materials. 

This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana es una pequeña comerciante, mujer trabajadora que ha logrado poner su propio negocio. Un comedor en donde hace una variedad de comida. Casada con tres hijos.
Iniciando con poco dinero y propio solo con la venta de refrescos, en frente de su casa. Toma la iniciativa ya que enfrente de su casa hay una empresa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para vende comida y arreglar el local. Y busca la alternativa por medio del financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde logro invertir en el comedor.
Hoy con este  préstamo comprara: granos básicos, carnes pollo, frutas, verduras para aumentar en la elaboración de más platillos variados. Contenta porque ah alcanzado que su negocio este solido lo que ayuda más a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a small business owner. She is a hard-working woman who has managed to open her own business, a small restaurant where a variety of foods are available. She is married and has three children.

She started her business with little money and only sold soft drinks in front of her house. She took the initiative since there was a business opposite her house. However, she did not have enough money to sell food and straighten-up the area. She found an alternative by getting a loan with Afodenic and she is able to invest money in her business.

With this loan, she will buy staple grains, meats, chicken, fruits and vegetables to use in the preparation of a greater variety of meals. She is pleased because she is able to make her business more sound so that she can help her family more.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, chicken, meat, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks with the objective of making a greater variety of dishes

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es: La Señora Ana tiene un internet en la casa de su suegro, tiene once computadoras,  se turnan con el esposo para atender el internet, desde hace un año y medio, trabaja junto con su esposo, vive en casa familiar y por el momento no pagan alquiler, son un apareja joven y muy trabajadora, este crédito es para construir  su vivienda en su terreno que tienen en la misma zona, todavía no tiene hijos, pero desean agrandar la familia una ves que terminen su casita esos dos son sus deseos mas grandes de la Sra. Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ana has an internet café in her father-in-law’s house.  She has eleven computers and takes turns with her husband attending to the business.  She has worked with her husband for a year and a half, and lives in a relative’s house and doesn’t pay rent at the moment.  They are a young and very hardworking couple.  This loan is to build their home on a piece of land that they have in the same area.  They don’t have any children yet, but they want to make their family larger once they finish their house.  These are Ana’s two biggest dreams and she is very appreciative of the lending institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
DORILA I. P.
La señora Dorila socia del banco comunal Pan de Vida. Del distrito de Manantay  departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años, 4 hijos uno independiente y  tres menores a su cargo, su esposo es empleado público.
La señora Dorila lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de  Manuela Ramos, anteriormente ha estado criando pollos. Actualmente tiene una bodega en su casa, al cual se dedica todo el día que también le permite atender a sus hijos menores.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de  S/. 1,500.00 soles,  lo invertirá en la compra de: 1 caja de  aceite, 1 paquete de sal, 2 cajas de galleta soda, 1 caja de galleta vainilla, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 caja de leche grande, condimentos, ½  bolsa de lejía, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 3 casilleros de huevo, 10 kilos de papas, 3 kg de cebolla, 1 kg de ajos, 3 kg de tomate.
 La señora Dorila con su negocio más el sueldo de su esposo les alcanza para seguir educando a sus hijos y pagar sus servicios básicos, por eso esta más que agradecida con Manuela Ramos y espera que sigan apoyando a todas las mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
DORILA I. P.
Sra. Dorila, 50, is a member of the Pan de Vida community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She has 4 grown children, who are independent, and 3 younger children, who still live at home.  Her husband is a public-sector worker.  Sra. Dorila has been a client of Manuela Ramos for 4 years.  Before that, she operated a business raising chickens.  Now she has a corner grocery that she operates from her house, a business that allows her to both earn an income and still take care of her younger children.  With this S/.1,500 [1,500 Peruvian soles] loan, she will buy bulk supplies of: cooking oil, salt, soda crackers, vanilla crackers, rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, condiments, bleach, candy, eggs, potatoes, onions, garlic and tomatoes.  The earnings from Sra. Dorila's business, combined with her husband's income, just stretches to pay for their kid's schooling and their everyday living expenses.  She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support of her business and she hopes that the bank will go on supporting the women who need these loans.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
El Señor Román P. es oriundo de la Compañía Rincón Guazú, trabaja en el negocio de la elaboración de ladrillos hace cuestión de 14 años, con el correr de los años el trapiche(aparato donde se mezclan el lodo para la fabricación de ladrillos), se  va desgastando  por lo que hace falta su refacción.

El Sr. Román P. en vista a que no disponía de recursos económicos para dicha refacción recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para la solicitud de un crédito.

Agradece a nuestra entidad el apoyo y la confianza depositada en él ya que con eso pudo arreglar su trapiche y el horno ademas de comprar leñas para seguir elaborando los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Mr. Román P. is a native of the city of Ybycuí of Compañía Rincón Guazú.  He has worked in the brick-making business for around 14 years. With the passing of time, the mill (the aparatus where the mud is mixed for making bricks), became worn out and needed to be refurbished.  

In light of the fact that Mr. P. did not have the economic resources for the refurbishment, he visited the Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan. 

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support and the confidence given to him, because with this he was able to fix his mill and his oven. He also bought firewood to continue making bricks.

loans.use: Buy raw materials and refurbish oven

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a father of four children, aged between eighteen and six years old. He has been doing mixed farming for over ten years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. His produce of vegetables, onions and tomatoes are sold to the local markets, especially hotels. He has employed two farmhands.

He has requested for this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He aims at taking his children to the best schools within the area with the income generated from his dairy business. He also wants to change dairy cow breeds for better production. 

Patrick says a lot of their milk products go to waste due to a poor road network, which delays delivery, hence spoilage. He is thankful to Juhudi for this asset-financing project.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and insurance

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold L. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family have been living at their current address together in their own 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence for the past 2 years. Ganbold owns and operates his own shoe repair business with help of his wife. 

He worked as a shoemaker at the local factory between 1988 and 1990 and after  the factory closed, he worked in a local company till 2004. He began his shoe repair business in 2004 out of small pavilion at the local market. In 2006, his wife graduated from vocational training as a traditional Mongolian shoemaker and started to produce a variety of traditional boots to supplement their earnings. 

Ganbold is a modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to repair his workplace and buy more repair supplies and tools for his shoe making and repair business.

loans.use: To buy more repair supplies and tools

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus  avec FATOUMATA T., la restauration, les boissons non alcoolisées etc . 
FATOUMATA T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 pagnes de tissus wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) . Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of this DANAYA group are married and have an average age of 40 with, on average, three children. They live in monogamous families in Medine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their eleventh loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, aimed at satisfying their clientele. Their previous loans were reimbursed in a timely manner. This group of women sell cloth, as does Fatoumata T., or sell cooked foods, non-alcoholic drinks, etc. 

FATOUMATA T.  intends to buy 50 lengths of good quality African print cloth ("pagnes") with her loan. She does her buying at the big marketplace in Sikasso and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The lengths of cloth are resold at the markets of Medine, Sikasso, and to family members, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which will be used for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: purchasing cloth

loans.name: Yuris Mabel

texts.es:
Yuris, de 21 años de edad, reside en Yoloaiquin departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, pues desde niña le ayudaba a su madre a preparar refrescos y venderlos así que hoy que tiene su propio hogar no se le hiso difícil encontrar un negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su venta la realiza en los buses y carros que viajan con personas con un horario de 9:00am  a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo el cual utilizara para la compra de materiales para refrescos como frutas, bolsas plásticas, azúcar, comprara también gatorade, sodas y agua, también utilizara una parte para pagar un abogado que le ayude a escriturar la casa donde vive actualmente.
Con este préstamo se beneficiara doblemente por una parte su negocio con la inversión, en lo personal pues podrá comenzar el proceso de escrituración para tener más seguridad del ligar donde reside, Su sueño es ver a su hijo crecer sano y poder darle lo mejor para que se desarrolle correctamente, también tiene la esperanza de seguir con el trabajo en busca de crecimiento económico.
texts.en:
Yuris, age 21, lives in Yoloaiquin in the Morazan department with her husband and one-year-old child. She sells drinks, since she helped her mother to prepare and sell drinks as a child. Now that she has her own home, it was not hard for her to find a business to help her husband with the household costs. She makes her sales to buses and cars which travel between 9:00 am and 5:00 pm.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for drinks, such as fruits, plastic bags, and sugar. She will also purchase Gatorade, sodas and water. She will also use part of the loan to pay a lawyer to help her to register the home where she currently lives.

This loan will benefit her twice; on one hand, the investment will help her business. On the personal level, she will be able to start the registration process in order to have more security in her home.

Her dream is to see her child grow healthily, and to be able to give him the best for his proper development. She also hopes to continue working in search of economic growth.

loans.use: the purchase of drinks and ingredients for natural drinks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Grace has a mobile business selling cosmetics, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business by means of a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor is the responsible father of two children. From the time he was a young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Abdujabor hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, he is requesting the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To invest capital in young animals in order to expand his business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 52 años, es casada tiene 3 hijos.
Laura solicita un crédito de S/. 2000.00
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar materiales como: telas diversas, hilos, agujas forros entre otros.
Laura y su esposo tiene una sastrería hace más de 10 años,  donde confeccionan: uniformes escolares, institucionales, ternos, pantalones , faldas.  Laura está en Finca Perú 4 ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos, las capacitaciones que reciben en la familia matrimonio, negocio, empresarial, que lo pone en práctica en su vida diaria. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y poder abrir una boutique.
texts.en:
Laura is a 52-year-old married mother of three. She is requesting a 2,000.00 PEN loan. She is requesting this loan to invest it in purchasing materials like different types of fabric, thread, needles, lining, and other products.

For over 10 years, Laura and her husband have owned a tailor's shop in which they make school and company uniforms, suits, pants, and skirts. Laura has been a member of Finca Perú for 4 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining a loan, and the family/marriage, and business classes that she receives, which she puts to practice in her daily life. Her dream is for her business to keep expanding and to be able to open up a boutique.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan Alberto is married and has two children. He works as a tailor in the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has been working in the business for the past 15 years. He started out in this line of work as a sewing machine operator. His wife currently works at home raising their children and caring for their home. 

Juan is requesting a loan to purchase sewing machines to help grow his business. He hopes that these machines will allow him to sew more clothing and increase his revenues. He hopes to one day run a larger business which will help his family live a better life. This is Juan´s first loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: purchase sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: Francisca Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que además de cuidar a sus hijos y su hogar también se  dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, nos cuenta que ella compra los animalitos, los tiene por un espacio de tiempo suficiente hasta que estén listos y luego  vende los chanchos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y los pollos los vende enteros o por libras  a personas de la localidad o entrega en tiendas en Santa Ana.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos como para los chanchos. Está en el Banco comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
  
Su sueño es tener una granja con tecnología.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana. This city is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

Here we met Francisca who is 39 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage who are in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who, in addition to looking after her children and the house, works raising chickens and pigs. She tells us that she buys the animals, keeps them until they are ready, and then sells the pigs to merchants that come to her house and sells the chickens whole or by the pound to people in the area or to stores in Santa Ana.

This loan is for the purchase of more chickens, feed, and medicines for the chickens as well as the pigs. She has been with the bank almost since the beginning and she likes the benefits provided by the institution.

Her dream is to have a farm with technology.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicines for chickens and pigs

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: José tiene 56 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive en casa de familia junto a sus padres ancianos en el distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el norte de Perú. Reside en la parte rural de su distrito y tiene los servicios básicos de agua y luz. José gana la vida prestando servicios de internet dentro de su vivienda. Cuenta con 04 máquinas. Esta actividad le permite sobrevivir  y cuidar a sus padres ancianos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio. El destino del crédito será para la adquisición de mercadería como golosinas y gaseosas para ser ofrecidos dentro de su negocio a sus usuarios. Eso le permitirá obtener otros ingresos para su subsistencia. Para lograr esta meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: José is 56 years old and single with no children. He lives in his family home with his elderly parents in the district of Reque, an area located twenty minutes from the city of  Chiclayo in the north of Perú. He lives in the rural part of his district and he has the basic services such as running water and electricity. José makes his living offering internet service in his home. He has 4 computers. This activity allows him to survive and take care of his elderly parents. He has had this business for more than 3 years. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise such as candies and soft drinks to offer to users of his business. This will allow him to obtain more income for his subsistence. To acheive this goal, he has decided to ask for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as candies and soft drinks to sell in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Florence has a poultry firm, which she has had for less than one year. To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more poultry feed and chickens for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Florence hopes to build a house.

Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling self-employment.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry feed and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Erlita

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 36 años de edad tiene con un hijo a cargo.  Vive en casa de sus familiares, en una zona rural de Pacasmayo

Carmen hace mas de 10 años se ha logrado establecer en un mercado de abastos de la localidad donde vive  en un puesto de venta de verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad . Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia,. El negocio de Carmen  siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 



Carmen está solicitando un préstamo a edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que puedan comprar  más mercadería y posteriormente venderla en en su establecimiento.

 Carmen  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le concern le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and has a dependent child.  She lives in her family's home in the rural area of Pacasmayo.   

Ten years ago Carmen established a vegetable stand in the food market where she lives.  She buys her merchandise at the wholesale market in the city and every day she has a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers to offer her customers.  This business is an important source of income for her family.  Carmen's customers prefer her business because of her friendly service.    

Carmen is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] so that she can buy more merchandise for her business.

Carmen is a very hard-working woman of good character.  Those who know her have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Zaitoon's Group

texts.en:
Zaitoon is 43 years old, married and has a son. Zaitoon couldn’t educate her son due to financial constraints. He helps his father run a shoe making business. Both are very hard workers. They take orders from different shoe shops and fulfill their orders on time to make profits. 

Zaitoon is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a caring and responsible person by nature. She manages her household expenses very responsibly. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With the loan, he will buy required items such as nails, glue, leather and shoe polish in bulk to be able to make a larger quantity of shoes and earn more profits. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Zaitoon is very hopeful that a loan will bring more profits to him and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy items required for the shoe-making business

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She cooks food such as "fufu" with palmnut soup and "banku" with okra soup.  She has been in the food business for 10 years and uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Nyame will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nyame plans to build a food stall.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old and married to Elizabeth. The couple has five children. For the past two years, George has been selling shoes in Olkalou town. 

George was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell at his place. In the future, George hopes to grow his business, move into a more permanent location, and be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Fokaben V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Fokaben V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le haricot, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI, assise à droite,  compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de riz..
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Fokaben V group are married women, on average 31 years old with 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, small millet, beans, rice, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Sali, sitting on the right in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour (hoeing) costs to manage about 0.9 hectares of rice crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average profit of about 75,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa earns her living by processing and selling "gari," a Ghanaian staple. Gari is a type of flour made from cassava and is a starchy food that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families in Ghana. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak gari mix with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines. Families also eat gari for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that are mostly accompanied with gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can also be used to accompany gari, such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, or tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with gari depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces.

To prepare the gari, Adjoa obtains raw, fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas, then sends them to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process is completed, she stir-fries the gari in a pan on fire. The gari is then left to cool and finally bagged into small bags that are then offered for sale. Adjoa sells her wares at the Abura market.

Adjoa and her husband, who is a farmer, have eight children. 

Adjoa has been selling gari for 15 years. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to be processed into gari. She plans to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land. 

In the picture above, Adjoa is shown sitting near the bags of dough to be used for preparing gari.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to be processed into gari.

loans.name: Maria Estefania

texts.es:
Maria tiene 20 anos actualmente vive en Otavalo con sus padres es soltera y no tiene hijos, es totalmente feliz y muy sonadora.

Trabaja en una tienda hace un ano empezo a trabajar con sus padres y lo sigue haciendo, el prestamo que requiere es para abastecer a su tienda con viveres, es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI lo esta haciendo por un tiempo de 10 meses, el prestamo le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos y entre sus principales suenos esta el de tener otros negocios y poder acabar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old now and still lives with her parents in Otavalo. She is single, has no children, and is totally happy, and very much the dreamer. 

Maria has worked in her store for a year now. She began working with her parents and still does so. The loan she needs is to resupply her store with groceries. This is the 2nd time she has collaborated with FODEMI. The time period involved is 10 months. The loan will help her increase her income.

Among her principal dreams is to have other stores and to be able to complete her studies.

loans.use: supply her general store with groceries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Nancy has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, & underwear. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the same type of clothing for resale.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts & blouses for resale

loans.name: Dangely Mabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dangely, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  6, 4 y 1 año  de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo esta en el extranjero trabajando.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y a la elaboración y venta  de bisutería de todos los modelos y variedades, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque por el momento que sus hijos están pequeños mas vende en su  casa al mismo tiempo que elabora sus obras, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan pedidos ya que en varias ocasiones su esposo le trae o le manda mercadería de los Estados Unidos donde él vive. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien a pesar de que tiene sus hijos pequeños que le impiden ir a otros lados a vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y material para elaborar bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años  y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es tener un local grande y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The Women's Union Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, known as "Calceta, a city without equal" for the beauty of the women and because to its inhabitants there is not a more beautiful city in the world. 

This is where Mrs. Dangely lives. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, 6, 4, and 1 respectively. Her husband currently works abroad.

She works selling all types of clothes and makes and sells jewelry of many varieties. She sells door-to-door, though at the moment in order to be with her young children she sells most of her products out of her home. She also makes her jewelry there. Her clients make orders and her husband, who lives in the United States, sends them or brings them when he returns. She allows her clients to buy on credit and charges interest every 15 days. She has been running this business for six  years, and it continues to be successful despite the fact that she has to sell out of her home.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes, and materials for jewelry. She has been a member of the community bank for two years, and she likes the support offered through loans.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked big store.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, and materials for jewelry

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 38 years of age, married, and had been blessed with three children. She has been running her hog raising business for over 21 years. She also sells different kinds of vegetables such as eggplants, string beans, and squash within their village. The daily net profit of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) is just enough to cover the cost of daily meals and allowances for her children. 

Siony is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicine for the pigs vaccination, and also to acquire different kinds of vegetables to sell. She hopes to grow her hog raising business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for the pigs vaccination, and to acquire different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Rey has a shop that buys and sells bananas and fire wood.  He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fire wood for sell.  Rey is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fire wood for sell.

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es: Victoria es integrante de la alcancía comunal "Sagitario" conformado por  siete socias,  todas ellas vecinas ya que viven en el mismo barrio, ellas radican en el distrito de Lurigancho. Un grupo de mujeres optimistas para los negocios y muy empeñosas en salir adelante.  Muestra de ello es la señora Victoria de 40 años de edad, ella  tiene 3 hijos, dos son menores de edad y uno es independiente. Ella hace cuatro años trabaja en el camal (ventas de carnes) como supervisora, tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de cerdos hace ocho años, con  estos dos trabajos le ha generado ingresos modestos y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante y a podido pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos, En el futuro le gustaría  poder tener una tienda propia para la venta de carne. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para la crianza de sus animales
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Sagitario” communal bank which has seven members who are all neighbors living in the same neighborhood in Lurigancho District.   They are a group of women who are optimistic about business and very determined to get ahead.

Victoria, 40, is a clear example of this.  She has three children; two are minors and one is independent.  She’s been working as a supervisor at a butcher shop (meat sales) for four years but also has been working raising pigs for the last eight years.  She has generated modest income with these two activities thanks to which she’s been able to get ahead and provide education for her three children.  In future, she’d like to have her own butcher shop.  She will invest her latest loan to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa de 30 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (cuenta 10 cabezas de ovejas), porcino (8 cerdos) y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  tener mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, lives with her children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is known for farming, raising livestock and crafts.

For the last three years Rosa has been raising sheep (she owns ten head of sheep), pigs (8 pigs) and barnyard fowl.  Her corrals which are appropriate for this are in her back yard.  She feeds her animals nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that they will reach optimum growth and be able to be sold in the various local markets thus obtaining good profits to cover her daily household expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more nutritionally balanced animal feed.  With income she obtains she will be able to repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life.  Rosa is a hardworking, very responsible person.  The only thing she wants is that her children get ahead and to improve economically.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed.

loans.name: Victoria  Maria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria María  se dedica a la  venta  de artesanías   desde hace diez años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque desde chica le gustaba tejer y bordar.
Tiene  cincuenta y seis  años de edad  está felizmente casada  con el señor  Domingo  de sesenta y cuatro años de edad.
Tiene una hija  Mari Cruz de veinte cuatro años de edad, está  muy contenta  porque  gracias a fundación   sus sueños   se están realizando.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar: manta, listón, hilo  de ceda  e hilo de colores.
Uno de  sus sueños es hacer su negocio más grande, seguir trabajando  hasta que ya no pueda  ya que tejer y bordar  es lo que más le gusta.
Lo que más le gusta  de su negocio es la relacionarse con las personas  ya que todas hablan mixteco, tejer, bordar y dibujar en la manta.
Si quisiera  tener otro negocio seria  vender, verdura y comida  en las escuelas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus  sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria Maria has been selling handicrafts for ten years. She enjoys her work very much because she has enjoyed weaving and embroidering since she was a small child. She is 56 years old and happily married to Sr. Domingo who is 64 years old. She has a daughter, Mari Cruz, who is twenty four years of age. She is very happy because, thanks to the Foundation, her dreams are being realized.

She requested a loan to buy cloth, ribbon, silk yarn and colored thread.
