One of her dreams is to have a larger business and to continue working until she no longer can, since weaving and embroidering are what she most enjoys. What she most enjoys about her business is relating to people who all speak Mixteco, weave, embroider and sketch drawings on cloth.

If she wanted to start another business it would be selling vegetables and food to the schools.

She thanks the Foundation for its support in helping her get ahead and fulfill her dreams

loans.use: to buy thread, ribbons and cloth to make housedresses, blouses and huipiles (traditional tunics).

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and blessed with one child. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to increase his income. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. With this loan of 20,000 KES he intends to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, 10 and 13 years old, both in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for one year.

Leila has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 49-year-old widow with three school-age children. Her husband died of severe hypertension. He didn't go to a good hospital because of their financial difficulties. As a result, she has to run the family's farming business in order to provide a living for her three children. Despite the difficulties of farming, she is brave enough to face whatever difficulties she encounters. For her, the most important thing is to provide for her children.

To be able to provide for the family's necessities, she needs financial assistance. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor in her corn field. She knows that abundant crops will allow her to lift her family out of poverty and give them a better standard of living.  

She says "Just believe in our Almighty God and definitely, He will help you with any burden".

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor in her corn field.

loans.name: Marlen Janet

texts.es:
En el Sauce departamento de León, la señora Marlen Janet actualmente se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiante de dicho municipio, desempeñando el cargo de maestra, es una madre soltera donde ha logrado mantenerse en mejores condiciones saludable.  
Actualmente acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para compra de medicina para la salud, ya que esto le permitirá vivir  saludable y en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: In Sauce, the Department of Leon, Marlen Janet currently works as a teacher in this municipality.  Aside from her role as an educator, she is a single mother that has been able to keep herself in healthy shape.  She joined Ceprodel with the objective of seeking a loan to purchase medicine for her health, which will allow her to live healthy and in better condition.

loans.use: purchase medicine.

loans.name: Kim Rong

texts.en:
Kim Rong is a 38-year-old, married woman. She resides with her husband and their four children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

She and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, her husband is a village leader.

Kim Rong is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for use by her family. In the future, she plans to grow mushrooms, build a new house, and support her children so that they can study to receive a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for use by her family

loans.name: Fidèle Chimène

texts.fr: Fidèle,femme dynamique, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle  est coiffeuse de formation et y associe la vente des chaussures, sacs, parfums et tissus. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants pour distribuer aux fonctionnaires dans les sociétés, dans les écoles et le reste est disposé dans une vitrine à son domicile. Compte tenu de son emplacement et en vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de maximiser son profit pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
A loyal and energetic woman, this is a mother of three children. She is a hairdresser by training and includes with her business the sale of shoes, bags, perfumes, and fabrics. She purchases her supplies from surrounding markets and then distributes them to officials in companies and in schools. The rest is placed in a display window of her home. 

Taking into account her location and aiming to satisfy the needs of her customers, she is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev to increase her stock of merchandise and to maximize her profit for the sake of her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 30 assorted fabrics, 20 of perfumes of any brand, 20 shoes of any brand, and other goods.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nadia, de 36  años es una mujer trabajadora; vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Saúl de 39 años y su pequeño hijo Michael de 10 añitos, quien es el motivo de seguir adelante. La tienda de Nadia, es una de las más visitadas; desde tempranas horas de la mañana habré su negocio donde vende materiales de escritorio para todo público en general donde pueden encontrar libros, cuadernos;  entre otros.  Nadia es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y dispuesta a ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes; lleva 06 años en este negocio y dice que para ella no hay nada difícil ya que lo más importante es poder ayudar a los niños en que puedan leer un libro. En su negocio le va muy bien que gracias a ello pudo adquirir muchos bienes. Este es el crédito número 08 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, ya que el apoyo que se brindan es recíproco. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de escritorio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nadia, 36 years old, is a very hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her partner, Saúl, who is 39 years old, and their young son, Michael, who is 10 years old and who is her motivation in life. Nadia’s store is one of the most popular. Early in the morning she opens her business, where she sells stationary supplies for everyone, where people can find books, notebooks, and other items. Nadia is a very cheerful and courteous salesperson who always receives her customers with a smile and is happy to help them with their purchases.

What she most likes about her job is making a good impression on her customers. She has been in this business for 6 years and she says that she doesn’t have any difficulties and that the most important thing is to help children so that they can read a book. Things are going well for her in her business and because of that she has been able to purchase many items. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she pledges to continue making her repayments. Additionally, she is happy with her communal bank because the support they provide each other is reciprocal. With the 1,500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy stationary supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy stationary supplies

loans.name: Kim Thai

texts.en: Kim Thai, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 10 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at the rice mill. He earns about USD 10 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kim Thai is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cattle for resale. By doing so, she would be able to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is a committed member of Life in Africa. She joined Life in Africa in March of this year, where she is earning a liittle money to supplement her income. She is a widowed mother of 5. Her husband passed away in late 2000. Life took a turn for the wose when this unfortunate event happened. All her realtives and in-laws left her all on her own and with 5 children, it was a tug of war to survive.

She and her family had to leave the big house in which they were living before her husband passed on and began to put up in the garage so that, they rented out the larger part of the house so as to get some money to maintain themselves and also be able to send the children to school. However this Income is not enough to meet all of thier needs. Next to the big housae, there is a boys quarter that needs to be renovated so that she can rent it out to earn some money to help her in running her family.

She needs a loan in the amount of 500,000/= to accomplish this. Once this is done, it will go a long way to support her family and also reduce on the school fees pressures she has. Below is her budget:

Bricks 1000pcs @50/= ..........50,000/=
Sand 2 trips ..................100,000/=
Cement 6 bags @18,000/= ......108,000/=
Hardcore ......................50,000/=
Timbers........................ 50,000/=
Doors 2units ....................50,000/=
Labour............................ 80,000/=
Others.............................12,000/=
Total 500,000/=

loans.use: Construction materials and labor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 60 year old woman with eight children. She specializes in sales of baby things to the public. With a loan of $800, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Marguerita

texts.en:
Marguerita M. S. runs her own hardware and crafts store called Ferretería Rosario to support her four children: Maximo, Tobias, Adaela and Miria. They live in a small village called La Pacuala in the province of Samana on the north peninsula of the Dominican Republic. She is applying for this loan to buy more paint, cement and tools. Due to all the construction nearby, Marguerita has found that paint and cement are in high demand. This loan will allow her to replenish her supply to meet that demand.

Marguerita has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Esperanza. She has also gone through Esperanza's business training program where she learned accounting, budgeting marketing and developed a business plan with her loan advisor. Marguerita's advisor meets with her and other microentrepreneurs in her community where they make loan payments and receive ongoing support.

loans.use: Purchase paint, cement and construction tools.

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Muqimjon is 48 years old and is married with three children. He has a secondary education and is unemployed at the moment. His business is the main source of income for his family. A year ago Muqimjon got a loan from Microinvest to process and dry apricots. Once he had repaid the first loan he applied for another loan to open a small shop where he sells an assortment of foodstuffs and soft drinks. Recently Muqimjon has started stocking carpets from a local carpet factory in his shop. Muqimjon is requesting a third loan so that he may further expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
Juventino is a married man with two children. He is a hard-working guy; he and his wife both work to support and educate their children. His wife sells fried snacks and Juventino helps her during weekends when he has free time.

He started his business young, first learning the work as a construction assistant. As time passed he decided to go independent, and is now self-employed. He now has many clients that he has gained through recommendations because of his good work. Juventino wants to continue improving his service and keeping his prices economical so he can increase his clientele and better his quality of life together with his wife.

He is asking for a three month US$200 loan to buy raw materials. He wants to be able to offer the best prices in his estimates to clients. He is grateful to everyone for the support that helps him improve his business and get ahead in life with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Juventino es un hombre casado tiene dos hijos, él es un hombre muy trabajador y junto con su esposa los dos trabajan arduamente para poder mantener y educar a sus dos hijos, su esposa trabaja vendiendo fritangas y él le apoya los fines de semana que tiene tiempo libre, él inicio su negocio desde muy joven, empezó a trabajar como albañil asistente y poco a poco fue aprendiendo bien el negocio y con el paso del tiempo se independizó y actualmente trabaja por su cuenta, ahora el ofrece su servicio a muchas personas que lo recomiendan por su buen trabajo y desea poder ofrecer cada día un mejor servicio y a un mejor precio para poder tener muchos clientes y mejorar su situación y calidad de vida junto con su esposa.

Juventino solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar materia prima con tiempo y poder ofrecer mejores precios en sus presupuestos a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, agradeciendo el apoyo de todas las personas que le brindan su ayuda para poder salir adelante y continuar creciendo con su negocio para seguir mejorando su trabajo y calidad de vida junto con su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his contruction business

loans.name: Abdul Khaliq

texts.en:
Abdul Khaliq lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son, and he lives with his own family.

He has a car parts shop. He has a lot of experience in his job. He was in this business for more than 5 years in Pakistan. When he came back, he started working in Kabul. Now he wants to expand his business in Afghanistan, so he requested an individual loan to increase his stock. He wants to make a good income to make a better life for his family. He is happy, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is very creative. Her goal of participating in the Kiva program is to purchase different kinds of New Year's clothes for her little clients. She wants to make holidays more interesting and unforgettable for children, and she wans to supply her market with more holiday dresses. During her shop's activity (5 years), she noticed that children from her region (J.Rasulov)have not had the opportunity to buy New Year clothes. She had seen other children from foreign countries meet the New Year wonderfully, and she wants children from her region to meet the New Year holiday also with great pleasure. That is why she ordered to her friend who brings goods from Bishkek to export New Year costumes for her. She needs a loan to pay for this batch of goods.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for the New Year (a special holiday) for her little clients.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn G. is 42 years old.  She is married, has 5 children, and lives in Benin City.  Her business is selling bread. She is requesting a loan, to the amount of $450, to enable her to buy more bread for sale. She spent 10 months learning this business before starting her business in 1980. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew O. is 27 years old and single with 2 children. He lives in Benin City and has a workshop that he uses for his lubricating work. He solicits a loan of $600 to enable him to buy drum oil and wheel alignment materials, and to renovate his workshop to meet the standard of the customers. He has been with LAPO for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy drum oil and  alignment materials

loans.name: Joanitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Joanitha B.. She is married with two children, aged 9 months and 8 years, and has one other dependent, who lives with her because she is schooling in the area.

In 2004, Joanitha established a pharmacy and soft drinks business. Working nine to twelve hours a day, and assisted by her husband and two employees, she earns about $1500.00 per month. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260.00. In the future, Joanitha also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her pharmacy and soft drinks business

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang P., 68, is a mother of four children and works as a farmer. On average, she makes less than one dollar a day. Her husband, Ken Chen, age 71, is also a farmer, eventually earning around $1 a day of profit. All of their children are employed by a garment factory with a salary $80 each a month.

This couple needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for transportation from their house to the field. Any leftover money will be used to purchase fertilizer for their farmland. (Mr. Ken Chen is pictured because Mrs. Yang P. was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand one of the classrooms in her school

loans.name: Ni Made Gelis

texts.id:
Ni Made Gelis enjoys her work as pig farmewr, since besides providing income as pig farmer, also gives her recreation besides being a housewife. From DINARI's first loan, Made Gelis bought one mother pig, that after 6 months bore 6 piglets. From sales of those 10 piglets, Made Gelis profits Rp 1,100,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00) after subtracting feed and medical expenses. After learning of that good result, Made Gelis is requesting a second perod loan from DINARI to increase her capital to buy a second mother pig. So that in the next 6 months she could obtain more result than from her first loan. Of course Made Gelis' hope that this second period loan could be useful for her family in the niddle of ever increasing prices of all major daily needs items.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Gelis sangat menikmati pekerjaannya sebagai peternak babi karena disamping menghasilkan pendapatan bagi keluarga beternak babi juga sebagai hiburan disela-sela kegiatannya sebagai ibu rumah tangga. Dari pinjaman pertama ke DINARI Made Gelis membeli 1 ekor induk babi yang setelah 6 bulan melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi. Dari hasil penjualan 10 ekor anak babi tersebut Made Gelis memperoleh keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1.100.000 dan itu sudah dipotong biaya pakan dan obat. Setelah mengetahui hasil yang demikian bagus itu, Made Gelis kembali melakukan pinjaman periode kedua ke DINARI untuk menambah modalnya untuk membeli induk babi menjadi 2 ekor. Sehingga kedepannya selama 6 bulan akan diperoleh hasil yang melebihi dari pinjaman pertama. Tentunya besar harapan dari Made Gelis pada periode kedua ini hasil yang akan diperoleh akan sangat bermafaat bagi keluarganya ditengah semakin tingginya semua harga bahan pokok keperluan sehari-hari.

loans.use: To buy mother pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Tuulima

texts.en:
Tuulima T. is a 49-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation/farming business, and she is proud to say that she does all of the farming on her plantation. As a result, she sells her crops to the village people and to the public at large 3 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 400 Tala ($166 USD).

Tuulima has received 1 previous loan from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Tuulima’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her kids' education, and the rest will be used for general business purposes.

loans.use: To purchase necessary goods for business purposes and to pay for her childrens' education

loans.name: Nyirimpunga

texts.en:
Greetings from I. in Kabuga Rwanda! I. is 32 years old and married with one child and one adopted orphan. 

In 2005, he started his business selling second-hand shoes for kids and adults. He buys the shoes from Uganda and Kenya in bulk and sells them in the local markets in Kabuga. Besides that, he sells beans, sorghum, and cassava flour to the neighboring markets. His capital has accumulated to over $2500 over the past three years. He employs two people and makes about $40 every month. The loan requested is for 515,000 frws to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ibn Chambas

texts.en:
A., as he is popularly called, is 30 years old. He is single with one child who is currently in school. A. is a dealer in electrical supplies and electric appliances like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

A. is requesting this loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronics parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and television. He would be very grateful for your support.

A. has been in this business for the past eight years and so has a lot of experience with wider market share in his business area. He belongs to the community group called Royal Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of electrical and electronic appliances

loans.name: Rayhongul

texts.ru: Наврасова Райхонгуль жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 47 лет, заумжем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Она покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их и продает. На доход от своего бизнеса содержит свою семью.Животноводство является основынм источником дохода ее большой семьи. Помогают ей ее дети. На кредит Райхонгуль планирует купить 2-х бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rayhongul N., 47, lives in Vahdat district. She is married and has six children. Ms. N. has a high school education. She has been in the business of raising animals for over ten years. She purchases calves at the market, fattens them up and re-sells them. The income from this business is the main source of income for Ms. N.'s large family, and her children also help her with the business. Ms. N. has applied for a loan to purchase two calves. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Aldo Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Aldo tiene 32 años de edad, casado y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Venezuela, su actividad es un cyber de café que lo tiene ubicado en su casa, con tres años de experiencia lo cual hasta ahora ha sobresalido adelante, solo cuando hay apagones de luz pues le va mal ya que no tiene el servicio y cuando lo hace con la planta eléctrico se le eleva el consumo de energía. Inicio con ahorro que trajo de Panamá donde trabajaba en una empresa procesadora de café colombiano. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de computadoras y así elevar la oferta a sus clientes y obtener mayor utilidades. A futuro es hacer una barra en el cyber y mantener el café a granel con la maquina tostadora y procesadora  todo integrado, Y hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Aldo is 32 years old, he is married and he lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Villa Venezuela. His occupation is running a cyber cafe located in his home. With three years' experience he has seen great success until now. Only when there are blackouts is when he sees problems because he cannot run his services without the generator, which is very taxing on their energy reserves. He started out with some savings he put away from when he worked in Panama in a columbian coffee processing plant. With the loan he requests he will invest into his business through the purchase of computers. He will then be able to provide more to his clients and obtain a greater income. IN the future he hopes to set up a coffee shop in his cyber cafe, complete with roasting and processing equipment. He also wants to remodel his home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computers.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Su nombre es Félix Pedro Téllez su edad es de 45 años, su  estado es  civil casado este señor tiene 4 hijos todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora no labora, Don Félix tiene sus propósitos como lo es mantener su negocio activo por lo que es necesario para el generar ingresos para su familia, sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una casa propia para que el día de mañana no tengan problemas y puedan tener su propio lugar.


La actividad a la que este señor se dedica la venta de gaseosa y cervezas, la ubicación de su establecimiento es en su casa de habitaron en león comarca sagrado corazón de Jesús Km. 77 carretera León- Managua, el tiempo  que tiene de  poseer  este negocio es de 8 años, el inicia este negocio por motivación propia por lo que empezó con la venta de gaseosa al principio  este negocio no le proporcionaba afluencia de clientes por lo que decido introducir otro producto como lo fue la venta de cerveza y cigarrillos así obtuvo  mas afluencia de clientes y es entonces que decide dedicarse a la venta de estos productos el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que el necesita abastecerse de estos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
His name is Félix Pedro Téllez, his age is 45, he is married. This gentleman has 4 children, all working for themselves. His life companion does not work. Don Félix plans to keep his business active enough to generate income for his family. His dreams are that his children would have their own homes so that in the future there would not be problems and they would have their own places. This man sells soft drinks and beers. His establishment is located in his home in the Sacred Heart of Jesus Region Km. 77 León- Managua Highway. He has had this business for 8 years. He started the business through his own motivation, in the beginning selling soft drinks. Since this did not draw a huge clientele, he decided to introduce other products, selling beer and cigarettes, which drew a larger clientele. Therefore he decided to sell these products. The financing is for working capital, because he needs to stock up on these products to offer to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao R. is 30 years old and is a resident of Kandal Province. She runs a business selling Khmer Noodle in front of her home in the village of Svay. Most of her clients are neighbors who live near by. She always gets up early in the morning to make her noodles, which she will have completely sold by the afternoon. She is married with three children, all of whom are single. Her husband, 29, is a construction worker. To earn extra income to help with the family's expense R. also sells water. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cart for transporting her water barrel.

loans.use: To purchase a cart

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en:
Khasan S. is 51 years old and married with four children.  Khasan is a market vendor.  He has been selling fruit and vegetables for the past 13 years.  During these years, Khasan acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.  For instance, he knows how to store fruit to maintain their marketable conditions and preserve the taste and other useful properties.  He sells fruit and vegetables such as: apples, pears, pomegranates, carrots, tomatoes and potatoes in the central street of his village.  Khasan begins his workday early morning at 5:00 AM, buying vegetables and fruit from local farmers.  

People across the building always come to Khasan to buy fresh fruit or vegetables; he is well-known because of his attractive prices and friendly customer service.  All this allows Khasan’s business to generate a stable and considerable income stream for his family.  Due to the current season, Khasan’s goods are in high demand.  For this reason, he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.  Today, he is requesting a loan for $1,200 USD that will allow him to expand his business. With your help, this expansion will be possible.  He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Julia es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa que esta ubicado en el barrio de Andamarca, en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, licores, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Julia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of "Banco Comunal Amauta" (a community bank). Julia is married, 58 years old, and has 7 children. Julia has a store in her house, which is located in the neighborhood of "Andamarca." She sells general groceries, such as vegetables, fruit and liquor. She makes this business a reality with the help of her daughter. Julia needs a loan of 1500 soles (monetary unit of Peru) that she will invest in rice and sugar. Julia's dream is to give a good education to her children and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Sugran Shahnawaz Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of S. and they have resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Sugran baji is a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are getting education from a school located near their house.

Sugran baji is a very simple lady. She spends her time doing household work and taking care of her family. Her husband runs a PCO (public call office, where people come to make calls and must pay a fee). Sugran baji is applying for a loan to buy calling cards to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rubina kosar baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making businesses. Saima baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Salma baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires and switchboards) to sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy calling cards for PCO

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 55 años de edad, por más de 18 años vive con el padre de uno de sus hijos que estudia en la ciudad. Desde que era soltera se dedicó a los cultivos, en su afán de progresar y convertirse en una prospera agricultora y negociante, pero cuando quedó embarazada su trabajo en el campo mermó y tuvo que volcarse a los cuidados de su hijo y la labor de ama de casa. Pero ahora que su hijo ya es mayor, Clarisa está retomando sus labores agrícolas sembrando maíz, alverjas y otras verduras en las chacras que heredó de sus padres.  En esta temporada, ella y su hijo han sembrado mayormente maíz, pero no fue rentable por los bajos los precios del mercado. Ahora quiere incrementar sus cultivos en alverjas de semilla de alta calidad, resistente al mal clima y mejor cotizada en el mercado. Con estas miras Clarisa está contenta con sus labores agrícolas, anhelando la rentabilidad de sus cultivos, para de ese modo cubrir la educación de su hijo. Clarisa en una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, esta es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, al cual le tiene mucha gratitud y cariño por permitirle trabajar. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos que tiene y para los que va a sembrar.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 55 years old and has lived with the father of one of her children, who studies in the city, for more than 18 years. Since she was single, she has been devoted to agriculture in her eagerness to progress and turn herself into a prosperous farmer and businesswoman. But when she became pregnant, her work in the field suffered and she had to turn to caring for her son and working as a housewife. Now that her son is older, Clarisa is returning to her agricultural work, planting corn, peas, and other vegetables in the fields she inherited from her parents. This season, she and her son primarily planted corn, but it was not profitable due to low market prices. Now she wants to expand production of higher quality peas, resistant to bad weather and more valued in the market. To this end, Clarisa is happy with her agricultural work. She hopes to have a more profitable crop so that she can afford to educate her son. Clarisa is a client who is very responsible with her payments. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she gives them much gratitude and affection for allowing her to work. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and manures for the crops she has and those she will plant.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia K. sells clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell in order to expand her business. She is 31 years old and is married to an accountant in the Ministry of Regional Co-operation, Government of Southern Sudan. Cicilia has no children. And with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land to rent.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Nahida has owned a small shop and beauty salon in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 15 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $175. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items and other items for her shop. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for a future use.

Nahida is 41 years old, married, and has three children: ages 15, 13 and 10. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Yusta, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and other items for her shop

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 48 years old and married to Ma. Elena. They have two children: Daphnie - 13 years old, a high school sophomore and Hyacinth May - 12 years old, an incoming high school student. 

Vicente manages a rice-farming and hog-raising business at the same time. He would like to develop his businesses to have a higher yield for him to continuously support the education of his two children. 

He is hoping that he could obtain a loan of PHP 12,000 that he can use on his farm. This would mean a lot, not only for his business but also for his family. His wife is working abroad and they have to sacrifice to uplift their life from poverty.

loans.use: To use on his farm

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
“Patience and perseverance overcome mountains,” says Marilou. No matter how difficult life is, when you strive to overcome, by inches, of the test of times, you will become successful, she added. Marilou is already 43 years old and is married to Benjamin G., 49 years old. The couple is blessed with five children who are all studying at the moment. 

Marilou struggles a lot in order to help her husband to provide for the needs of their children. She further said that through her sacrifices and patience she is able to survive life’s difficulties. Presently, Marilou is engaged in a vending business. She sells street foods and refreshments everyday in their village. She wants her business to grow and to increase her daily income, so she is requesting to borrow PHP 6,000 to be used as additional business capital. This will help her family a lot because she knows that in this business she will gain more income. She also aims to become successful in their life someday and she hopes that by providing her with this loan, she can shift up from their poor ways of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal Los Andes se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Media Luna”, cuenta con 12 integrantes que tienen negocios pequeños tales como vender dulces, comida, juguetes, ropas, perfumes, pasteles y tejido de chompas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o para comprar instrumentos de trabajo como, carrito para llevar su mercadería a las diferentes ferias, máquina de tejer y  mueble para exponer los pasteles. Lidia C. es la presidenta de la Asociación y vende pasteles, ella espera que a todas las integrantes les vaya bien en sus negocios  y cumplir puntualmente con los pagos.
texts.en:
The association "Media Luna" is located in the center of the Andes mountains. The association consists of 12 members who own small businesses and sell items such as sweets, food, toys, clothes, perfumes, pastries, and sweaters. All the members need this loan to buy merchandise or business items such as a cart to take merchandise to various street markets, a sewing machine, or a table for the display of pastries. Lidia C. is the president of the group. She sells pastries. She hopes and expects that all members will be successful in their businesses and will make their loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and tools for work

loans.name: Santiaggo Ignacio

texts.es: El Joven Santiaggo C. tiene 23 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Tzansiguan, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santiaggo C. is 23 years old and single. He is a weaver in a workshop, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres”, that has 2 looms and makes women's garments. He lives with his parents, who work in the same trade as him. They have 2 employees and for 7 years have run Cortes from their residence, which is in Caserío la Tzansiguan, the village of V. of Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from his customers has grown but his economic situation doesn't allow him to expand. That's why he went to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, with the intention of buying raw materials. In this way he hopes to increase sales and also be able to provide for his family so that they will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artisan crafts (working capital)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 22 years old and married to an accountant in the Ministry of Finance, Government of Southern Sudan (GOSS). She has two children who attend School. She sells green vegetables at the market, and is requesting a loan in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a shop from which she could sell her produce.   

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farm stock

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Inseparables” están representadas por la señora Sandra y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como horneados, comida, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, ropa americana, comida, cotillones y adornos. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desD. 2 ciclos anteriores recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios y al incremento D. su mercadería para ofrecer al M. un producto D. mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas D. las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the "Las Inseparables" group, led by Mrs. Sandra, are in their third cycle with the institution having demonstrated responsibility, honesty and a desire to get ahead to keep growing with the economic help from the institution. Most of the members are involved in sales of such items as: prepared meals, food, groceries, catalog cosmetic sales, American clothing sales, food, party supplies and decorations. The work of the past two cycles is now beginning to show benefits which creates the need for a new loan so that their businesses can grow and they can increase their inventory in order to offer the marketplace a higher quality product that is more competitive. The members expect to have a productive enterprise that will afford their families a better quality of life and better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Funds.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Five months ago, Viviana took the plunge and bought a beauty business. She had been thinking about starting her own business in order to progress economically and, specifically, give her daughter better opportunities. She says that every day brings a new challenge, but she enjoys confronting these challenges in order to maintain a successful business.

Now, she will use her ACCION USA loan to put a deposit on a rental contract for her storefront. She hopes that, in the future, her young business will bring her and her daughter a better and more prosperous life.

loans.use: To put a deposit on a rental contract for her storefront

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan T. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread along side the road in an open place.  She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of sugar and baking flour.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to develop her place along the side of the road into a restaurant.  She will do this by building a structure with iron sheets for the both the walls and the roof. 

Juan is 25 years old and is married to a soldier.  She has no children.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of sugar and baking flour

loans.name: Mrs. Pheang Uon Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pheang U. is a group leader of four who all live in Ta Ou Kang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. She is also a pig breeder. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and to buy piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the family’s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Hon, helps her in the business. Mrs. Pheang U. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is studying at the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field and to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Currently one is in school, while the last born is still breastfeeding. She sponsors the children's education, health care and food, etc., through the support from the husband and the business. She is a bread baker and has been baking for four years now. She bakes and supplies to her customers, and also sells the rest through hawking in the community market where she lives.  She acquired her baking skills from baking school. She has good customer relations; for that reason, lots of customers buy from her. She requests the loan assistance to enable her procure stock like flour, flavor, nut milk, baking powder, etc. She takes delivery of stock in bulk from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She believes sales could increase as we enter Christmas and she would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy items like flour, flavor, baking powder etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz M. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Luz is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Luz is just starting this business.

In 2009, Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Luz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance O. is 28 years old and a widowed of mother of 3 children and a guardian of 4 orphans. She runs a dairy farm business in Malanga, Busia district. Her main plan is to buy another dairy cow and keep expanding her farm to cater for the whole village in milk and dairy product supply. Her future dream is to ensure all the children under her care get the highest quality of education within the country. She would like a loan of Kshs.30,000 to enable her to get the new dairy cow she is after.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad V. is from the village of Panduma in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Caridad is single and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Caridad owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of products such as sugar, shampoo, sardines and other daily-use products in the local community. Caridad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caridad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She use her loan to buy additional products to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Caridad's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teodoro Jose

texts.es: El señor Teodoro tiene el negocio de explotación de mina de poma en el cual desde horas muy tempranas se levanta a realizar su actividad diaria que es el sacar poca el cual un trabajo duro ya que es a la intemperie, el crédito lo ocupara para la compra de herramientas para el trabajo ya que es muy pesado y estos se deterioran rápido además le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida ya que el empezó a trabajarle a un vecino y ahora es dueño de su propia mina.
texts.en:
Teodoro operates a business mining pumice stone. He gets up early every day to make a meager living doing difficult work in harsh conditions. He will use the loan to buy new tools because tools quickly fall apart due to the difficult work. They have also helped him improve his quality of life: he began by working for his neighbor, and he is now the owner of his own mine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for mining business.

loans.name: Akoua Rosaline

texts.fr: Z. Akoua Rosaline est née le 10 Octobre 1969 et vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, dont quatre sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Rosaline sont scolarisés. Rosaline vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs charges respectives. Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis 21 ans, Rosaline mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (poissons et viande frits accompagné d’akassa fait à base de maïs). A côté de cela, Rosaline vend également des produits de toilette et du savon dans son quartier. Rosaline s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rosaline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a eu à bien rembourser. Rosaline ambitionne développer davantage son activité et agrandir surtout sa seconde activité de vente de produits de beauté. C’est pour y parvenir et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Rosaline sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Akoua Rosaline was born on October 10, 1969 and has been living for some twenty years in Xwlacodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children, of whom four are still dependent on her for support. All Rosaline's children are enrolled in school. She lives alone with her children and is the sole breadwinner for the family.

Rosaline did not go to school. For 21 years, she has been selling cooked food: fried fish and meat with "akassa" (a local dish) made of cornmeal. Besides this business, she also sells toiletries and soap in her neighborhood. She gets her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Rosaline is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already received four loans from ALIDé, which she reimbursed correctly. She would like to expand her little businesses, especially her sales of cosmetics. It is in order to arrive at that goal and better satisfy her clientele that Rosaline is asking for a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish, meat, maize, and toiletries

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K. is married and has five dependents. She has a senior high school education.  

Mercy sells bread at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  Mercy uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more bread to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Griselda Hesperida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Griselda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 27 años, es soltera y es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Griselda es una mujer joven, trabajadora, responsable y estudiosa, ella actualmente trabaja en un laboratorio clínico desde las 7 a.m. hasta 1 p.m. y ella por las tardes estudia la carrera profesional de psicología en la Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco y esta cursando el sexto semestre. La socia tiene un negocio familiar con su papa y es fabricación de muebles de madera. La socia requiere el préstamo de los 1200 soles para pagar sus estudios y para invertir en el negocio familiar.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Griselda belongs to the Kantu de San Jerónimo Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. She is 27 years old and single. She is from the city of Cusco. Griselda is a hard-working, responsible, and studious young woman. She currently works in a clinic laboratory from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. In the afternoons she studies for a professional career in psychology at the Universidad Particular Andina in Cusco. She is in her sixth semester. She has a family business with her father. They make furniture from wood. She needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to pay for her studies and to invest in the family business. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her studies and invest in the family business

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Manuel C. M., Habita en el reparto Pedro j. chamorro de Chinandega, es sastre  y además repara Maquinas de coser, el señor posee un tramo en el bisne donde realiza sus trabajos de confección y de reparación.

El señor C. M. es casado y tiene  dos hijos que aun dependen de él, su esposa también posee un tramo de en el bisne donde vende comida, contiguo al de el, ambos son bien trabajadores y luchan a diario para sacar  adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the Pedro J. Chamorro neighborhood of Chinandenga. He is a tailor and also repairs sewing machines. He has a workshop where he practices his trades. Carlos is married and has two children who depend on him. His wife sells food next door to his shop. They are both hard workers who work to move their family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 37 años es soltera y es consultora D. belleza venD.  la mayoría D. marcas y tiene mucha clientela, también venD. ropa por  pedido todo esto la ayuda a solventar los gastos que le genera la educación D. su hija quien cursa estudios en una universidad.
La Sra. Patricia toda la vida ha trabajado en lo que se refiere a  ventas, sabe el movimiento D. ese negocio, en el futuro quiere tener  un  bazar  o una jugeria para eso esta pensando en alquilar un local adecuado ya sea en un mercado o un lugar céntrico.  Para este fin ella trabaja mucho por que quiere lograrlo muy pronto. Su présT. actual lo usara en la compra D. productos D. belleza y ropa para vender, ella es la presidenta D. el grupo “DAMAS TRIUNFADORAS”  ya tiene en ese cargo 1 año y lo desempeña D. la mejor manera apoyando a su grupo.
*lA Sra. Patricia esta sentada,es la quinta D. la parte D. atras con blusa blanca.
texts.en:
Patricia is 37 years old, single, and works as a beauty consultant. She sells most brands and has plenty of customers. Patricia also sells clothing upon requests. All of this helps to pay for the educational expenses of her daughter who is studying at a university.

Sra. Patricia has worked in sales her entire life and knows how this type of business operates. In the future, she wants to open either a bazaar or a juice bar. She needs a suitable location that she can rent in the market or in a central area. In order to achieve this, she works hard because she wants to accomplish this very soon. Her current loan will be used to purchase beauty products and clothing to sell. Patricia is the president of the group “Damas Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women). She has already held this position for one year and has demonstrated that she is the best at supporting her group.

*Sra. Patricia is the fifth person seated in the back, wearing a white blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & clothing

loans.name: Las Rosas De Mazateupa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Rosas de Mazateupa” esta integrado por seis integrantes mujeres todas ellas. Las representa doña Miguelina, que se dedica a vender artículos de plástico por medio de catálogos, doña Ma. Anita, vende pollo vivo o aliñado como doña Anabel, doña Marina vende “pozol” que es una bebida tradicional tabasqueña hecha a base de maíz y cacao; Andrea, vende zapatos de varias marcas por catálogo y doña Viviana, antojitos tradicionales.

Doña Miguelina comprará más catálogos de plásticos además de los pedidos que ya tiene. Ella tiene fe en que trabajando duro logrará su meta que es ampliar su casa y que sus hijos terminen una carrera, ella quiere obtener mayores ingresos y vender en más comunidades.

Éste grupo es muy jovial y tienen variadas actividades, se debe resaltar que es un grupo familiar, ellas piensan que así se pueden apoyar más y lograr muchas cosas juntas.

Están muy agradecidas con la Fundación y con KIVA por creer en la gente “choca”, término con el que se les conoce a las personas de Tabasco.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rosas de Mazateupa” (The Roses of Mazateupa) is made up of six members, all women. The representative, Mrs. Miguelina, sells plastic goods through catalogues. Mrs. Anita sells chicken, live or prepared by Mrs. Anabel. Mrs. Marina sells “pozol” which is a traditional drink in the Tabasco region made from corn and cocoa. Mrs. Andrea sells various brands of shoes by catalogue and Mrs. Viviana sells traditional snacks. Mrs. Miguelina will buy more catalogues of plastic goods in addition to the orders that she currently has. She has faith that by working hard she will succeed in her goal which is to enlarge her house and have her children finish university. She would like to have a greater income and sell to more communities. This group is very positive and does a variety of activities which has resulted in the group feeling more like a family. They believe that in this way they can better support one another and accomplish many things together. They are very grateful to the Fundación and to KIVA for believing in the “choca” people, a term by which they are known in Tabasco.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods, perfumes, deodorizers, shoes, live chickens, corn, cocoa, and firewood.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the wife of M. I. and they live in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. 
 
She is a caring mother as well as a caring wife. She stays at home and does household chores. She also cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. 

Her husband is involved in a cosmetics selling business. He purchases the cosmetics at wholesale prices and then sells them to the cosmetics shops. He has been in this business for over ten years.  

Razia is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase cosmetics in bulk and increase his profits.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Shakeb Andrabe Group

texts.en:
Belqis is the group leader of the Shakeb Andrabe Group. Belqis is 45 years old. She lives in Kabul. She is a bead worker and she has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. She wants to take a loan for her bead-working business. She wants to enlarge her business, she wants buy beads for her business, and she wants to expand and improve her business.

All of the group members would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona dedicada principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en corrales situados en la parte posterior de su vivienda, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan frecuentemente la zona para revender los animales en el distrito de Cayaltí o en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares, Carlos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Carlos es un joven tranquilo y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y confianza, siempre encuentran en el a alquien dispuesto a ayudarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house in Nueva Arica District, an area dedicated primarily to agricultural activities like ranching and tobacco farming. It is located one and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For two years, Carlos has worked raising and selling animals. He raises poultry and small animals in pens behind his house. When they have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to businessmen who frequently visit the area to resell the animals in Cayaltí District or in Chiclayo. The income he receives from this business allows him to cover his personal expenses and help his parents with the family's expenses. Carlos wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed. For this reason, he has for the first time asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles. Carlos is a calm and responsible young man. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in great esteem and have a lot of confidence in him; they always find in him someone who is ready to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed for expansion of business raising and selling animals

loans.name: La Venta Group

texts.es:
La Venta es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Aura Lila L. L. quien vende cosméticos y ropa usada desde hace cuatro años. Sus compañeras de grupo son Migdia Arabel Landez O. comerciante de ropa usada, Juliana C. H.  es propietaria de una pequeña venta la cual estas bien surtida y Elizabeth H. P. a partir del 2009 vende pollo. 

Ellas tienen la meta de prosperar y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“La Venta” (The Sale) is a group that consists of four hardworking individuals. One of them is Aura Lila L. L., who has been selling cosmetics and used clothing for four years. Her fellow group members are Migdia Arabel Landez O. (a used clothing merchant), Juliana C. H. (the owner of a small well-stocked store), and Elizabeth H. P. (who has been selling chicken since 2009).

Their goal is to prosper and expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Maria junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración de precocidos de menestras, carnes, actividad que realiza en la madrugada, además Maria elabora gelatina de pata, que es preparado con pata de ganado vacuno que es sancochado por horas para que suelte su gelatina, sus ventas los realiza caminando por las calles y también a pedido.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y azúcar.
Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio y terminar de pagar la casa que compro en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
María is married and has three children who are studying in the university. Together with her family María sells prepared meals and meats. She does her work at daybreak. She also prepares “gelatina de pata” which is prepared with cow’s hooves that are boiled for hours so that the collagen is released. She sells it in an itinerant fashion but also based on prior orders. María is a member of the Sarita communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy sugar and firewood. María dreams with expanding her business and with paying off her house that she bought in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Rose Mukuhi

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old, married to Wathumba Chege, and they have three children.  She ventured into quarrying and stone extraction two years ago, which  has proven to be successful, and she now wants to buy another piece of land to be able to extract more stones.

She hopes to be extracting stones in large quantities in the future and to be a major supplier.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site

loans.name: Marilu Dolores

texts.es:
Marilu nació en la ciudad de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Marilu vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra ubicada a una hora diez de la ciudad del Cusco). 
 
Marilu se dedica a la venta de leña, madera y arboles. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo.
       
Con el próximo préstamo, Marilu que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo madera y leña. 

Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal “Vilcanota” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marilu was born in the city of Urubamba, Urubamba Province in the department of Cusco. Currently, Marilu lives in the city where she was born. (The city of Urubamba is located an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.) Marilu sells firewood, wood and trees. She has been in this business for 15 years now, and she has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. With this next loan, Marilu hopes to receive 2000 new soles. She would like to invest the loan money in buying merchandise like wood and firewood. For several years now she has been a member of the Vilcanota communal bank of Asociación Arariwa Cusco, and she is doing very well thanks to the trust of her companions and the punctuality of their loan payments. This member is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like wood and firewood

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba. To make a living, Marites is engaged in the agriculture sector particularly in hog raising. She has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years, earning a monthly income of 1200 PHP. 

In 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mairtes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Mukhtaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a resident of Vehari which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its agriculture industry. A very talented lady, Mukhtaran owns & operates an embroidery business. Embroidery is a popular job among ladies of Vehari, and Mukhtaran also adopted this work to financially support her family. She enjoys doing it. She crafts beautiful designs on clothes and attracts more customers.  

Her husband's name is F. M. and he is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw has become old and needs repairing. Due to its rough condition, he can’t use it for long hours and can’t seat passengers in it. 

Mukhtaran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan amount he will repair his rickshaw. She is hopeful that with the fully repaired rickshaw her husband will be able to work for extended hours with more efficiency.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo;  El socio tiene 39 años de edad;  el es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio  trabaja es albañil y trabaja en todo tipo de obras , actualmente están construyendo un condominio ecológico en este bello poblado, el socio en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus menores hijos, el socio pagara unas mensualidades hasta que le regularicen el sueldo. El socio solicita el dinero para invertir en el pago de las mensualidades de sus menores hijos.

 El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Señor de Tantamarca communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Chicón, which is in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Cirilo is 39 years old and has a live-in partner and three children. He works as a builder on all types of projects, and is currently building an ecological condominium in this beautiful area. At this time, Cirilo is requesting a loan to invest in his young children’s education. He will use the money to pay their monthly school payments until they normalize his salary.

He appreciates and values the loan provided and he promises to make his loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in his young children's monthly school payments.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan V., es un mecanico que con esfuerzos y sacrificios ha logrado levantar su negocio que es un taller , donde se arreglan todo tipo de autos, el tiene 2 trabajadores que le ayudan a sacar adelante el  trabajo, pero nos comento que le hacen mucha falta varias herramientas por ejemplo pistones electricos,  y otras herramientas que se necesitan para mejorar la calidad del trabajo de los autos que arregla, el se siente  muy contento, porque piensa que en el futuro  va a sacar  el trabajo de los autos con mayor rapidez, y  asi lo recomendaran para agrandar su negocio y darle una mejor comodidad, tanto a su familia como a los clientes que lo visitan solicitando sus servicios de mecanico.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Vásquez is an auto mechanic who has managed to install his auto repair shop, where all kinds of auto repairs are done, thanks to much sacrifice and effort.  He has two employees that help him do the jobs but he commented to us that he needs several tools, like electric pistons and other tools, to improve the quality of his auto repair jobs.

He feels very happy because he thinks that in the future he will be able to do the repairs more quickly and that way he will be recommended so that the business will grow and he will be able to provide more comfort for his family and to the customers that come to request his services as a mechanic.

loans.use: To buy tools and parts for his auto shop.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a messenger. She has been through junior high school.  Esi sells cooking utensils and meat at Abura. Esi assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is requesting the loan to use  to purchase different varieties of meat for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase different sorts of meat for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es casada y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus suegros, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente es empleada de una galería vendiendo ropa para mayores y niños, además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza; el esposo trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de llantas para movilidades.
El crédito lo utilizará para abastecerse de material de belleza. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Irma is married and has one school-age child.  She lives in her in-laws' house which is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.

Irma works in a mall selling adults' and children's clothes.  She also sells beauty products.  Her husband sells all kinds of tires for vehicles.

Irma will use her loan to stock up on beauty products.  That is how she makes income for her household.

This is Irma's second loan and the socio-economic analysis we have carried out shows that she can access another loan.

loans.use: To buy women's beauty products for her sales business

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two children who are 8 and 5 years old. She raises tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes in her own greenhouses. She started this business twelve years ago. Hard work and persistence helped her to develop it well. Today she has five large greenhouses that provide a stable income for her family.

Oksana is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new film for her greenhouses. She needs to purchase these inventories now to have good crops in the Spring. This business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and film for the greenhouses

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en: Amalya M. has been trading in flowers, design and perfume since 2000.  She adds a special touch to each order, making her customers happy and willing to come back to her shop. Amalya receives orders locally and from abroad. To enlarge her business, Amalya would like to purchase additional inventory for the shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a flower shop

loans.name: Yimmy Geovanny

texts.es:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F., tiene 20 años, es soltero con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Yimmy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa y tener un futuro mejor.

Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F. is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos Province. He doesn’t have any children.

He is a member of the Valle Alto Communal Bank, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precint, part of the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank works in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Yimmy works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He buys and sells the products in Ventanas in the Peña shopping center and sells them every day from home or at the Ventanas market.
