He is requesting the loan to plant corn and purchase supplies and seeds. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases, as well as the variation in climate. His dream is to buy a house and to have a better future.

He likes playing sports and studying.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own another business selling charcoal.
Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn computer skills and tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Peace and Unity” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Zainab K., 43 years old. She was born in Magburaka but currently resides in Makeni together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a prison officer and her children attend secondary school. For 11 years, Zainab has been selling toothpaste, soaps, toothbrushes, biscuits, milk, sardines, soft drinks, and other items. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy items at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 24 es una joven muy responsable, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace más de 4 años a su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes platillos, por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Siempre se ha preocupado por realizar el pago de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella solicita este crédito para realizar la compra de granos básicos, bolsas, frutas, verduras entre otras cosas. Por lo que sueña ampliar cada día su negocio.
texts.en: Marlene is a very responsible 24-year-old, which is why this is not the first time she requests a loan. She has been selling food for a living for over 4 years. The majority of her customers always order different dishes, so she feels satisfied to earn a living this way. She has always been concerned about making her payments on time. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase staple grains, bags, fruits, vegetables, and other goods. She dreams of expanding her business every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hilaria Bienvenida

texts.es:
Hilaria es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda de vivieres en la parte delantera de su casa. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido surtir su local con víveres y ha podido mantener su hogar. 

En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su hija desde las 07h00am todos los días. Vende en su tienda arroz por libra, azúcar, aceites, enlatados etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite y otros víveres de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a hardworking woman who has a small grocery store in the back part of her house. With effort and dedication she has been able to supply her store with groceries and support her home.  

At present, she works with her daughter's help starting at 7:00 a.m. every day. In her store, she sells rice by the pound, sugar, oils, canned goods, etc. She has a lot of dreams for her business and that is why she wants the loan to buy rice, oil, and other basic neccesity products.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Lilia Fernanda

texts.es:
Lilia de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó hace 13 años preparando panes y dulces en una pequeña panadería.

Ella trabaja diariamente de 8:00am a 11:00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina amasadora para facilitar la preparación de sus panes y así aumentar sus ganancia para sacar adelante a su familia. En un futuro quiere seguir en su negocio y terminar de adecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Lilia is 34 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has been making bread and sweet treats in her small bakery for 13 years.

Lilia works from 8.00am to 11.00pm every day.  She would like to use her loan to buy a kneading machine in order to facilitate her bread making.  In this way, she hopes to increase her profits and get her family ahead in life.  In the future, she would like to continue in her business and finish fitting out her house.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child.

Haydar is a carpenter; in 2002 he opened his own shop selling furniture. He has 8 years of experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy new equipment and to increase procurement. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and to increase procurement.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Mulago neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with three children, all of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business selling fish. She has been in this business for ten years and works seven days every week. 

Margaret sells her products at the market. Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the money to buy more baskets of fish. The main business challenges for Margaret include thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own rooms for rent, and to start selling wholesale only. Margaret lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but not to running water. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy Tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, en casa de la propiedad de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años y medio toca con su propio instrumento en una banda musical, trabaja generalmente los fines de semana porque en esos días se presentan celebraciones y eventos sociales que se dan en su localidad y alrededores. Este trabajo le permite estudiar en la universidad y solventar sus estudios de ingeniería. Disfruta de su trabajo ya que desde muy joven siempre ha tocado  varios instrumentos musicales, en un principio lo tomó como pasatiempo, ya que su sueño es convertirse en un artista, pero ahora lo considera como una fuente principal de vida. Es su crédito número 3 que tiene con MFP, considera que su experiencia de trabajo en un banco comunal le ha permitido mejorar la administración de su dinero por lo que esta agradecido y da su palabra en ser muy responsable en sus pagos como lo ha venido haciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otro instrumento musical.
texts.en: Jimmy is 22 years old and he lives with his parents and siblings in a house that is owned by his parents. He has been playing his own musical instrument with a band for more than four and a half years. He works generally on the weekends because it is during these days that celebrations and social events take place in his community and surrounding areas. This business allows him to go to university and to pay for his engineering studies. He loves his work because since he was very young he has been playing various musical instruments. At first it was only a pass-time and his dream was to be an artist but now he considers it to be his primary source of support. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He says that his experience with a communal bank has helped him improve his financial administration, for which he is thankful. He gives his word to be very responsible with his payments, as he has always done so. With the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of another musical instrument.

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, a 56-year-old married mother of five children, works hard to provide for her family selling spices in the Philippines, a business she has operated for 21 years. She also earns an income from operating a general store and selling vegetables. Myrna, who has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF, is requesting a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to puchase additional stocks of spices to sell. Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua makes a living by selling gari (or cassava flour) in the town of Elmina. She has been educated through junior high school, is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. She works hard to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to buy cassava to make more gari to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete building a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava to turn into flour for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single woman with one child, who is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, Mwanakombo has operated a business selling clothes to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Mwanakombo plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 29-year-old married man, and the father of one child. He has been renting a cafe since 2007, where he serves hot drinks and coffee. He also has Hookas available for customers to use for smoking tobacco.

Samer's customers like dealing with him. They meet up every night at his cafe to chat with each other and to enjoy their night. Samer also serves most of his customers through his fast and free delivery service. He takes their order and sends the drinks to their work and also sends Hookas to customers' homes or other requested places. He is fast in replying to customers' needs, and that's why they rely on him.

Renting a Hooka is normal these days, and it's expanding a lot. That's why Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the number of Hookas he owns.

Samer has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva borrower for five consecutive loan cycles, and he has good standing in his payback history. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to increase the number of Hookas he owns.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor  Luis  es un cliente antiguo  de la institución que se dedica  al transporte publico  que esta  en  unos de los  sindicatos mas reconocidos de la ciudad de La Paz  el cliente vive   en la zona de Munaypata Tiene  tres hijos  en edad escolar. El Sr. Luis   es dedicado a la familia y  muy trabajador el se siente beneficiado con el crédito  kiva el préstamo invertirá para  de dos pares de llantas para su movilidad. Luis tiene  gran visión para  los negocios y quiere superarse  y fortalecerse con otro negocio que es la venta de  zapatillas para damas y caballeros, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Luis is an long-standing customer of the institution.  He works in public transportation, which is one of the most recognized trade unions in the city of La Paz.   The customer lives in the area of Munaypata, and has three school-age children.  Señor Luis is dedicated to his family, and is very hard working.  He feels favored by the Kiva loan.  He will invest the loan in two pair of wheels for his transportation.  Luis has great business acumen and wants to get ahead,  and also strengthen himself with another business that is selling shoes for ladies and gentlemen.  He is a hard worker who is very grateful to the institution for the support that is offered.

loans.use: to buy tires and pads for his transportation.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina tiene 57 años, radica en su tierra natal con sus 2 hijos en la casa que ha heredado de sus padres. Desde hace 5 años apuesta y cree en el mercado local de su zona, tiene su empresa que se encarga de la repartición de gaseosas, refrescos y néctares al por mayor y que son distribuidos a los comerciantes minoristas. Durante estos años de experiencia le ha dado la oportunidad de poder fabricar su propia marca de refrescos y ahora los reparte a distantes ciudades, teniendo mayor venta durante la temporada de más calor. Por la constancia en el trabajo que viene realizando, ha ido creciendo su negocio por lo que desea ahora incursionar y vender en las ciudades  tropicales de  su país. Tiene 8 oportunidades de crédito que ha venido trabajando con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha mejorado bastante en su emprendimiento  porque  cada dinero fue el crecimiento de su capital de la cual se siente orgullosa. Con el  dinero que solicita, le servirá para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Florentina, 57, lives in her birthplace with her two children in the house she inherited from her parents.  For the last five years she’s been betting on and believing in her local market.  She has a wholesale soft-drink, beverage and fruit nectar delivery firm that sells to retailers.  These years of experience have given her the opportunity to manufacture her own brand of soft-drinks that she now distributes to distant cities.  Her highest sales occur during hot weather.  Because of the consistency of her work the business has been growing and now what she wants to do is to start operating in her country’s tropical cities.

She’s had 8 loan opportunities with MFP.  In all this time of working her enterprise has improved considerably because every loan was used to increase her capital and she is proud of that.  She will use the money she’s requesting to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Elvira has a shop that sells candies, biscuits and breads. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five low-income villagers who have been living in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Mien is the head of this group. She is a 39-year-old married woman blessed with five children, four of whom are single and enrolled in school. The other is no longer in school and is working as a porter. 

Mrs. Mien makes her daily living by working as a carrying laborer in the local market, earning $3 a day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a porter. Mrs. Mien is seeking a loan to renovate her house.

In the future, Mrs. Mien expects that she will be using her income to buy some piglets, ducks, and chickens for breeding and to have a good house for living. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

The other four borrowers are: 
Mrs. Ren, a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her house.
Mrs. Am, 48, who will use this loan to buy some goods to sell for more income.
Mrs. Hoat, who is applying for a loan to buy more pigs and repair her house.
Mrs. Sao, who is taking a loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность всем социальным инвесторам Кива, которые поддержали первый кредит Рахат, использованный по назначению и погашенный без просрочек. 
Рахат начала свой бизнес в перепродаже галантерейных изделий в  2004 году, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме всего лишь 1,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Рахат имеет в наличии товарооборот на сумму 30,000 (KGS) сом и наличные средства в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) для закупа товара.   Для дальнейшего увеличения своего товарооборота, Рахат повторно обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на оплату обучения сына, а в дальнейшем – на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Company "Bai-Tushum and Partners" expresses a sincere appreciation to all social investors from Kiva, who supported Rahat's first loan, which she used as directed and repaid without delays.  Rahat started her business of with resale of haberdashery goods in 2004, using a starting capital of only 1,000 som (KGS).  Today, Rahat has a good turnover of 30,000 (KGS) som and cash resources of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy merchandise.  To further increase her goods turnover, Rahat requested a second loan in the sum of 45,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to use the income from the loan to pay for her son's education and to further expand her business.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu.  She is divorced, and has two children aged 19 and 22 years. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because they were not going to school in the village where they lived and since Kadiatu is living in the city and her children are now grown up, she decided to help the children of her relatives by bringing them to the city for better education .  

In 2008, Kadiatu established her drinks (soft and hard) business. Kadiatu started because she needed a means of income to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

 Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy extra stout - 5 packets @ Le100,000, bottle parrot drink - 10 crates @ Le50,000, savannah - 10 packets @ Le140,000, Carlsberg beer - 10 crates @ Le120,000, soft drink in cans - 5 crates @ Le70,000 and pure drinking water - 20 bundles @ Le2,500. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Kadiatu hopes to buy a piece of land, build her own house and open another shop. Kadiatu is hard working and dedicated.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy extra stout - 5 packets @ Le100,000, bottle parrot drink - 10 crates @ Le50,000, savannah - 10 packets @ Le140,000, Carlsberg beer - 10 crates @ Le120,000, soft drink in cans - 5 crates @ Le70,000 and pure drinking water - 20 bundles @ Le2,500.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina de 45 años, natural de la ciudad de San Miguel, convive con Sergio de 48 años de edad y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos y viven juntos en su propia casa en el distrito de Samugari. La labor que realiza Delfina es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, frijoles y plátano, en total cuenta con 03hectáreas de terreno y es conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo; donde viene trabajando 20 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos menores. Se siente muy comprometida con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos las cuales perjudican sus cultivos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas injertadas de cacao y café, para obtener mejores frutos en corto tiempo. Este será su primer préstamo de Delfina y ya se siente muy alegre al saber que recibirá el apoyo de los financistas y por ello se compromete devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos solicitados comprará plantas injertadas de cacao y café para así obtener mejores ingresos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Delfina, 45, is from the city of San Miguel.  She lives with Sergio, 48, and their three children in their own house located in Samugari District.  Delfina works farming the land; she grows cocoa beans, beans and bananas. She has a total of three hectares of land and she’s well aware of the hard work farming entails.  She’s been working her own fields for 20 years.  During harvest time she gets help from day workers who harvest and transport the harvested products a certain distance to then be transported by small vehicles.  She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort she enjoys seeing that her plants bear good results today producing good profits.  She comments that the winter is not of her liking because that’s when insects that damage her crops abound.

She will use the requested loan to buy grafted cocoa bean and coffee plants to obtain fruit in shorter time.  This will be Delfina’s first loan and she feels very cheerful knowing she’ll get support from lenders and because of this she commits to make the programmed payments on punctually.   She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy grafted cocoa bean and coffee plants to earn better income in a shorter period of time.

loans.use: to buy grafted cocoa bean and coffee plants.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi de 39 años de edad,labora como docente de Educación Primaria en La Escuela Mauricio Cajina de la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, solicita su 9no crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda esperando continuar siendo beneficiada para ponerle el piso a su casa y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos los cuales están estudiando la primaria y por ende un mejor ambiente, en su barrio es bien reconocida y querida ya que es una docente con gran experiencia en este ramo, su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus tres hijos con una buena preparación académica y darle una buena educación y formación para que sean hombres y mujeres de bien en el futuro
texts.en: Daysi is 39 years old. She a primary school teacher at the Mauricio Cajina School in zone #2, Nueva Guinea. She asking for her 9th loan to invest in home improvements. She hopes to continue being a beneficiary in order to add a floor to her house and in this way give her children better living conditions as they are in primary school and need a better environment. She is well-known and loved in her neighbourhood as she has extensive experience as a primary school teacher. Her biggest dream is to get her 3 children ahead in life with a good academic background, a good education and training so that they become well-off men and women in the future.

loans.use: to remodel the house.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino es un hombre trabajador, a sus 53 años todavía está soltero, pero cuida de su madre de 80 años y de su hermano menor para quién es como un padre. Los 3 viven armoniosamente bajo un techo humilde pero propio. Gabino desde pequeño vive rodeado de vecinos y familiares que se dedican a la agricultura, por esa razón aprendió sobre las labores del campo, las que hasta ahora aplica para la producción de verduras y hortalizas. 
A sus 20 años, él tuvo que tomar las riendas como cabeza de familia haciéndose cargo de sus hermanos menores, ya que su padre falleció. De esa manera se consagró a la agricultura, y como las cosechas producen en temporadas, Gabino también trabaja como operario en otros terrenos agrícolas y como albañil, así él puede continuar brindándole educación a su hermano menor. Considera que la venta de arvejas es más rentable ya que, si no las vende frescas, puede ofrecerlas secas como semillas, cuyo precio se acerca a los 500 soles por bolsa. A parte de la cosecha de papas, que a pesar de dar frutos cada 6 meses, significa un ingreso considerable para la familia. Mas adelante, él quisiera ver a sus hermanos realizarse, para dejar a su madre en buenas y seguras manos, ya que con el tiempo su edad no le permitirá continuar con las mismas fuerzas. Gabino es muy constante, con éste será su préstamo número 13 de MFP, tiempo suficiente para calificar de bueno y satisfactorio su trabajo con su banco comunal, del que recibe buen apoyo. Con el dinero, Gabino podrá comprar abonos, para enriquecer sus sembríos de papa, las que cosechará para el mes de mayo. Además para pagar  a los operarios que colaborarán en la siembra, cultivo y cosecha. Estima que invertirá más de 2500 soles en el proceso.
texts.en:
Gabino is a hard-working man. At 53 years old, he is still single but he takes care of his 80 year old mother, and his little brother, to whom he is more like a father. The three live happily under their own humble roof. Ever since he was very young, Gabino has lived surrounded by neighbours and friends who dedicate themselves to agriculture, so he grew up accustomed to the labours of the field and he still grows vegetables and herbs. When he was 20 years old, Gabino had to take the reins as head of the family, and look after his little brothers, when his father died. This was how he came to dedicate his life to farming, and while the crops were growing Gabino would also work as a labourer in other people's farms and as a bricklayer, so that he could ensure his little brother's education could continue. 

He says that the pea harvest is his most profitable crop, because if he doesn't sell them fresh he can still sell them dried as seeds, at a price of nearly 500 Soles a bag. The potato harvest, even although it only comes round every 6 months, represents a considerable income for the family. In future, he would like to see his brothers fulfil their potential,and for his mother to stay in good hands, because her age no longer permits her to live with the same vigour. Gabino is very reliable. This is his 13th loan with MFP, and he has shown himself to be a good worker and part of his communal bank, from which he recieves good support. With the money, Gabino will be able to buy fertilizers to enrich the soil for the potatoes he plans to harvest in May. He will also pay hired labourers for their help in sowing, cultivating and harvesting the crop. He expects to invest around 2500 Soles in the process.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years old and a single mother of a 20-year-old  child.  She has been providing mobile phone money transfers to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  She also owns a barber shop where she earns extra income.

Rose hopes to grow her clientele in five years.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to add "float" for her money transfer business.

loans.use: To add "float" for her mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en: Oyunsuren is 59 years old and lives with her son and grandson in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Oyunsuren operates a shoe-making business. She started her business in 2010 by taking training from Mercy Corp. Since then, her business has been going so well that she can't meet her customers' demands. She is therefore requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy supplies and tools. Oyunsuren is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "My father used to make shoes. When he was alive, I wasn't old enough to pick up his skills. Now that I have, I'm really glad".

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools

loans.name: Suyunbubu

texts.ru:
Суюнбюбю 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает  5-х детей, младший из которых дошкольного возраста. Муж работает  на железной дороге в должности стрелка. 
С мая 2011 год, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Суюнбюбю решила заняться торговлей продуктами питания  в арендованном магазине, вложив  начальную сумму 30,000 сом (KGS). Приложив все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, Суюнбюбю добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день в ее товарообороте около 50,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса, Суюнбюбю обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров. Доходы от кредита Суюнбюбю планирует вложить развитие животноводства, так как для сельской местности это является прибыльным бизнесом.
texts.en: Suyunbubu is 40 years old married and is raising five children, the youngest still a preschooler. Her husband works for the railroad as a railroad switch operator. In order to supplement family income, Suyunbubu has been selling groceries from a rented store starting May 2011. She used a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS) to start her business and has been successful, as she now has 50,000 som (KGS) invested in her inventory. In order to further grow her business, Suyunbubu has turned to "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her inventory and attract additional clients. Suyunbubu is planning to use the profits from her loan to invest in a livestock business, as it is very profitable out in the countryside.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Yasay María

texts.es:
En el Sauce departamento de León, la joven Yasay María labora en una institución de la comunidad siendo ella una joven muy trabajadora que ha tomado la sabia decisión de salir al frente y velar por el bienestar de su familia a la que tanto ama.
 
Se presentó a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar su vivienda familiar ya que requiere mejorar tales condiciones puesto que en esta temporada de fin de año se ha propuesto mejorar dicha vivienda. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
In the El Sauce department of León, the young Yasay María works in an institution in the community and is known for being very hardworking. She has made the wise decision to work to get ahead to ensure the well-being of her beloved family.  

She came to the CEPRODEL office with the goal of asking for a loan to improve her family home, since it could use a lot of work this season. She will use said loan to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 54, is married and resides with his wife and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a distiller. Additionally, he is a taxi driver who carries garment workers to the factory. His wife is also a distiller and raises pigs. Due to his truck breaking down. Sok is requesting a loan of USD 800 to pay for his truck repairs. By doing so, he can safely carry garment workers to the factory and earn more money to support the family. In the future, Sok would like to buy one more truck to expand his transportation service to increase his income. In addition, he plans to build a new wooden house and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for his truck repair

loans.name: Los Tulipanes Blancos Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Los Tulipanes Blancos, está integrado por la señora Marcela va a comprar con su préstamo carnes, verduras, platos, aceite y refrescos, el señor Gersom va a comprar calcetines por mayoreo, la señora María Cleotilde va a comprar vitaminas, jarabe, pomadas, tés, complejos, shampoo, la señora Fausta va a comprar resistol para suelas, pampas, adornos para elaborar zapatos, la señora Gudelia va a comprar libretas, regalos, hojas, lapiceros, artículos navideños, etc. El señor Gersom tiene 27 años de edad, el es soltero, el vende ropa, el solicito su préstamo para comprar camisas, pantalones, playeras, calcetines para dama, caballero y niños, el acaba de iniciar su negocio con unos ahorros, su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene, a él le gusta su trabajo le sirve de distracción y le gusta atender a sus clientes amablemente, la ganancias las utiliza para volver a comprar mercancía, el está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más ropa, nuevas modas y lo piensa lograr trabajando, poniendo empeño al trabajo y con el préstamo que va a recibir, el vive con sus padres, hermanos y sobrinos, sus sueños y esperanzas son que progrese y crezca su negocio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por su ayuda, que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos para que nuestros negocios crezcan”.
texts.en:
This group is called the White Tulips and was formed by Mrs. Marcela. With her loan money, she will buy meat, vegetables, dishes, oils, and soft drinks. Mr. Gersom will buy socks in bulk, and Mrs. María Cleotilde is going to buy vitamins, cough syrup, ointments, tea, and shampoo. Mrs. Fausta will buy glue for shoes and decorations for making shoes. Mrs. Gudelia will buy notebooks, gifts, paper, pens, Christmas items, and more.

Mr. Gersom is 27 years old, single, and works selling clothing. He is asking for a loan to buy shirts, pants, t-shirts, and socks for men, women, and children. He just started his business with some savings, and his business is important because of the income he can earn. He likes his job because it entertains him and he likes to very kindly attend to his customers. He uses his earnings to buy more merchandise and is planning to expand his business by buying more clothing of the latest style. He plans to accomplish this by working hard and with the loan he will receive. He lives with his parents, siblings, nieces, and nephews. His dreams and goals are to progress and grow his business. To Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, the group wants to say: "thanks a lot for your help, and for continuing to support us with your loans so that our businesses grow."

loans.use: buy shirts, pants, t-shirt, and socks for men, women, and children

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Roma Group

texts.es: Es un grupo que está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras de éxitos, Ana Jacoba se dedica a vender zapatos, cosméticos de la Avon desde hace cinco años, es casada y tiene un hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos, cosméticos variados de la Avon como lociones, perfumen, cremas  para el cuerpo, crema para las manos, etc. Teodora vende cosméticos también de la Avon, Amanda tiene un kiosco estudiantil en un colegio cercano a su domicilio y Ana vende frutas, verduras frescas en su casa.
texts.en: This is a group made up of four successful, enterprising members.  Ana Jacoba has been selling shoes and Avon cosmetics for five years.  She is married and has a son and will use the money from this loan to buy shoes and various Avon cosmetics, such as lotions, perfumes, body creams, hand lotions, etc.  Teodora also sells Avon cosmetics; Amanda has a kiosk at a nearby school; Ana sells fresh fruits and vegetables in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep lives in Bogor, a city located about 2 hours from Jakarta, with six persons living together in the family home. Asep is single, and he currenly manages a small shop that sells drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and processing bill payments for his customers. Asep joined Ruma because he wants to learn more about Ruma's business and he is really glad with the support and assistance from Ruma's agents.

As his business continues, Asep hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions especially on weekends. For the last three months, Asep has had around $65 - $66 per day sales just from selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. In the photo, Asep is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a smiling and charismatic person. Speaking with her, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. 
She lives in a humble home in the town of Kerugoya along with her family.
She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity. 
Catherine is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Catherine and her family.
Like Catherine, thousands of women smallholder farmer are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as fertilizers and good quality seeds

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia has been in business for more than 6 years selling novelties such as gifts and home decorations. She has 3 children and Alicia wants to offer them an education so they will come to be honest and hard-working people. She is married but her husband\\\'s salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses.

This year Alicia hopes that her sales will increase with the Christmas season. Therefore she needs a loan of $925 USD to purchase merchandise to grow her business. She thanks you for your help and caring.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch:

Alicia tiene más de 6 años con su negocio, este consiste en la venta de novedades tal como regalos y algunos adornos para el hogar. Tiene 3 hijos a su cuidado, pero Alicia quiere ofrecerles una educación para que en el futuro sean personas honestas y trabajadoras. Esta casada pero el salario de su esposo no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia.

Alicia espera que este año sus ventas se incrementen con la próxima temporada navideña, por lo que ella requiere un préstamo de $925 USD. Ella agradece tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: A 36 year old woman, Mrs. Mabel O. is married with five children living in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She learned her trade business for 6 years before she started her business in the year 2002. She is eager to receive a loan of $800 to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use:
To buy additional sewing machines and 
materials for sale

loans.name: Esthela Margarita

texts.en:
Esthela is originally from Garcia in Nuevo Leon. She is married and has one son, with another child on it's way. When her husband was layed off she opened a seamstress shop. As the cost of maintaining her family increases, she is working to grow this business, making clothing for her neighbors and taking orders from clothing wholesalers. She is known for the high quality of her work. At this time she is asking for a loan of $475 to repair her sewing machines and continue to grow her business. She promises to repay the loan in 4-8 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands, so please do not hesitate to support them.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Esthela es originaria de la localiad de García en el estado de Nuevo Leòn, ella es casada, tiene un hijo y esta en espera de su segundo bebé. Esthela tiene un taller de costura que inició cuando su esposo quedó desempleado por reajuste de personal, las obligaciones de su casa empezaron a acumularse y para poder obtener un ingreso ella decidió empezar a trabajar haciéndole costuras a sus vecinos, su negocio fue creciendo y ahora maquila cantidades de mayoristas para algunos negocios que venden ropa.

La excelente calidad de las costuras que realiza Esthela ha permitido que su negocio prospere. Para incrementar su producción, ella necesita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en el mantenimiento de sus máquinas de coser, mismo que devolverá en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyar a esta familia.

loans.use: Sewing machine maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second hand clothes selling business

loans.name: Nazifa

texts.en: Nazifa is a resident of Saatli town in Azerbaijan. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. She has worked in cattle breeding, a very common business in the region, since 1992. Cattle breeding is the main occupation of the local people. She raises cattle together with her husband in the shed that they built in their yard. She sells adult livestock to earn a living for the family. She has applied for a loan of $500 to buy two more calves to increase her number of livestock. Her husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Piedad De Jesús

texts.en:
Piedad, 35, lives with her husband and their two boys.  Her husband, a professional painter, works in Santo Domingo, the capital.  Five months ago, Piedad took out a loan and used it to open a small cosmetics business. She sells lip gloss, lipstick, skincare products, hair lotion, perfumes, and women’s fragrances. Because she managed her small business prudently, she was able to pay back the loan before the due date.  

She runs her business from home, but sometimes she sells door to door or in the public market, especially on weekends.

Now she wants to expand the business and introduce gold-filled and silver jewelry to diversify her inventory and attract more customers.  She has applied for a second loan for this purpose.  The entrepreneur hopes that very soon her business will grow and that she’ll have her own location from which to run the store.

loans.use: To buy gold-filled and silver jewelry to sell from her business.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.fr:
Mr. Kevin A., 30, is married and the father of two children. He owns a little shop that sells shoes, and he has been in this business for 5 years. His earnings allow him to support his family and to pay the school fees for his two children. The requested loan will allow him to enlarge his store so that he can better satisfy the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 30 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants; Mr Kevin A. est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de chaussures. Il exercice cette activité depuis cinq ans . Les produits de son activité lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de payer l'écolage de ses enfants . Le présent emprunt lui permettra d'agrandir son magazin afin de satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle

loans.use:
to buy 10 cases of shoes to re-sell on the local market

acheter 10 caisses de chaussures pour les revendre sur le marché local

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
The lady Celina F. is a person who has worked very hard. For 5 years she has worked to manufacture and sell foods and tortillas in the Israel lewites market of Managua. She is a mother of 3 children, for which she has the responsibility to offer them an education, since they all study in the grade school.

She began selling tortillas by walking around in the market, which incented her to buy her own location at the market until she finally obtained it. Nowadays, in spite of the difficult economic situation that she finds herself in, she has been able to do well, offering a variety of dishes in her business.

For two years, she has successfully completed loans with Ceprodel, from which she has benefited greatly by being able to supply her variety of dishes. In addition she has been able to offer an education to her children that need her so much. Her loan accounts receivable is 12 credits with Ceprodel.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Celina F. es una persona muy esforzada, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida y tortillas en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua. Es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles educación ya que todos estudian en la primaria.

Inició vendiendo tortillas a la intemperie en el mercado por lo que se propuso conseguir un local propio en el mercado hasta obtenerlo. Hoy en día a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviese ha podido salir adelante ofreciendo variedad de platillos en su negocio.

Desde hace dos años, ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado grandemente por el hecho de que ha surtido su variedad de platillos y además ha podido brindarle la educación a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella. Su cartera crediticia es de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To buy materials for making foods for sale.

loans.name: Munilaty

texts.en: Munilaty A. has been a hairdresser for 6 years.  She is married and supports 2 children.  Munilaty is requesting $525 to purchase hair creams and hair extensions to meet the her customers' demands.  She hopes this loan will increase her income so she can better provide for her family.  Munilaty is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase hair cream and hair extensions.

loans.name: Marry's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Marry is 40 years old and is single woman with 3 children, ages 16-20 years old. Marry is a soap seller, she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal selling and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en: Faaea F., 38, is married with 7 children.  Her husband is a driver at the airport.  She wishes to start selling produce (cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.) 5 days a week.  She will use her loan to purchase weed killer, a wheelbarrow, cabbage seeds, tomato seeds, pumpkin seeds, cucumber seeds and peppers.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Isménia

texts.pt:
Isménia S. is 44 years old and married. She was born in Maputo, has 5 sons, and attended school until the 6th grade. She lived with her mother until she was 19. In 1980 she got married and moved to Malhampsene.

In 1994 she began a business of selling shoes which she acquired in Swaziland and in the RSA. She made her sales on foot in the city of Maputo. After some time the business wasn't yielding as well as when she first started so she decided to switch to selling staple products in 2004. Currently she has 2 small commercial establishments.

She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of Hluvuku. She solicited a loan for 22,000MT to grow her business acquiring more products and soft drinks.

Isménia opens her business at 7:00am and closes at 7:00pm. She purchases her products from warehouses in Maputo and uses rental vehicles to transport her and her goods back home. Currently she employs one worker, a father of 2, who cares for the second stand.

The most productive times for her business are weekends, end of the month, and the summer when the average daily receipts varies from 900MT to 1,200MT. Her most lucrative products are the soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. She uses a book register to control her inventory and sales receipts.

Her monthly profit margin is 9,000MT, and with this income she can pay off her loan, the salary for her worker, school expenses for her children, replenish her stock, and transport her goods. The other expenses, especially household expenses, are covered by her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Isménia S., de 44 anos de idade, nasceu em Maputo tem 5 filhos rapazes, estudou até 6ªclasse. Viveu com a mãe até aos 19 anos e em 1980 junta –se maritalmente e passou a viver em Malhampsene Até então. Em 1994 inicia o negócio de venda de sapatos os quais adquiria na Swazilandia e na RSA . A venda era feita de uma forma ambulatória na cidade de Maputo , passado algum tempo, o negócio já não rendia tão bem como começou, dai que decidiu mudar de negócio passando a vender produtos da primeira necessidade, tendo a contecido este facto no ano 2004, conta actualmente com dois pequenos estabelecimentos comerciais. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através duma amiga sua que é cliente da Hluvuku, tendo desta forma aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 22.000,00mt para a ampliação do seu negocio aquirindo mais produtos da primeira necessidade e refrigerantes. Isménia S. abre o seu negócio as 7.00h e fecha as 19.00h, os produtos que vende adquire- os nos armazéns da cidade capital-Maputo e para transportar usa viaturas alugada que lhe levam até ao destino. Emprega actualmente um trabalhador pai de dois filhos para cuidar da segunda barraca. A época mais produtivao seu negócio é no fins de semana, fim do mês e no verão onde a receita média diaria varia de 900,00mt a 1.200,00mt sendo os produtos que dau mais lucros os refregerantes e bebidas alcólicas . para controlar o fluxo da mercadoria e o registo das vendas usa um livro de registo.. A margem de lucro mensal é de 9.000,00mt e com este rendimento paga o empréstimo, o salário do empregado, as despesas escolares dos filhos e o reabstecimento e o transporte de mercadorias sendo que as outras desepesas, sobretudo as domésticas são suportadas pelo marido.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Falatika

texts.en: Falatika A., 64, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and taamu business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Falatika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Also, she will use the loan for buying cement and timber for repairing her home.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq N. is a 31-year-old man who has been selling DVDs, TVs and other electronic goods since 2002. His store is in Sabirabad. He works as a teacher in the local school but his main source of income is electronic goods sales. He has applied for a loan of $800 to repair his store and improve the condition of it.

loans.use: To improve the condition of his store

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira is a 61-year-old single mother. She had 5 children who are now independent with families of their own. She currently lives with one of her daughters, whom she helps by paying for her accomodation in her home and they both work hard to get ahead.

Recently she has begun to loan out small quantities of money (between 100 and 300 soles). Previously she rented rooms, which did not produce an income. Therefore she chose to enter another bype of business, which is loaning money, and up to now it has been going well for her. She enjoys her work, because it is a way to get to know many people. She must do a lot of analysis when a new client comes before agreeing to loan them money.

She works to help her daughter and her grandchildren who are students, but also to feel useful to those who need her. She needs increased capital in order to continue this business. She will invest part of the money in her home as well, which needs several modifications.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Edelmira tiene 61 años, es madre soltera. tuvo 5 hijos que ahora ya son independientes y con familia, en la actualidad vive con una de sus hijas, a quien le dio ayuda brindándole alojamiento en su vivienda y ambas trabajan duro por salir adelante. Desde hace poco tiempo, se dedica a prestar dinero en pocas cantidades (entre 100 y 300 soles), anteriormente se dedicaba al alquiler de habitaciones, los mismos que no le producían ingresos; por lo que optó con otro tipo de negocio, que es el préstamo de dinero y hasta ahora le está yendo bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es un medio para conocer a muchas personas, ella debe analizar mucho cuando viene un nuevo cliente para acceder a prestarle dinero. Trabaja para ayudar a su hija y a sus nietos, quienes estudian, pero también lo hace por sentirse útil para con los que necesitan de ella. Requiere de mayor capital para seguir en este negocio. Así como también, parte del dinero invertirá en su vivienda que necesita de algunas modificaciones.

loans.use: Increased working capital for her business

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has a two-year-old daughter. His family lives in Melitopol where Oleg owns a small business selling cell phones and accessories in one of the local electric appliances stores. His enterprise has a very favorable location as the store is usually packed with customers, especially on weekends. Oleg has been in business for 6 years. Presently, he has about $1400 in inventory and his net profit is approximately $800. 

Oleg is seeking a loan of $1075 (5000 Grivna) to increase the assortment of merchandise at his stand. In this way, he hopes to increase his income and provide a better livelihood for his family. Oleg has promptly repaid all previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine, which will secure a timely repayment of the current loan as well.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Uyimwen

texts.en: Uyimwen Vincent U. sells beef at the market in her community. Uyimwen is 48 years old and married with four children. Her eldest son is married and is a furniture maker. The other children are in school. She says that she and her husband are doing their best to give their children a quality education. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more beef for sale. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Kork village in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a widow with three children.  One is a worker while the others are attending school.  Mrs. Nem S. owns a small restaurant where she sells soup to the villagers and passengers.  

Although she and her working child have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well.  In order to improve her living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Miguel F. me dedico a la venta de frutas y verduras, tengo 42 años de edad, tengo 4 hijos, a parte de las frutas y verduras tamebien vendo huevos, palomitas de maiz y golosinas de galletas y confites, tengo varios años de tener mi negocio el cual me ayuda mucho a contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar, tengo muchas ganas de superarme y hacer crecer mi negocio, por tal razon es que estoy solicitando credito para poder inyectarle capital y asi tener variedad de productos y un mejor negocio. en estas epocas de navidad se vende mucho las manzanas y las uvas quiero comprar varias cajas de este producto para poder venderlas.
texts.en:
Hello my name is Miguel F., I sell fruit and vegetables. I'm 42 years old and I have 4 children. Besides selling fruit and vegetables, I also sell eggs, popcorn, cookies candies and regular candies. I have had my business for several years now, which helps me to support my home with the expenses. I really want to do better for myself and make my business grow. For this reason, I am requesting a loan to be able to inject capital to my business and have a larger variety of products and a better business. During this Christmas season apples and grapes sell a lot, so I want to buy several boxes of these products to be able to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị N. 37 tuổi. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Hiện tại ngoài thu thời gian giúp đỡ vợ chăn nuôi, chồng chị còn đi làm thuê để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi N. is 37 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004 to invest in raising chickens. Currently, in addition to helping with raising livestock, her husband works as a hired hand to increase the family's income. At a stable income of 3,000,000 VND per month, her family has more opportunity to improve its living standard. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in feed for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ThienN. Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Bibihawa Group

texts.en:
Bibihawa is the group leader of the Bibihawa group. There are three members in this group. They would each like to receive money for their businesses.

M. Hamid and Bibihawa want to take a loan for their general stores. Anesa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and they all want to receive a loan for their business progress and they want to make their business larger.

They want to say that loans can help them progress in their businesses and make their businesses larger. They all thank Kiva for aiding the process of small loans in Afghanistan that supports poor people in this country.

loans.use: to make their businesses larger

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Estrellas " esta representado por la señora Yerma Paolita e integrada por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes rubros comerciales como a la venta D. ropa, comida, abarrotes, zapatos, cosmeticos, CDs., tarjetas , juguetes, medicamentos, pan y fruta seca . Dentro del ámbito laboral siempre existe la competencia pero ellas están concientes D. las obligaciones que cada una tiene, por lo que luchan día a día para obtener ingresos y para mejorar su calidad D. vida D. sus familias; es por eso que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda la confianza D. un crédito destinado a la compra D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas para poder incrementar sus ingresos y darles a sus familias una mayor comodidad. La socias tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios y conocen D. la responsabilidad y honestidad que se requiere para formar parte D. un grupo integro y confiable
texts.en:
The "Las Estrellas" [Stars] group is represented by Yerma Paolita and is maD. up of 15 members who are involved in various commercial activities such as the sale of clothing, food, groceries, shoes, cosmetics, CDs, cards, toys, medications, bread and dried fruit. Within the workplace there has always been competition but they are aware of each person's obligations, for which they struggle day by day to gain income and to improve the quality of life of their families; It is for this reason that the Fundación Agrocapital offers them the confidence of a loan intended to purchase merchandise, supplies and tools in order to be able to increase their income and to improve their families' comfort levels. The partners have experience working in supportive groups and know the responsibility and honesty required to be part of an upright and trustworthy group.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Transactions

loans.name: Rukhsana Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is the wife of M. A. and has resided in a city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Rukhsana baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a local school. Rukhsana baji belongs to a family of farmers, so she mostly spends time with her buffalos and taking care of them. Presently she has two buffalos at her house. She gets milk from them and sells it to the milk shops. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand the milk-selling business

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rubina Naz baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business. Safaide baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow D. is married and has six dependents. He has received schooling through senior high. His wife is a seamstress.

Ekow sells car spare parts and other items like engine oil at Komenda Junction near Elmina, which he has done since 2006. He uses his income to provide food, clothing and other basic needs of the family. Ekow will use this loan as additional capital to increase his sales of spare parts, engine oil, and related items to meet the increase in demand from his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ekow plans to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy additional car spare parts, engine oil, and related items to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Married with six children, Monica T. supports her family by owning a restaurant in the heart of the market in Momo. She has been a GHAPE member for several years and this loan will be her fourth from the organization. This loan will allow Monica to purchase additional plates, bowls, pots, trays, spoons and oil as well as to pay taxes on the restaurant.

Monica is determined "to cook the best that [she] can," and so with that mentality and the convenient location of the restaurant, her business will continue to succeed as well as benefit her community. To keep her customers returning, she opens early when most people open their shops at the market.

On a personal note, Monica has faced many illnesses in her family and the deaths of her brother and one of her children. She and her family also struggle with her husband's sudden blindness and the financial difficulties in sending the children to school. However, she plans to use the profits of her loan to confront such challenges, by paying her children's school fees, completing construction on their house and providing better medical services for the family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy additional plates, bowls, trays, and pots, and pay taxes on her restaurant.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their two children. Rami has been working in home construction, specifically cladding, since 2004. Rami has requested a loan of $1,600 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cladding supplies for his work. This is the first time that Rami has requested a loan.

Rami is engaged in his business because he wants the best for his family. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase cladding supplies for his work.

loans.name: Jane Nabaale‘S Group

texts.en:
Jane is the leader of four members of a group. She is a 25-year-old, married with two children aged between 3 and 7 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she lives with four people. Jane doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Jane operates a restaurant in Nakulabye, one of the Kampala surburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Jane buys all her food requirements from Nakulabye market and so doesn’t pay for extra transportation to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and for her residence. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her.

Jane has been with MCDT for over two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more saucepans, plates and cups. She is aspiring to open another eating establishment.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans, plates and cups for her restaurant

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita V. is from the village of Purok 2, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Carmelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business raising cops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional corn seeds & young crops to raise. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used for the education of her three kids. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the education of her three kids

location.town: Purok 2, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Guendelyn

texts.en:
37-year-old Guendelyn C. of Banga, South Cotabato started her farming business 10 years ago. In addition, she’s still able to manage her hog-raising project. Her determination to support her husband in raising their two children pushes her to strive well in life. Presently, the business is self-financed by Guendelyn. As the business is growing, so are the expenses.

She is currently in need of additional capital to purchase other farming necessities. Thus, she applies for a loan in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to PHO 10,000.00. She was greatly encouraged by CEVI’s mission to help small business grow. With this great favor she enjoys at CEVI, she is optimistic that a better future awaits for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, and is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and pay for her children's tuition.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es: Doña María G. tiene 51 años D. edad, es soltera D. oficios en servicio,  “Molino D. Nixtamal”, habita junto  a sus hermanas, lleva 10 años D. brindar los servicios   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento D. Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda D. su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención D. comprar más Activos y D. esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones D. vida
texts.en:
María G. is 51 years old, single, and lives with her sisters. Her occupation is operating a grain mill, something she has been doing for ten years. She lives in Paraje Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala.

The demand of her clientele has grown but her economic situation is not sufficient to increase her capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more materials. In this way she can increase her sales. She hopes to be able to further her family's situation and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital (Grain Mill)

loans.name: Liên

texts.en: Liên Thị N. (no. 010117130026) was born in 1975. She is a widow and lives in Xom Trong, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her 13-year-old son. She is a farmer, and she also has a business selling refresher (a kind of dessert made with sugar, green bean flour, grilled rice, black bean, etc.) in the market. Liên Thị N. works very hard to earn money to raise her son. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her refreshment bar.

loans.use: To expand her refreshment bar.

loans.name: Luon

texts.en: Mrs. Luon R. is a villager in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder to make duck eggs to sell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chea Mao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In his plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is far from irrigation system. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Luon R. decided to ask for a loan to buy pump machine and she would use the rest of money to a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. She is a 42-year-old mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pump machine and she would use the rest of money to a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa Margarita Téllez C. tiene 42 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y amorosa con sus 3 hijos actualmente todos estudian y están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos, ella disfruta cada día salir a ofrecer sus productos ya que cada uno de sus clientes tiene diferentes necesidades además, sus disfrutan conversar con ella. Ella dio inicio hace mas de 7 años por lo que todos los días por la tarde salía de su casa para buscar nuevos clientes y mejorar su forma de vida, y así fue que poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que ella solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, sombra, cremas, colonias y prendas de oro laminado. Su deseo es establecer una tienda para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Margarita Téllez C. is 42 years old. She is a hardworking and loving woman with 3 children who are currently in school and in her care. She sells cosmetics, and enjoys going out every day to offer her products, conversing with her customers who each have different needs. For 7 years she has left the house each afternoon to look for new customers and improve her way of life, and this way her business gradually grew. The financing that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase lipstick, eye shadow, cremes, colognes and gold-plated jewelry. Her desire is to establish a store that would supply the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josué es socio del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Josué es viudo, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Josué tiene un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Josué necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos y el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los sueños de Josué son comprar otro carro mas moderno.

loans.use: Para la compra de neumáticos y el mantenimiento de su carro.

loans.name: Olayemi

texts.en: Olayemi sells shoes and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She uses part of her profit for the family upkeep. She is 42 years old and married with three children.  She hopes for a loan of N40,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita F. owns and operates a clothing business, buying and selling ready-to-wear items in her community. She is 46 years old and married. She is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. Lita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Yolla

texts.en:
Yolla is a 20-year-old single woman. Eight years ago she decided to begin working early as a hairdresser to help her family with the household expenses. And in 2005, she opened her own beauty salon to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Today, Yolla is requesting $1,000 to buy cosmetics products requested by her clients.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mr. K. is 34 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. (K. was busy at his business activities when the photo taken, so his wife is in the picture instead.)  He is a father of three children, all of whom are going to school and dependent on him. He is married to Sokny, 31, who produces rattan cupboards for sale. 

K. owns a vehicle which he uses to pick up ice cream to sell along the streets around his community. He usually earns approximately $3.60 each day. Currently, their income is not adequate to support the needs of the entire family. K. hopes to earn more revenue by operating a new business line, but he does not have enough capital to start it. He is requesting a loan of $500 to be used as capital to invest in selling sugar-cane juice.

loans.use: To invest in the selling of sugar-cane juice

loans.name: Arua Hill Cell Driwaru Juliet Group

texts.en:
D. Juliet is just twenty-two years of age, is single, and is a businesswoman. She deals in bitengi (wax-print cloth worn like a sarong). She has been running this business so far for five months.

Juliet is using the loan to purchase more bitengi from the Congo. She is bringing in real quality wax bitengi to her customers. She is winning market share because the quality wax-print material is causing her business to boom and is increasing her profits.

Juliet is an active and hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to struggle hard and live a good standard life.

loans.use: To purchase more bitengi from the Congo

loans.name: Pastora Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Pastora Idalia tiene su propia pulpería en el municipio de Nagarote en León donde vende todo tipo de productos comestibles y a pesar que dicha pulpería no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias como estantes y vitrinas, ella continua esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los productos azúcar, frijoles, aceite, arroz, verduras y pan para ofertarlos en la pulpería. Ella espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera contribuirá al desarrollo y mejora de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Pastora Idalia has her own grocery store in Nagarote, León department, where she sells all types of food items, even though the store does not have ideal conditions, like display cases and shelving.
