She continues to make an effort to improve her business' condition. The funds will be used to buy products like: sugar, beans, cooking oil, vegetables and bread to stock her store. She is confident that the loan will be approved so that she can continue to develop and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice, vegetables and bread.

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: A. Sabine est née le 2 septembre 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin. Sabine vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, depuis sa naissance. Mariée à ACLASSATO François, un chauffeur, Sabine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Sabine a un autre enfant à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sabine n’a fait que l’école primaire. Depuis près de 20 ans, afin de contribuer à assurer les charges familiales, Sabine vend des tissus à son domicile, mais aussi par le système de distribution. Sabine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Sabine a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sabine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité. Sabine ambitionne plus tard acquérir un refrigérateur et diversifier son activité par la vente de jus de bissap, bière, et de la glace.
texts.en:
A. Sabine was born on September 2, 1966 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Sabine has been living in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou ever since she was born. Married to ACLASSATO François, a chauffeur, Sabine is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. She is also responsible for one other child. The couple share in supporting their family.

Sabine only went to primary school. For about 20 years, in order to contribute her part to supporting the family, Sabine has been selling lengths of cloth out of her home and also as a hawker. She gets her wares in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She has already received and correctly reimbursed one loan from ALIDé. Wishing to meet the growing demand from her clientele, Sabine is requesting another loan from ALIDé to bolster her little business. She hopes later to be able to acquire a refrigerator and diversify her business by selling a hibiscus-flower soft drink (bissap), beer, and ice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of cloth for re-sale

loans.name: David 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Charlot is the coordinator of her group, David, and her story is representative of her group and generally representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, a community where the economy centers around sugarcane cutting and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure alone as a widow with grown children.

Charlot is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling a variety of items. She will use the loan to purchase pants, shirts, perfumes, deodorants, and skin creams. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with block walls. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, creams, deodorants, perfumes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Eulalia tiene un puesto en el mercado D. Carmen alto en donD. venD. papa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Eulalia se dedica a L. siembra D. papa que venD. en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. fertilizantes.
Los sueños D. Eulalia son comprar una camioneta para transportar sus productos y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Community Bank. She is married, 35-years old, and has a son. She has a stall in the Carmen Alto market where she goes daily to sell potatoes. She also grows potatoes which she sells in Lima. Eulalia needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy fertilizer. Her goals are to buy a truck to transport the produce, and to have her son get a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos García de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa vende dulces ellos tienen 3 hijos de 17, 13, 7 años. 

Carlos aprendió desde pequeño el oficio de maestro constructor pero al crecer como no tenía suficiente ingresos decidió invertir sus pequeños ahorros en dulces y venderlos a sus vecinos. 

El sigue ejerciendo el oficio de maestro constructor pero en ocasiones también atiende su pequeño puesto de dulces con su esposa. Vende caramelos a $ 0.10, chupetes a $ 0.25, etc. Uno de sus oídos ya no le funciona y le es de dificultad para atender su puesto de dulces. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y piedra para poder el mismo construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de dos pisos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Carlos García, 47, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; his house is cement and has all basic utilities; his wife sells candy and they have three children, who are 17, 13 and 7 years of age, respectively. Carlos learned how to work in construction when he was a young boy but, as he got older, he saw that this work did not produce enough income so he decided to invest his meager savings in candy to sell to his neighbors. He still works in construction but sometimes also tends to his wife’s small candy stand. He sells candies for $0.10, lollypops for $0.25, etc. He can’t hear in one ear and this is a problem for him in tending to his candy stand. He will use the funds to buy cement and gravel so that he can make some improvements to his home. In the future, he’d like to have a two-storey house and have his children continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Leilanie's Group

texts.en:
Leilanie G. is 40 years old and is from the town of Quimalabasa Norte, San Agustin. She is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Leilanie G. Group.

Leilanie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leilanie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Leilanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Tres Marías porque la comunidad en donde inicio esta ude se llama así  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de covadonga chalco en el estado de mexico.  El grupo está conformado por: Guadalupe R. R., Lucina  González García, Irma Hernández A., Maria de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez, Gilberto M. C., Hortensia C. S., Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez, Maria Magdalena M. S., Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez, Juana B. Sánchez, Maria Josefina S..

El representante del grupo se llama Guadalupe R. R. tiene 37 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, y tiene en total tres  hijos dos mujeres y un varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de pan y necesita el préstamo para  comprar charolas, pinzas bases para colocar su pan.  Sus clientes se encuentran a gusto con su negocio por que se encuentra a un costado de una tienda y alrededor no hay un negocio similar.
La señora Guadalupe R. R. desea este préstamo para invertir su negocio, y de esta manera  aumentar sus ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

La señora Maria de Lourdes Pérez  Sánchez forma parte del comité de este grupo, ude tres marias.Ella tiene 39 años estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, y tiene en total tres hijas.  Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos en un puesto que esta en la esquina de su casa  y necesita el préstamo para arreglar su puesto y así tener mejores ingresos y de esta manera poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Sus clientes le dan preferencia por que les gusta  el sazón de sus alimentos y sobre todo su higiene.	

Los otros nueve integrantes quieren el préstamo para acrecentar tanto sus ingresos como su negocio de la cual ejercen diversas actividades, como por ejemplo:Lucina González García (bisutería de temporada), Irma Hernández A. (productos de belleza y joyería de fantasía), Gilberto M. C. (abarrotera), Hortensia C. S. (venta por catalogo de ropa interior ,fajas,etc), Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez (venta de productos de belleza por catalogo), Maria Magdalena M. S. (venta de zapatos por catalogo), Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez (venta de dulces),  Juana B. Sánchez (venta de blancos por catalogo), Maria Josefina S. (venta de ropa interior).
texts.en:
This "development unit" (UDE) is called Tres Marías, named after the community in which this UDE began. UDEs are groups of 10 or more people who have a bank account and that have to meet either weekly or biweekly to make payments. There is a representative and a committee that governs each group. This group is located in the community of Codvadonga Chalco in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of: Guadalupe R. R., Lucina González García, Irma Hernández A., Maria de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez, Gilberto M. C., Hortensia C. S., Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez, Maria Magdalena M. S., Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez, Juana B. Sánchez, Maria Josefina S.. The group representative is named Guadalupe R. R. and is 37 years old. She studied until the 6th grade, and has three children (two girls and one boy). She sells bread and is taking out this loan to buy trays and clips to put her bread on. Her clients really like her business because it is next to a store and there isn't a smilar business around it. Sra. Guadalupe R. R. wants this loan to invest in her business and through this investment increase her earnings to help her children with their education and to provide them a better quality of life. Sra. Lourdes Pérez Sánchez is part of this groups committee. She is 39 and studied until the 6th grade. She has 3 children. She sells Mexican snacks from a stand that is on the corner in front of her house and needs this loan to fix her stand to help increase her income. This way she can help her husband pay for household expenses. Her clients like the quality of her snacks and above all the cleanliness of her stand. The other nine members of the other 9 members of this group want to take out this loan to increase their business incomes that come from a diverse range of activities like: Lucina González García (seasonal jewelry), Irma Hernández A. (beauty products and fancy jewelry), Gilberto M. C. (groceries), Hortensia C. S. (underwear), Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez (beauty products), Maria Magdalena M. S. (shoes), Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez (candy), Juana B. Sánchez (linens), Maria Josefina S. (underwear).

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials for their businesses

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai R. and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Tun, have been married since 1985. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. One of them is married, one is a construction worker, two attend school and the other is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mai was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is shown instead.
Mai has been a construction worker for more than 20 years. He works in his village and the nearby district. Mai has requested a Kiva loan once before. He is now asking for his second loan of $500 to concrete his house's foundations.

loans.use: To concrete his house's foundations

loans.name: Carrie

texts.en: Carrie B. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 59 years old. Carrie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carrie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Carrie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Carrie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carrie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carrie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Carrie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
José Antonio M. R. is a 21-year-old pepper producer who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in northern Costa Rica. José is a dedicated producer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of Cayenne peppers. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking and cleaning and caring for younger siblings. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting – working the land as needed. The land they work is their own.

In addition to his agricultural activity, José spends some days working as a labourer in the nearby orange producing factory in order to supplement the family income, but this work is sporadic. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and buys food. The rural zone where José and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. José is working hard for the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which José and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbours help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labour and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by José with the help of his family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. José will need roughly one year before his peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest. 

In the past, it has been difficult for José to gain access to financial services and technical advice regarding farming practices. This has been a factor that has hindered his ability to be as productive as possible. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity for José, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, José wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighbourhood.

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Chepkwony

texts.en:
Chepkwony is a mixed farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 38 years old, married, and has been blessed with 4 children ages, 4,6,10 and 13. All the children attend school. Chepkwony has been farming for the past 17 years and employs 2 farmhands. He produces milk, tea, and chickens which he sells locally.

His biggest challenge has been tick control which is a major hurdle, especially for certain breeds like friesian, and the fluctuation in the prices of milk which makes it hard to budget.

Chepkwony has requested his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 60000. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. This means more income for the family therefore improving their living standard.

In the future, he would like open a retail shop for him to sell his milk, and to purchase a motorbike to transport his farm products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rices, sugar, bread, soft-drinks, beans, soap, cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos que se llaman Miriam, Jonathan, Alex, y Dayona.  

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejorara la situación económica de comprar insumos. Su sueno es comprar una tierra propia.  Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, una en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

En su tiempo libre arregla y hace todo las cosas en la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the municipality of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She has four children called Miriam, Jonathan, Alex and Dayona. Maria is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús communal bank. There are 15 members in total, most of whom work in agriculture. Maria works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys and sells produce in the municipality of Ventanas. She requests a loan to buy raw materials for her agricultural business. The loan with improve her financial situation and enable her to buy raw materials. Her dream is to own land. A challenge she faces in her work is pests attacking corn crops, in particular the "longosta" type. In her free time she tidies her home and does the housework.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for agriculture.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La Señora Noemí se dedica a las labores del hogar, su esposo, el señor Martin es muy trabajador, el trabaja como chofer de un autobús de transporte de personal. Ellos adquirieron una vivienda de interes social y poco a poco y con ahorros han logrado hacerle algunas mejoras, han pensado en construir una habitación mas al frente de la vivienda, es por eso que solicitan este crédito, para empezar la construcción.
texts.en:
Señora Noemí does housework. Her husband, Señor Martin, is very hard-working. He works as a bus driver, transporting passengers. They acquired a house in subsidized public housing, and little by little, using their savings, they have succeeded in making it somewhat better. They have thought about constructing an extra room at the front of the house, and this is why they are applying for this loan, to begin the construction.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Cuando su esposo fue despedido del trabajo la Sra. Nelly se preocupo mucho, ella trabajaba en casa pero no le alcanzaba el dinero, peor aun por que cobraba cada 15 días y el dinero era poco para los gastos familiares. es asi que decide trabajar por su cuenta al principio lo hizo ayudando a una señora que vendía comida pero poco a poco aprendió el negocio y lo hizo por su propia cuenta compro algunas ollas pequeñas y una mesita así empezó a cocinar y vender comida a los trabajadores de un paradero de transporte publico, ella tenia  mucho miedo de fracasar pero se sorprendio cuando le falto comida para empezar fue un exito, eso fue un gran impulso para seguir adelante su negocio ha crecido ahora tienes muchos comensales la mayoría son choferes y cobradores quienes consumen lo que ella prepara como comidas y sopas, ahora que hace frio vende mucho, se siente feliz por que de esa manera ayuda a su esposo para que sus hijos puedan estudiar a la vez que también ha mejorado su casita lo que ella quiere es tener su propio restaurante aunque le da temor hacerlo esa es su meta para un futuro cercano, su préstamo le servirá para comprar sus ingredientes ella compra sus insumos por mayor de esa manera ahorra mas y sus ganancias son mayores, “ MADRES LADEREÑAS” es un grupo nuevo ella es la presidenta recién nombrada y espera trabajar junto a sus 10 compañeras todas viven en la zona de Puente Piedra Lima Perú.

La Sra Nelly es la tercera de las paradas esta con chompa rosada y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
When her husband lost his job, Sra. Nelly was greatly concerned. She worked from home but did not earn enough money. What made things worse was that she accumulated family expenses every 15 days, but there was not enough money to cover them. Nelly decided to work by herself at first, but then she began helping another woman sell food and gradually learned the business. She bought a few small pots and a table so that she could begin cooking and selling food to the workers at a bus stop. Nelly was afraid of failing, so she was surprised when she ran out of food because she had gotten off to a great start. She is determined to move her business forward now that she has many customers, most of whom are drivers and fare collectors who buy the food she prepares. Nelly prepares meals and soups, which she sells more of now that the weather is colder. She is very happy that she can help her husband with paying for their children’s education and making improvements to their home. Nelly wants to have her own restaurant in the near future even though the thought makes her apprehensive.

Her loan will be used to buy ingredients and supplies in bulk, which will help her save more and generate better earnings. The Communal Bank “Madres Ladereñas” is a new group and Nelly was recently named its President. The group consists of ten members who plan to work together. They all live in the district of Puente Piedra in Lima, Peru.

Sra. Nelly is the woman in the back wearing a pink sweatshirt and gray vest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies in bulk

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Thuong T. L. is 37 years old and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Xuan Non Commune. She has been running a delivery service by mini truck for 5 years. She has been very successful in this kind of business. Having been a client of the SEDA credit program since 2004, she has used loans very effectively to invest in her business. Now she wants to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy one more truck to meet increasing demand.

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly es un cliente que ya trabajo varias secuencias  en la institución,   ella se dedica la venta de frutas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de el alto, su negocio esta ubicado en la zona 16 de julio,  a unos pasos de la famosa plaza 16 de julio, la feria de el alto es muy famosa en toda la ciudad de La Paz  por la gran diversidad de productos que tiene, en la feria se puede encontrar desde agujas hasta partes de aviones, la señora hace traer las frutas desde la región de yungas zona muy accidentada por la misma topografía, la señora invertirá el crédito en la compra de frutas, la mercadería de la señora tuvo un accidente hace tres meses en ese accidente tuvo una perdida cuantiosa en su capital pero ahora la señora se restableció económicamente,  pero la señora pese a esa desgracia no se da por vencido y sigue trabajando. La señora tiene dos hijas una mayor que sigue estudiando y una pequeña que sigue cuidando.
texts.en: Nelly is a client who has already worked for various cycles with the institution. She is dedicated to selling fruit at the various markets in the city of Alto. Her business in located in the July 16 zone, a few steps from the famous July 16 plaza. Alto's market is very famous in all of the city of La Paz due to its great variety of products. At the market, you can find everything from needles to airplane parts. She brings fruit from the Yungas region, a very rugged area of the same topography. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruit. Nelly's merchandise had an accident three months ago. In this accident, she took a substantial loss to her capital but now she has reestablished herself economically. Despite the misfortune, Nelly has not given up and she continues to work. She has two daughters: an older daughter who is studying and a small daughter who she still takes care of.

loans.use: Purchase fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Concepción

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Concepción G. R.  ella se dedica al negocio de Venta de Verdura y granos básico tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de verduras y granos  para su negocio y así  ampliarlo,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Concepción G. R. sells vegetables and basic grains.  She has been doing this for four years.  She is married, and she has three school age children.

She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL.  She has used each one of them to buy vegetables and grains in order to expand her business.  The loans from CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her.  This is the way she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Clara Berta

texts.es: Clara Berta tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio pues ella es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora. Inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia pues necesitaba este negocio para mantener a su familia, ya que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. El mayor desafío que enfrenta es problemas de salud, ya que todos los días se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y todo el día pasa de pie realizando su labor. Este crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Clara Berta is 26 years old and sells tortillas. She has been in this business for more than three years. Being a determined and hardworking person, Clara started her business of her own initiative because she needed to support her family. She has one young child under her care. Her greatest challenge has been health problems. Every day she wakes up at 5am and works until 7pm, working the entire day while on her feet.

This loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, and a grill among other items.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: 8 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de enero está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Suyen del Carmen A. Áreas de 25 años tiene una tortillería desde hace cinco años y destaza cerdo. Ella trabaja junto con su madre en ambos negocios la cual es de gran ayuda principalmente para sustentar a sus cuatro pequeños a los cuales desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Karla M. Aragón de 30 años comercializa cosméticos desde hace un año y Gricelda Maudalena R. Solórzano de 24 años tiene una pequeña venta y vende sopa.
texts.en:
The "8 de enero" ["January 8"] group is made of of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people. One of them is Suyen del Carmen A. Áreas, who is 25 years old. She has operated a tortilla business for five years, and she also butchers pigs. She works together with her mother in both businesses, which is a great help to her, above all in supporting her four little children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life. 

The other members of the group are Karla M. Aragon, age 30, who has sold cosmetics for one year, and Griselda Maudalena R. Solórzano, age 24, who has a small sales stand and sells soup.

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in Lahore, which is located in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. Shahida lives there, in the area named Ismail nagar, with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 6 years ago. 

Her husband runs a stationery shop in the market, where he sells books, notebooks, pencils, ballpoint pens, etc. His shop is well-known in the area because he keeps all the necessary items in his shop to fullfil the timely needs of his customers.

Shahida herself is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients on order. She learned this art of sewing from a sewing school at an early age and became an expert by much practice. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. She is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are studying by attending a local school. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his stationery shop business. With the loan, he will buy the stationery items in bulk quantity, which will help him make more sales and income. Shahida is hopeful that by investing a loan in his stationery business, her husband will successfully be able to grow his business, which will help her family to live a better standard of life. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pencils, notebooks, books, etc., for the stationery shop business

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor’s economic activity is agriculture, to which he has dedicated himself for several years. He is married and the father of 5 children. Abdujabor learned farming business from a young age and now has a lot of experience. His business requires a lot of effort, which is why he dedicates himself to growing potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. Abdujabor is requesting a loan from IMON International to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Walter

texts.es:
Luis Walter B. M. tiene 37 años, Es casado vive con  la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Walter B. M. is 37 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has 3 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito precinct, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Luis Walter is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.

The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land. 

Luis Walter likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José Damián, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con esposa, ellos aun no tienen hijos, José tiene 25 años  de edad, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cultivo de maíz, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 5:00pm todos los días de la semana, su oficio permanente es la ganadería ya que los cultivos los realiza solo para la temporada de sembrar.
Él actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tres terneros, que valen $150.00 cada uno, su compra es con el objetivo de crecerlos y engordarlos para dentro de algún tiempo poder venderlos a buen precio, esta inversión le ayudara a tener dentro de algún tiempo una ganancia producto de la venta de estos terneros que comprara.
Las aspiraciones de José Damián son continuar con este negocio de ganado, multiplicándolo sus ganancias para sacar a delante a su familia con una condición estable.
texts.en:
José Damián lives with his wife in San Rafael Oriente, in the San Miguel department. They do not have any children. Jose is 25 and raises livestock and grows corn. His work schedule is from 6:00 am - 5:00 pm, every day of the week. His permanent job is ranching, since he only grows crops during sowing season.
He is requesting a loan for the purchase of three calves, which are worth $150.00 each. In this purchase, his goal is to grow and fatten them in order to sell them for a good price. This investment will help him to make a profit from the sale of these calves.
His dreams are to continue with this livestock business, multiplying his earnings in order to get his family ahead with stable conditions.

loans.use: the purchase of three calves

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Reimundo Antonio

texts.es: Reimundo tiene su negocio que es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de de 6 años que tiene este negocio,  dedica a la comercialización de granos básicos, pues siempre se ha dedicado a brindar los mejores servicios. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos ya que gracias al gran esfuerzo que realiza es que ha mantenido a su familia.  El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz y concentrado. El desea tener una pulpería grande, pues ha sido muy difícil cumplirlo pero con persistencia sabe que podría lograrlo.
texts.en: Reimundo has his own store which sells dry beans and grains. He has had this store for over six years now. He sells dry beans and grains there. He has always sought to provide excellent customer service. He is responsible for taking care of his two young children. This is not the first time he has requested a loan. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family. With this loan, he plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and other items. He would like to have a bigger store one day. He hasn't been able to reach this goal so far but he knows that if he sticks with it, one day he will reach his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for his store

loans.name: Jorge Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas tiene 60 años de edad, tiene nueve hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Leonidas es músico y toca la guitarra en su agrupación musical, él también tiene un pequeño restaurante turístico en su domicilio. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Leonidas invertirá el dinero del préstamo para comprar insumos para el restaurante y también para comprar instrumentos musicales. El sueño de Leonidas es triunfar como músico y construir otro restaurante.

Leonidas pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 60 years old, has nine children, and was born in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is a musician and plays his guitar as part of a musical group. Leonidas also manages a small tourist restaurant in his home. He has had this business for twenty years and has done very well. Leonidas will invest the money from this loan to buy supplies for his restaurant as well as acquire musical instruments. He dreams of succeeding as a musician and building another restaurant.

Leonidas belongs to the Communal Bank “Yahuar Maqui”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his restaurant & acquire musical instruments

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con sus padres, es soltero y se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas especialmente pipián, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre ya que el señor se dedica a esta actividad, Francisco tiene 3 periodos de estar sembrando pipián y al mismo tiempo trabaja como ayudante de un taller de serigrafía. 
El solicita un préstamo para sembrar pipián en manzana y media de terreno, para lo cual necesita comprar los insumos como abono, semilla y fertilizantes, con esta inversión espera que este cultivo sea abundante.
Las aspiraciones de Francisco es aumentar la producción, tener más terreno para cosechar más y mejorar los ingresos para ayudar a sus padres y cubrir sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Francisco is a young man of 20 who lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department with his parents.  Francisco is single and his business is growing vegetables, especially 'pipián' (a type of squash).  He learned the business from his father.  Francisco has three periods when he sows 'pipián' and, at the same time, he works as an assistant in a silk screen printing workshop.

Francisco is requesting a loan to sow 'pipián' on just over two and a half acres of land.  He needs to buy supplies such as manure, seeds and fertilizers.  He hopes that this investment will help him produce an abundant harvest.

Francisco's aspirations are to increase his production, to own more land so that he can grow more, and to improve his income so that he can help his parents and cover his own personal expenses.

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds and fertilizers to grow 'pipián' (a type of squash)

loans.name: Carlos Diego

texts.es:
Carlos Diego A., siempre ha sido un luchador y se ha caracterizado por su optimismo y ganas de salir adelante. Desde joven se había desempeñado realizando oficios varios en diferentes empresas; después de un tiempo y con la esperanza de tener lo propio decidió darle vida a su negocio de asados que actualmente acredita gracias a su sazón. 

Actualmente Carlos Diego está ubicado en las afueras de una placa polideportiva, lugar de donde lo reubicarán debido a la construcción que realizarán en el sitio, para ello requiere de un préstamos pues de estar en la calle en un puesto de venta pasará a un local que requiere de algunas adecuaciones que deberá cubrir de su propio dinero, así como comprar exhibidores y una nevera.   

El gran reto que tiene es aumentar el reconocimiento de su negocio en el nuevo local, organizarlo muy bien y ofrecer nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Carlos Diego A. has always been a fighter. He is characterized by his optimism and desire to get ahead. From a young age, he has carried out various jobs in different businesses. After awhile, with the hope of having his own enterprise, he decided to start the business grilling meat that he currently has established thanks to his special touch for cooking.

Currently, Carlos Diego’s stall is located outdoors next to a sports field. He has to relocate from this place because of construction which will be carried out on the site. He needs a loan because his business will be in a location where he will have to make some modifications with his own money. In addition, he wants to buy display cases and a refrigerator. His big challenges are increasing his business’ recognition in the new location, organizing it there and offering new products.

loans.use: to pay for modifications to his stall at a new location.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a algunas de sus clientes que trabajan durante el dia y además porque a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender y que lleva 7 años dedicada a esta labor.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y es la fiscal de pagos del banquito.
 
Sus metas son tener un carro y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Mi Banquito’ has meetings every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for the diversity of local products recognized within and outside of the country, like the well known ‘toquilla palm’ straw hats, also called ‘Panama Hats’ even though they are made in Ecuador. 

There we met Mrs. Gloria who is 32 years old, married and has a four year old son. Her husband is an artisan and works with ivory nut. She sells Avon and Yanbal products like cosmetics, perfumes and ladies’ accessories. She works three morning a week because it is cooler, and in the evenings, because her husband can take care of their son. She sells door to door, takes orders and gives credit to be paid weekly. She has been doing this kind of work for seven years and loves it. 

She will utilize the loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, jewelry and other products. She has been with the bank since its inception and is the person who oversees the payments at the bank. Her goals are to have a car and to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg S. is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvs province, Mongolia. 

Her four sons go to a local secondary school while the only daughter stays home. 

Her husband is a herder. 

Oyuntsetseg owns a grocery trading business in her town. She sells many kinds of grocery items such as vegetables, drinks, candies and some dairy products as well. She has been managing her business for 10 years and has gained much experience. Now her monthly net profit is 150,000 to 200,000 MNT. 

As a result of her successful business operation she had been able to buy a car and some livestock for her husband. 

She is a polite woman who says, "I want to have my own house in the future." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT  loan to purchase garlic, potatoes and some other grocery items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase garlic, potatoes and other grocery items

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a farmer who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. Her husband is also a farmer and driver. 

According to Renita, she and her husband has been growing rice for 28 years. Recently, they have been earning approximately 3900 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. Her husband also earns extra money from driving. Renita does her best to improve their family's income. 

She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. K. is twenty seven and married.  She has four children and she hopes they are able to receive a university level education. 

Jane sells fish at a busy market in Kisumu.  Kisumu is the region of Kenya that includes Lake Victoria, and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.  She has been operating this business for three years, and manages to employ another person.  Jane says the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Jane is using this loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more fish to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes to grow her business and open a hotel where she will serve fish and other types of food.  She describes herself as hardworking, strong and persuasive.

loans.use: To buy more fish to grow her business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 53 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 32. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Beatriz is also a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Beatriz also raises pigs in her backyard. She built a small piggery that she hopes to expand soon. Beatriz sells her pigs at the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for her rice field and to feed her pigs. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Kerenke

texts.en: Kerenke grows wheat and is also a livestock trader. He lives with his wife and their two children. Kerenke is seeking a loan from KADET to buy farm supplies and more livestock as he doesn’t have enough money to do this. This would be a big help and allow him to expand his business by increasing the number of animals he possesses. His goal is to work hard to support his family and, above all, to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and more livestock

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past three years, Dama has operated a business selling kikois (an East African version of a wrap or sarong) from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dama dreams of expanding her business in the future. She plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of khangas (a traditional type of dress amongst women in central/east Africa) for sale. Dama decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of khangas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild his factory's iron-pillar rooftop with stone.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, del Distrito y Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 79 años, está casada y sus hijos ya son independientes.
Cuando su esposo se enfermó y ya no pudo trabajar, la señora decidió poner un negocio en su casa y administrarlo ella misma, mejoró sus habitaciones y las implementó para alquilarlas como hospedaje, pues tiene la ventaja D. que su casa está bien ubicada. Ahora se dedica al cuidando D. su esposo y a administrar su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1500.00, comprará sábanas y productos D. limpieza.

La señora Mercy  es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es continuar con su negocio que le permita solventar sus gastos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad a mujeres como ella D. hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mercy belongs to the “Brigada Ramírez” Communal Bank, in the district of Provincia D. Lamas, department of San Martin.  She is 79 years old.  She is married and her children already live on their own.

When her husband became ill and was unable to work, Mercy decided to establish a business at her home and manage it herself.  She improved and furnished her rooms in order to rent them out as lodging.  She also has an advantage because her home is in a good location.  Now she takes care of her husband and manages her business.

With this loan of S/. 1500.00, she will purchase sheets and cleaning products.

Mercy is a creative and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to continue her business, which enables her to pay her expenses.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering women like herself the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and cleaning products.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es: Esta clienta es originario de la comarca cruz de apante es una productora desde hace varios años, trabaja con su marido quien se encarga de las actividades agrícolas ya que también son pequeños ganaderos combinando las dos actividades ósea la actividad agropecuaria, el terreno donde siembra esta señora son herencias de sus padres, quien explotaban el terreno en la misma actividad ya que fue enseñada por sus antepasados, y de esa manera solicitan financiamiento cada ciclo para apoyarse en los costos de producción y de esa manera han mejorado sus condiciones y nivel de vida su núcleo familiar son 3 hijos de  los cuales una de ella tiene un hijo, quien convive en la misma habitación , dichos trabajos los realizan de manera familiar con sus hijos y su esposo, solo cuando la actividad demanda mayor fuerza buscan mano de obra no familiar y específicamente hombres por el tipo de actividad.
texts.en:
This client is from the Cruz de Apante region and has been a producer for a number of years, working with her husband who handles the agricultural business, since they are also small-scale livestock farmers, having the two businesses, that is, crop and livestock farming. The land where she plants her crops was an inheritance from her parents who utilized the land for the same purpose, as they were taught by their ancestors. Thus they are seeking financing during each cycle for help with production costs. In this way they have improved their living conditions and standard. 

Her nuclear family consists of three children one of whom has a child, who shares the same room. Said work is carried out by the family, her children and her husband. Only when the work is more demanding do they turn to non-family labor, and specifically men based on the type of activity.

loans.use: to prepare the ground and purchase inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 43 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Glenny

texts.en:
Glenny is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Glenny has a shop that sells beverages, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Glenny has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Glenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. Three of the children work.

Ali has been an owner of a blacksmith and painting workshop since 1990. He repairs and paints old and new cars body. He has more than 20 years experience in this field. He has a good reputation, a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a balancing machine for cars. He is trying to develop his work by adding modern machinery to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Louise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Louise est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Louise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants, et contribuent ensemble aux diverses charges du ménage. Louise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Louise prépare de la nourriture (riz et du haricot) qu'elle vend dans une école du Sud du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Louise vend des produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Louise s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Louise désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Mahugnon group is comprised of three people who all live together in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Louise, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time this group has sought financial support from Alidé with the intention of expanding their business.

Louise is 46 years old and is married to a mechanic by the name of Jean. The couple has five children, all of them under their care and in school. Louise and her husband live together with their children, and both contribute to the various household expenses. Louise did not attend school. Louise prepares food (rice and beans) that she sells in a school in the south of Benin. In addition to this business, she also sells various goods from her home, which allows her to keep up with the needs of her family and to provide for them with little trouble.

Louise purchases her supplies in one of the markets of Benin. With the intention of better meeting customer demand, Louise wants to increase her stock. In order to do so, she is seeking a fourth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Mahugnon group.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beans, and various goods.

loans.name: Octovianus

texts.en:
Octovianus is 45 years old, married and has three children: Marlensi, 22, is attending university; Rumly, 21, is working; Ivantri, 16, is in the first grade of technical high school.
Octovianus is a vegetable farmer. He has been working as a farmer for years. He is cultivating “Kangkung” vegetable, which he sells to his regular customers and is consumed by his family. Octovianus usually harvests the crop after 30 days. 
Currently, Octovianus plans to try another business – that is, raising pigs. He is thinking that the business is a good opportunity for him to generate more income in the future. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Octovianus will spend the loan on piglets to be raised and on fodder. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Olga; La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de artesanía, ella vende en la plaza principal del pueblo junto a otras artesanas todos los días, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de artesanía para poder vender a los turistas que visitan el bello poblado típico de Andahuaylillas. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Las Emprendedeoras de Andahuaylillas." The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Olga. She is 30 years old, single, and has one child who's 5 years old. She makes a living buying and selling handicrafts. She sells in the main plaza of the small town together with other craftswomen every day. This time she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of handicrafts in order to be able to sell to the tourists who visit the beautiful village typical of Andahuaylillas. She would like the loan to invest in buying handicrafts to sell.

She is thankful for the loan and has committed to honoring the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to invest the in purchase of handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Villa Rica Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Rosa, tiene 34 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos pequeños. Ella forma parte del grupo Villa Rica formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito de Carabayllo, en la zona de Villa Rica.
Ella se dedica a la venta de chocotejas, inició su negocio hace dos años, aprendió la preparación en una institución que brinda apoyo y capacitación a las zonas con menos recursos en Lima, como toda persona emprendedora e innovadora para aumentar sus ventas empezó a  variar  los modelos de los chocolates, por lo que es requerida para la preparación de chocotejas para ocasiones especiales o con motivos especiales.
Gracias a su trabajo ha brindado estudios a sus hijos y comprar artículos de primera necesidad para su casa.
Una de sus metas es tener un negocio propio o una pequeña empresa de chocolatería.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en insumos para la preparación de chocolates para poder atender los pedidos que ya tiene en espera.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Rosa, 34, is single and has three small children.  She is a member of the communal bank Villa Rica which is comprised of seven members from the Carabayllo district in the Villa Rica area.

She sells "chocotejas" (chocolate covered pecans or nuts and caramel) for a living and started her business two years ago.  At an institution in Lima that supports and trains low-income communities she learned how to make the chocolates.  Being the enterprising and innovative person she is, in an effort to increase sales she began to introduce variations of the chocolate and now has many chocoteja orders for special occasions and events.

Through her work she has been able to give her children an education and buy essential items for the household.  One of her goals is to have her own business or a small chocolate company. She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare the chocolates so she can fill the orders she already has.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chocolates.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, she runs a mobile-phone money transfer business (M-Pesa).  She has been in the business for seven years and has employed three people.  Besides, she runs a cafeteria for extra income.

Monicah hopes to become a successful business lady.  She needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to add "float" to her business.

loans.use: To add "float" for her mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Upendo A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo A group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the Upendo A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rosemary takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rosemary will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Rosemary is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with five children. 

Lourdes is making and peddling viands such as fried fish, mongo soup and escabeche . She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, él realiza cultivos de maiz, vende la cosecha y tambien realiza labores de jornalero.
Actualmente esta solicitando un prestamo para la compra de laminas para el techo de su vivienda, ya que esta cambiando el techo y quiere dejarlo más seguro, este prestamo le ayudara para solventar esta situacion, realizando la compra y mejorando las instalaciones de su vivienda.
Su aspiracion es ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien, por eso se mantiene buscando trabajo de jornalero o sembrando maíz para poder generar ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: José is a farmer who lives with his wife and four children. He cultivates corn, sells the harvest and also works as a day laborer. He is requesting the loan to purchase metal sheeting for his home's roof, since he is replacing it and wants to make it more secure. This loan will help him solve the situation by purchasing the sheeting and improving his home's facilities. His goal is to help his children, who are in school, so he will keep looking for work as a day laborer and plant corn to be able to earn income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets for his home's roof.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 30 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hentii province, Mongolia. He started his transportation business in 2007 with his own car.  Now he owns a van and does transportation across the countryside. However, his van's engine broke down. Therefore, Batbold is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to replace the engine and to replace his tires to enable the van to survive the harsh Mongolian winter. Batbold is a sharp and hardworking man who says"It has been horrible since my van broke down. I need to act aggressive in order to make this right".

loans.use: To buy an engine and winter tires for his car

loans.name: Rosa Lidya

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, sus hijos tiene 20, 16, 14 años de edad, Rosa se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, es rentable porque a través de él ha podido generar ingresos, aprendió con su familia porque es un oficio que practican todos.
Ella necesita comprar varios sacos de semilla de marañón cruda, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, obteniendo la cantidad necesaria de semilla para continuar en el negocio.
El sueño de Rosa es mejorar en lo económico con su familia, ayudando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and three children, ages 20, 16 and 14.  She has been selling cashew seeds for four years and has been able to earn a profit and generate an income.  She learned the trade from her family who are all involved in it.  

She needs to buy several sacks of raw cashew seed and is requesting a loan to carry out the investment.  This will allow her to continue with her business.

Rosa's dream is to improve her family's economy and help her children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She resides in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Merlinda owns and operates a retail store, selling clothing in the local community.  She has been in this business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Merlinda is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlinda hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Tereza Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Tereza, es habitante del municipio de Tipitapa labora como auxiliar contable, es madre soltera y está muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha brindado AFODENIC atraves de los fondos  KIVA, ya que con el primer préstamo ella logro hacer un muro en su vivienda y con el segundo el piso de su casa, ahora el tercer crédito lo necesita para comprar 600 bloques, 18 bolsas de cemento, un viaje de arena, 2 quintales de hierro, para realizar un cuarto en la parte trasera de la vivienda con este progreso su condición de vida verá mejorada tanto para ella y sus hijas.

loans.use: Para comprar 600 bloques, 18 bolsas de cemento, un viaje de arena, 2 qq de hierro.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Etho is a twenty-seven-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Mwangaza Solidarity Group, which has five members, all women. Etho sells soft drinks. She has been in this soft drinks business for the past five years.

She established her business to help support her children in school. Etho is married and has three children who all go to school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Etho and her group members need a loan totaling $1,750. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Etho plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes that educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Etho and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

Etho is standing on the left in the group picture.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo de 23 años, y su negocio es la frutería.
Ella es amistosa, fuerte y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes poblaciones del altiplano que se caracterizan por su ambiente seco, frio y casi de naturaleza inexistente, muy inhóspito.
Marcelina es de tez morena, físico delgado y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en su entorno familiar y también n las poblaciones que visita, habla español por cultura general, su vida la comparte con su hijo que es policía, viven en la casa de su hijo que es alquilada y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de fruta de temporada, como; plátanos, papaya, manzanas, piña y otros, actividad que realiza ambulando en poblaciones alejadas donde no existen estos alimentos, vende por mayor y al menudeo, “inicié vendiendo en una provincia donde tenía familiares, al ver las buenas ventas me aventuré a otras poblaciones más alejadas…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque los lugares que visita no producen fruta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con buenas ventas diarias, la desventaja son los cambios bruscos de clima. Su sueño es contar con mayor cantidad de fruta y comprar un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar fruta por mayor para incrementar su mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelina solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta por mayor para vender en poblaciones alejadas.

loans.use: para comprar fruta por mayor para vender en poblaciones alejadas.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a businesswoman and also runs tailoring lessons for rural girls who have failed to get school fees for their secondary and college education. Mercy does this at a cheaper fee and this has attracted many village girls to enroll in her enterprise.  The loan of $200 from PEMCI will be used to procure fabrics and materials to enable her meet such orders. The income from her sales is supporting the training of these girls and some of her peers who will one day be able to support themselves and contribute to the community development at large. She teaches her peers on means of sustainining themselves and income generation techniques to nenable them fight the burden of poverty which is a common scourge in the society. PEMCI is proud to be associated with the work that Marcy is doing and thus we are always ready to give mercy a hand whenever she needs our help.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Abdul Adies

texts.en: A.  Adies lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is living with his own family. He is married. He is a tailor and this is how he supports his family. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take a individual loan to buy new sewing machines and take a new shop in some busy area of Kabul to attract more clients and make good monthly income. He lives in a rented house and he needs money for rent. He wants to work hard to earn more money to solve his financial problems.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Maria Oristela

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria Oristela. I am an entrepreneur who owns a small grocery store in my home, named "El Triangulo". I have owned this for several years. It generates the income I need to contribute to the household expenses. I have three children and they are all going to school. Most importantly, this business allows me to take care of my children.

At this moment, I need to expand my range of products to offer a better variety to my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Maria Oristela, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia "El Triangulo", actividad que realizo desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, tengo 3 hijos y todos estan estudiando y lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mi familia.

Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase shortening, pasta, rice, sugar, corn meal, instant soups, diary, chicken, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yedigar

texts.en: Yedigar is a 28 year old resident of the town of Saatli. He is single and lives with his parents. He buys cattle, raises them in his parents' yard and sells them to the local market or to butcheries. He has been in this business for two years. As cattle breeding is traditional in  his region, it can bring in a good income. Yedigar wants to develop his business further and increase the number of cows he owns. He is therefore requesting a $500 loan with which he can buy two more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Ni Putu Sukadani

texts.id:
Ni Putu Sukadani lives in Manistutu, one of the town at south Bali. It is located at a geographical location where most of the people work as a farmer, especially for Clove. usually the men will go out and work, and the female will stay at home and take care of the family, and only follow them when there is a harvest. However, Ni Putu Sukadani is not like the rest. She does not want to wait for her husband to put food on the table, therefore she started farming pigs. To increase her the quality of her yield, she has obtained financial assistance and training from Dinari. Recently, her sow had just given birth to 10 piglet. She intends to buy high quality pig feedings to fatten her pigs. And she will also used it to renovate her pig sty. Ni Putu Sukadani is optimistic that this will work out, therefor she works hard to ensure that this will increase their living standard.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Sukadani tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa yang ada di Bali barat. Desa Manistutu adalah salah satu desa di Bali barat yang kondisi geografisnya berada di ketinggian sehingga banyak penduduknya yang berprofesi sebagi petani, khususnya petani cengkeh. Kaum lelaki pergi ke kebun untuk mengolah tanah perkebunan dan kaum wanita tinggal dirumah untuk merawat anak dan keluarga. Biasanya kaum wanita di desa ini akan ikut ke kebun kalau pohon cengkeh sudah berbuah dan siap di panen. Ni Putu Sukadani adalah sosok wanita yang gigih dalam mengarungi hidupnya.
