Ia tidak ingin hanya tinggal dirumah berdiam diri dan menunggu suami datang dari kebun. Untuk membantu menambah pendapatan keluarganya, Ni Putu Sukadani memelihara babi dirumahnya, khususnya babi jenis lokal. Untuk meningkatkan kwalitas dari usahanya, Ni Putu Sukadani mendapat pelatihan dan pinjaman modal dari Dinari. Saat ini Ni Putu Sukadani memiliki seekor induk babi yang baru saja melahirkan 10 ekor anak. Pinjaman yang didapatnya akan digunakan untuk membelikan pakan yang lebih baik dan bergizi, karena selama ini masih memberikan pakan tradisional sehingga pertumbuhan babinya tidak optimal. Selain itu, pinjamannya akan digunakan untuk memperbaiki kandangnya yang sudah rusak. Dengan perencanaan yang baik, Ni Putu Sukadani optimis akan berhasil dengan usahanya. Karena itu, ia melakukannya dengan tekun dan yakin usaha ini akan dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan hidup keluarganya.

loans.use: Membeli pakan babi yang berkwalitas dan memperbaiki kandang - To buy quality pig feedings and renovate pig sty.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana C. lives in Anticrético in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz with her two children. She works as a distributor of food and dietetic products. Mariana has problems at home given that, during construction, the kitchen and bath areas presented filtration problems that are proving inconvenient both for her family as well as their neighbors. The loan she is seeking would be to repair the affected areas of the house. This is her first request for credit, and the financial analysis completed indicates that she would qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mariana C. vive en Anticrético en la zona de Tembladerani ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus dos hijos; la señora Mariana trabaja como distribuidora de productos alimenticios y dieteticos. La señora Mariana tiene problemas en su domicilio, ya que con el tiempo de edificación, las áreas de la cocina y el baño presentan filtraciones que están provocando inconvenientes tanto para su familia como para sus vecinos. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de la instalación sanitaria y la refacción de las áreas afectadas en su domicilio. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Make repairs to kitchen and bath areas of her house.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has a business selling popular cookies and candies from a rented space at the city market in Kahovka, Ukraine. She carries a nice selection of delicious cookies – from jelly cookies to chocolate covered delights –  as well as Ukrainian made chocolate bars and boxed candies. Cookies and candies are popular snacks with tea in Ukraine and boxed candies are frequently given as gifts for special occasions so there is always a good demand for the products Oksana sells. Oksana is married and has two teenage children. Her business is a good source of income for her family. 

Oksana requests a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory for her business. She hopes to see good sales and income while meeting the needs of many customers.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Igamba East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene K..  She is currently in the business of trading new clothes and is requesting a loan to get a permanent place for business.  Irene is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man.  She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 11 and her children go to school.  Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to trade more clothes, both new and old  

Irene is joined in her small group by Florence B., Mutesi S., Mutesi Mwamini Madina Namukose and Joweria N..  Florence B. has a local restaurant business and wants to start up another restaurant in town.  Mutesi S. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to set up more charcoal stalls in new places.  Mutesi Mwamini is a  fish monger and wants to start a brick laying business.  Madina Namukose is currently in the business of retail shop and waragi brewing and is requesting a loan to buy more drums and straws for brewing waragi. Joweria N. sells sugarcane and intends to start up a charcoal business with the loan.

loans.use: To expand clothes business and make more profits

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Diatou is the mother of a family. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Hathioume in the Ziguinchor region for 6 and a half years. She sells brooms made in the traditional style from saplings. She has received 13 previous loans, all of which she repaid without difficulty. With the income from her business, she is able to support her family. Diatou is asking for this loan to strengthen her business and intends to repay it at the end of six months in one payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972, Diatou est mère de famille. Elle est membre du BV de Hathioume dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demie . Elle vend des balaies de fabrication artisanale faits à partir des tiges d'arbre. Elle a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté .Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce elle entretien sa famille.Diatou sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule fois.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Biubwa

texts.en:
Biubwa is 27 years old and is married woman. Biubwa conducts small business, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa D. owns a canoe and has employed fishermen to work for her. She is married and has four children. Business is going very well but the cost of the fuel that she uses to run the canoe has increased and it has affected her income.

She is asking for additional capital to help her buy more fuel to run her canoe’s motor.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to run her canoe’s motor.

loans.name: Faamuamaga

texts.en: Valeai Suataai, 38, is married with 7 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the Taro, taamu and bananas business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Valeai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Also use for buying cements and timbers for home repairing

loans.use: buy chemicals and pesticides, timber, iron roofing, nails, cement, bricks, furnitures

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
Shahla is a 34-year-old woman. She previously received and repaid a share of a group loan which she invested in her husband’s flower-making business. Since he has had this business, Shahla has always helped her husband with making beautiful flowers and selling them. However, Shahla’s real profession is beautician. She has 20 years' experience in this field. Ms. Shahla has also received a certificate for this profession. She has applied for a loan and wants to open a beauty shop in her neighborhood.

Shahla has 5 children. One of her young daughters works with Shahla, helping her with the beauty parlor. With a bulk individual loan, Shahla wants to open a shop and hire two more workers for her salon. Shahla has a lot of customers at home. She believes that by having a shop outside her home, she will not only keep these customers but will also find new customers. She will also use the loan fund to purchase beauty material and cosmetics to complete her shop equipment.

Shalla lives in a rented house. One of her immediate goals for the near future is to make enough money to get a mortgage on a house and not pay thousands every month in rent. She is also confident that her work will go well and that she will be able to buy a car which she and her husband have dreamed of forever.

loans.use: To purchase beauty material and cosmetics to complete her shop equipment

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley worked with another woman selling juices. It was this that allowed her to learn the trade, and with the financial support of her father, she decided to put a soda fountain in her home three years ago, offering juices, desserts, and, sometimes, meals. She also dedicates herself to selling polos made by the father of her son. The loans she has received in the past have helped her invest in her business. Shirley would like to expand her soda fountain operation and offer various meals every day of the week.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Shirley trabajaba con una señora vendiendo jugos. Fue así que aprendió esta labor y, con la ayuda económica de su papá, decidió poner una fuente de soda en su casa hace 3 años. Ella ofrece jugos, postres, y algunas veces, menú. Shirley también se dedica a vender polos que fabrica el papá de su hijo. Los préstamos le han servido para invertir en su negocio. A ella le gustaría poder ampliar su fuente de soda y ofrecer menú variado todos los días.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling juices and desserts / Para invertir en su negocio de ventas de jugos y postres.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед, 1982 года рождения. Он  женат и имеет 1 ребенка.  Начал свою деятельность в продаже ювелирных изделий как помощник своему родственнику, который торговал этим видом товара. Затем они с братом решили открыть собственный бизнес – продажа ювелирных изделий. Местом его деятельности является оптовый рынок «Корвон», магазин «Мир Золото» города Душанбе. Джамшед в этой сфере работает 5 лет. В его ассортименте товара можно увидеть разнообразные золотые серьги и кольца, браслеты и цепочки и кулоны производства России, Турции и Индии. Он закупает товар у поставщиков из Дубая, России и Узбекистана. 
Джамшед услышав о программе Кива захотел участвовать. Он хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, Jamshed is married and has a child. He began his entrepreneurial activity by helping his relative sell jewelry. Then, his brother and he decided to open their own jewelry business. He sells jewelry at the Corvon wholesale market and Mir Zoloto store in Dushanbe. Jamshed has been in this business for 5 years now. Assortment of his goods includes a variety of gold earrings and rings, bracelets, necklaces and pendants made in Russia, Turkey and India. He buys his goods from suppliers in Dubai, Russia and Uzbekistan. Having learnt about the Kiva program, Jamshed wanted to participate and obtain a loan for a sum of $1200.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pendants

loans.name: Djimah

texts.fr:
Monsieur NAKPANE Djimah est née le 27 décembre 1975 à Bassar. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a pour activité, la vente de volailles et de tubercules d’ignames dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2002. Généralement, ces activités sont exercées par les femmes mais monsieur N. a une passion pour ce commerce. Il a souvent pris le crédit auprès de WAGES et rembourse toujours bien.
Ce quatrième crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 120 têtes de volailles et 150 tubercules d’igname afin de pouvoir servir ses clients et tirer un bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mister Djimah NAKPANE was born on December 27, 1975 in Bassar. He's married and the father of two children. His business consists in selling poultry and yams in the Agoé neighborhood. He started this business in 2002. Usually, such activities are practiced by women, but Mister NAKPANE is passionate about this business. He has already obtained several loans from WAGES, which he has always repaid without problems. The fourth loan he is now seeking will enable him to buy 120 heads of poultry and 150 yams to serve his clients and make a profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and yams

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mr. Khem B., 29, lives in the Pour Dos village in the Kandal province. He is the father of two children who are too young to work or study. He and his wife, Mrs. Khem Da, are tailors in the local village. They now face a small problem because they do not have enough sewing machines to make clothes for their customers. So Khem decided to ask for a loan to buy one more sewing machine for this purpose. His wife is pictured because Khem was busy with his business at the time.

loans.use: To buy one more sewing machine for their business of making clothes.

loans.name: Luis Norman

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Altamira de los semáforos lózelsa 4 c al Norte 1 c arriba, pues desde muy pequeño a ayudado a su familia a salir adelante pues por herencia de sus padres tiene una escuela de enseñanza de manejo vehicular, lo cual con los años ha logrado obtener muchas cliente que aprenden a manejar, y esos recomiendan a otros debido al buen servicios que le da, es casado, pero a un no le tienen hijo que espera con muchas ansias.  Para brindar un buen servicio  a sus clientes opto con prestar en Afodenic para tener mas recursos económicos con esta solicitud es la cuarta lo cual espera que sean muchas mas ya que se ha beneficiado con estos préstamo, esta solicitud la quiere para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo de practicas vehicular. A largo plazo es poder tener otro vehiculo y un joven que le pueda a ayudar a vender su servicios para crecer en ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luís is 33 years old. He lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua called Altamira in an apartment. Since he was very small he has helped his family get ahead and through an inheritance from his parents has a driving school, which has successfully obtained numerous clients over the years. The clients who learn to drive there recommend the school to others for the great service provided there. Luís is married, but does not yet have a child that he is anxiously awaiting.

In order to provide the best services for his clients he opted for a loan from Afodenic to ensure more economic resources. This loan is his fourth, which he hopes will be much more since he has benefited from his past loans. He desires this loan for maintenance on his vehicle from the practice fleet. In the long term he hopes to have another vehicle and an assistant that can help him sell his services to grow his sales and improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Buluh Sari Group

texts.id:
Beberapa orang yang berdomisili atau bertempat tinggal  di Desa Pangkung Buluh yang sudah membentuk kelompok dengan Nama Kelompok ” Buluh Sari ”. Dalam pinjaman pertama mereka mendapatkan keuntungan yang minimal yaitu antara Rp. 500.000,- sampai Rp. 700.000,- per 6 bulani. Walaupun demikian anggota kelompok tetap semangat untuk bisa melanjutkan usahanya. Oleh karena itu kelompok  Buluh sari tetap mengajukan pinjaman untuk periode yang kedua, dimana jangka waktu pijaman 6 bulan dan pengembaliannya pinjaman dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
Pinjaman yang kedua ini akan dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi unggul dan pakan babi yang akhir-akhir ini mengalami peningkatan yang sangat drastis. Sehingga anggota kelompok Buluh sari sangat memerlukan tambahan dana untuk kelanjutan usahanya.Dengan usaha beternak babi yang tetap dijalankan oleh anggota kelompok Buluh sari, maka mereka dapat menunjang ekonomi keluarga mereka yang nantinya dapat memperbaiki  keadaan ekonomi keluarganya khususnya dalam pendidikan anak-anak mereka.
texts.en:
Several prople who lives in Pangkung Buluh village who already build an club with the name: ” Buluh Sari ” group. From their first loan, they made a small profit, between Rp. 500,000,- to Rp. 700,000,- for the 6 month period (Translator's note: 1 US$ is about Rp 10,000-12,000). However, club members are still enthusiastic to continue their business. Therefore Buluh sari group still applies for their 2nd period loan, dor aperiod of 6 months, and loan return at the end of loan period. This second loan will be used to buy superior piglets and pig feed which has increase in price drastically lately. That is why Buluh sari members very much need the increased funds to continue their efforts. By pig farming that is continued to be run by Buluh sari club members, they could support the family economy, and better their family economic situation, especially in their children's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Superior quality piglets and feed (Bibit kwalitas unggul dan pakan)

loans.name: Gulnar Samina Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Gulnar samina baji is 23 years old and is married. She resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She completed her education until 8th standard, but couldn’t study further because of her father’s low income. Her husband name is A. G.. He is a mason.

Gulnar samina baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. None of her children go to school. Gulnar samina baji and her husband couldn’t afford to send their children to school because of their low financial resources. Her husband has decided to start a new grocery shop business. He chose this business because he has two years of experience in this work.

Gulnar samina baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for starting a grocery shop in the community to improve their living standards.

Gulnar samina baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy electronic items (refrigerator and television) on installments for her electronic items shop. Mahmoodan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Syeda baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Cham Reun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Cham Reun S. is the group leader of four members who all live in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing one more cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Vong Sopha, is a grocer who makes a little income to support the family. Mr. Cham Reun S. is 25 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are Kiva partner AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Elba Lidia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Elba H.  con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee a raíz de sus esfuerzos vendiendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos personales.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora Elba al haber iniciado su negocio hace cuatro años ha logrado surtirlo de productos y por esta razón anhela continuar mejorando las condiciones. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Cinco Pinos, city of Chinadega, Mrs. Elba Hernandez has been applying all her efforts into a convenience store she owns which offers all sorts of products ranging from food to personal care items. It is important to note that Mrs. Elba started this business four years ago, and throughout this time spam she was able to build up stock merchandise. Because she wishes to continue improving her living conditions, she decided to approach Cepodrel in order to benefit from a credit line that would be used to purchase additional products and provide the support her store needs to continue in business.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu S. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. She lives with the husband who is a pensioner and is also into farming. She has three girls and two boys. Three of the children are in school. Alimatu is resourceful and enterprising. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like diewuo. Diewuo is prepared from a powdered maize mix with dried cassava and is served with soup. It is enjoyed as a breakfast or lunch and is normally prepared by Muslims who live in the Zongo communities. 

She has a strategic business location, giving her favorable business sales. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and increase her income level. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like maize powder, cassava powder, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to facilitate her food production. She says thanks for your assistance. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyamekye’ which means ‘God who gives’. She is requesting a loan of GH 1000 to make her business progress.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like maize powder, konkonte powder, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier de gblinkomé, il exerce comme activité la confection de tricots sur lesquels il fait des dessins, il a ouvert à cet effet  son atelier qu’il a appelé TCHECOBA, il a commencé cette activité en 1994. La qualité de ses services fait qu’il attire tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Actuellement il a reçu  une commande d’un de ses clients mais il ne dispose pas de colorants pour faire ce travail, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 boîtes de colorants et des pinceaux. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in the Gblinkomé neighborhood. His business consists in knitting pullovers, on which he paints drawings. He started this business in 1994, and he opened his workshop called "TCHECOBA". Thanks to the quality of his services, he gets new customers every day. At this time, he has received an order from one of his customers, but he lacks the dyes he needs to execute the order. He's therefore seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 10 boxes of dye, and brushes. He's married and the father of 2 children, and this business enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of dye, and brushes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick A. is a 45 year old man. He is married and the father of six children who are currently pursuing education in senior and junior high schools. He trades in agricultural chemicals and sells various kinds like herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers.

Oda, the town where Patrick lives with his family, is a farming community and many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands and planting their crops.

Patrick is expecting higher profits if he receives the loan and wants to invest the loan to procure an increased stock of assorted agro-chemicals. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his children’s education.

He is a member of a group called “Papaye” (translated as “Goodness”) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. He is very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Toleh

texts.ru:
Толех  Элмирзоев животновод со стажем работы 15 лет. Ответственный человек и по отношению к работе, и по отношению к семье.
Дома имеет крупнорогатый скот, от перепродажи  которой он получает прибыль. А так же,  всегда дома у него есть молоко, мясо, творог и кефир.
 Жена Толеха Истат из молока готовит очень вкусный кефир, вкус которого нравиться ее детям и соседям. Соседи с большим удовольствием, покупают именно  кефир ее приготовления, а иногда и молоко. На прибыль, полученную от продажи кефира и молока, она покупает своим детям школьные принадлежности. 
А так же, Толех занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке своего района. Что приносит дополнительную прибыль в их семью. 
Хочет получить займ в размере 1600 сомони на 6 месячный срок, для откорма своего домашнего скота.
texts.en:
Toleh E. is in animal husbandry with experience of fifteen years. He is a responsible man towards his work and towards his family. He has large cattle at home and gets income from its resale. Also he always has milk, meat, cottage cheese and buttermilk at home. Toleh's wife Istat makes very delicious buttermilk from the milk and their children and neighbors like the taste. The neighbors buy her buttermilk with great pleasure and sometimes buy milk too. She uses the income which she makes from the sales of buttermilk and milk to buy school supplies for the children. Toleh also sells food on the regional market which makes additional profit for their family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic U., 29 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She lives in the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in southern part of the Philippines. She engages in peddling food like banana cue, camote cue (variations of cooked plantain rolled in sugar) and viands (tasty dishes). 

Marivic is a hardworking mother who wants to provide the needs of the family. Everyday she peddles her food to their neighborhood and nearby villages. Demand is increasing and business is getting better. That's why she wants to increase her food production.

She is planning to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 5,000 to purchase more ingredients and materials. This will help her meet the demands of her customers and generate a higher income. If granted, this will be Marivic's first loan with HSPFI. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her application.

loans.use: To purhcase ingredients and materials for banana cue and viands

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi sells foodstuffs and drinks. Oluwakemi is 31 years old and she is married, with a child. Oluwakemi lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Christina M. from Mbeya. She is single. Christina has been running a used clothes store since 2002. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Christina currently earns about US$90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Christina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
L. señora Leticia es casada con el señor José Ramón quien es pensionado y tienen una tiendita D. abarrotes desD. hace 1 año D. nombre “Abarrotes Leticia”; ellos son una familia unida y tienen una hija D. nombre Yesenia quien labora como capturista D. datos en una oficina, sus ingresos contribuyen con los gastos familiares.
Están tramitando este crédito para invertir en mercancía para el negocio familiar y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Leticia is married to Sr. José Ramón, who is a pensioner. They have a grocery store called “Abarrotes Leticia” (Leticia’s Groceries), which has been in operation for one year. They are a close family. Their daughter Yesenia works in an office as a data entry operator. Sra. Leticia’s income goes toward the family expenses.

Her loan will be used to buy merchandise for her family business, which will increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells rice. She has been this business for the past 3 years. Felicia is 32 years old, married, an has 3 children. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more rice in bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de races améliorées de porcs

loans.name: Eleuteria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Antonia es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac Totonicapan que se encuentra ubicado a 8 kilometros de la ciudad su actividad principal es el servico como comadrona conocido en nuestro medio como ( Partera) dicha actividad  es un don que Dios le regalo hace mas de  veinte años  al servicio de su comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para comprar algunos materiales mas modernos ya que hasta la fecha ha recibido capacitacion de parte del area de salud, la cual necesita de dichas herramientas para poner en practicas los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Doña Antonia is originally from the community of Patzarajmac Totonicapan, which is located 8 kilometers away from the city. She works as a midwife in the local area. Doña Antonia believes her profession is a gift that God gave to her more than 20 years ago so that she could serve her community.

Today she needs a loan to purchase more modern materials. The health care training she has received is up-to-date, but she needs these tools so that she can put into practice the knowledge she has acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for her midwifery practice

loans.name: Fritzel

texts.en: 31-year-old Fritzel J. is requesting a loan amounting to Php5,000 after she was recognized as an official member of ASHI last month in September. The loan she is requesting will be a great opportunity for her to start up her envisioned variety store business. Through having the said business, Fritzel is expecting she will take a part in the family's finances. She can augment her husband’s sporadic income from being a farm laborer, and therefore they can provide the basic and necessary things her four children (whose age range is from three to ten years old) need daily. When the time comes that her business has grown through loans she had received from ASHI, her profits will be her means to support the financial needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a variety store which she will be starting up.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old and married with four children aged 10 through 16 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Esther rears chickens at her home in Lugala and so doesn’t pay rent because she works from her home. She sells in the outskirts of Kampala and has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for three years.

Esther buys feed for her chickens from Owino market and so incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of feed. Esther wants to use this loan to buy more bags of feed.

Esther aspires to seeing her business grow stronger and to own 1,000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more bags of feed for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn income

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros; tienen una hija de 9 meses, y por el momento viven en una casa alquilada.

Para su negocio, un salón de belleza, alquiló un local hace 7 años y ahí realiza todo tipo de peinados, cortes de cabello, tintes, manicure y pedicure.
Lo que a Elsa le gusta de su trabajo es aprender lo último en moda y estar pendiente de las exigencias de sus clientes. También le es muy rentable porque su local se encuentra en una zona que es muy transitada, además cuenta con una gama de clientes regulares. Adicionalmente, Esla atiende a domicilio y así obtiene ingresos adicionales.

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque le brindaron la oportunidad de seguir adelante en su negocio, a parte que sus compañeros son personas muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará productos de belleza y materiales para cortes de cabello. Con lo que le reste ambientará su local adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27, and she lives with her husband. He works transporting passengers. They have a nine month old daughter. For the moment, they live in a rented house. Her business is a beauty salon. She rented the place seven years ago. She does all types of hairdos, cuts hair, does tints, manicures, and pedicures. What Elsa likes about her work is learning the latest style and to be devoted to her customers’ demands. It is also very profitable because her location is in a very busy area. Also, she has an assortment of regular customers. Additionally, Elsa gets additional income from taking care of customers in their homes. This is her second loan with MFP. She likes being part of her communal bank because it offers the opportunity to get ahead in her business, and her colleagues are very responsible people. She will use the money that she is asking for to buy beauty products and materials for cutting hair. She will use the rest to equip her place adequately in order to give her customers a better reception.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products and materials for her salon

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita C., 44, who lives and does business in Dasmariñas, Cavite. She is a multi-tasking entrepreneur, attending to an array of business activities.  She has been in business for fifteen years. Her husband, Ruperto, 49, is a salesman. They have two children who are both in grade school.

Carmelita owns a general store, which has been around for fifteen years. In addition, she buys and sells fresh pork meat and dressed chicken. Her neighbors order from her. She buys items from the slaughterhouse in large amounts and delivers to her customers. She makes it a point to ensure that the orders be served as promised, although she sometimes finds it difficult to recover unpaid debts from some customers. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing.  Her most recent business venture is bicycle rental. From all these activities, she earns more than PHP 32, 000 in monthly profits. She banks most of her income for future use, especially for her children’s education.

Her membership with the (CCT) Credit Cooperative has brought her a lot of blessings in life and in business. In anticipation of the upcoming holiday season, she has been receiving a lot of new orders for hog meat and chicken. To answer for her commitments, she will need additional capital. She has applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of PHP 31, 000.  This will be her sixth loan cycle with CCT. 

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for meat orders.

loans.name: Etbel Jeannette

texts.es: Etbel Jeannette B. D. U. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y comercializa ropa en su casa D. habitación, la cual ya tiene 15 años D. poseerla. Etbel ha trabajado en la tienda durante mucho tiempo siempre pensando en el bienestar D. sus hijos. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos D. primera necesidad y así mismo pueda comprar mayor variedad D. ropa para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Etbel Jeannette B. D. U., 40, lives in San Martín with her husband and two minor children. She has had a grocery store in her home for the last 15 years. Etbel has worked in her store for a long time with her children's welfare always topmost in her mind. This is why she is asking for financing in order to buy more basic need items as well as a larger variety of clothing for children and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables and clothing.

loans.name: Kebiri A Onziru Kilara Group

texts.en:
O. Kilara lives in Kebiri Village in Arua district. She is thirty-nine years old and is a single businesswoman blessed with five children of whom one is schooling.

Kilara carries out a grocery business dealing in tomatoes, onions, etc. She is using the loan to purchase more grocery items for her business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Geysell Yaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Geysell Yaneth M. P. es comerciante del Municipio de Condega, ella se dedica a atender su negocio una rosticería ubicada en este mismo municipio. 

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel  con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción como es el cemento y hierro para la ampliación de la rosticería ya que esta teniendo muy buena demanda por parte de los consumidores debido a su buena atención y calidad del producto. Ella empezó este negocio  hace 4 años después de salir de la Universidad, empezó con un pequeño local el cual ha ido ampliando con esfuerzo propio, ella empieza sus labores diarias todos los días de 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y casi siempre obtiene la ayuda de su mama.

Ella espera que con la compra del cemento y el hierro complete todos los materiales para poder hacer so construcción y tener mas ampliado su negocio y así tener mejor atención y ganar mas clientela.

Geysell es soltera tiene un hija de edad escolar a quien le financia los gastos escolares, también vive con ella su madre.

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita, con el que espera tener buenos resultados ya que pos cuenta propia esta muy difícil, de esto depende el éxito de su negocio y así mejorar las condiciones para poder trabajar mejor y alcanzar mejores condiciones para su familia
texts.en:
Geysell Yaneth M. P. is a merchant in the municipality of Condega. She makes a living tending to her rotisserie business, also located in Condega. She is requesting the loan form Kiva partner Ceprodel with the goal of purchasing construction materials such as cement and iron so she can expand her rotisserie since her demand is very high thanks to her good customer service and the quality of her products. Geysell started the business four years ago after leaving the university. She started with a small site that she has been expanding all on her own. She starts her work every day at 9 in the morning and goes until 9 at night and is almost always helped by her mother. Geysell hopes the purchase of the cement and iron completes all the materials she needs to do the construction and make a much bigger business so she can better serve and expand her customer base. Geysell is single and has a school-age daughter, and she provides for her daughter's education. Geysell's mother also lives with her. This is the first loan she has requested, and with it she hopes to have good results since she depends on the success of her business and improving the conditions will help her work better as well as improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand her business

loans.name: Anacely

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Anacely L. se dedica a laborar como trabajadora domestica siendo una mujer muy disciplinada y con gran amor al trabajo. 
Ella se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su casa y beneficiar a sus pequeños hijos que están estudiando. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos y también en el pago de la matricula del colegio para que ellos se preparen y en un futuro lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote, Sra. Anacely L. works extremely hard as a housekeeper. She feels that she is a very disciplined woman who has great love for her work.

Anacely strives to maintain her home and support her children who attend school. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy school supplies for her children and also pay for their high school registration fees. This will prepare them to be outstanding professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's school supplies & registration fees

loans.name: Maria Andalisa

texts.es:
Maria Andalisa A. T. tiene 30 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 5 hijos de 4 a 11 años de edad.  Su marido sale en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura sembrando mora y papas.  Tiene otros cultivos que crece solo para el consumo.  Vende la mora en la comunidad cuando vienen los comerciantes.  Vende las papas en el mercado en Guaranda.  El mantenimiento de la mora es muy dura.  Se rasga las espinas y lastima demasiado.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y liquidos para la mora.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien si es posible.  Tal vez tengan que trabajar en el campo con sus padres.  En los tiempos libres, le gusta tejer y coser.
texts.en:
Maria Andalisa A. T. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her five children ages four to eleven. Her husband appears in the photo. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries and potatoes. She also has other crops which she grows for her own consumption. She sells the blackberries when merchants come by the community. She sells the potatoes at the market in Guaranda. The upkeep of blackberries is very difficult. The thorns tear and it is very painful. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and liquid manure for the blackberries. Maria's dream is that her children will go to school if it is possible. They may have to work in the fields like their parents. In her free time she likes to knit and sew.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and liquid manure.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 33-year-old active lady, married and blessed with one child who attends school.  She has been running a retail shop where she sells cereals and household items. She has one employee to assist her in the business which is located in a very competitive environment. She also runs a salon to increase her earnings.  Previously, Regina was running a grocery store before she ventured into these businesses.  She is requesting Kes.80,000 to add stock in her shop, and she dreams of buying a farm in the future.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia I. González, vive en Costa hermosa con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años, ella es una mujer ejemplar y muy negociante, vende mercancía desde cuando tenia 10 años que su madre la impulsó y le enseñó este oficio, pues le gusta trabajar independiente y no se visualiza como empleada de una empresa; en la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $1.500.000, para unirlo a un ahorro que tiene y comprar artículos encargados como lavadora, planchas, aire acondicionado y víveres que venderá en proporción a las solicitudes realizadas por sus principales clientes, las amas de casa.
Ella desde hace mas de 10 años es conocida por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo como una excelente cliente, pero se había ido a vivir a Bogotá y hasta hace dos años regresó a esta organización para continuar creciendo en su negocio; con los apoyos de capital de trabajo recibido ha podido aumentar su oferta de servicios, su clientela y por consiguiente la utilidad que ha reinvertido y con la que ha podido educar a sus hijos y aun comprarle  un computador, para que no se queden fuera de los avances tecnológicos. En la actualidad está muy feliz porque su esposo tiene un buen empleo en el Departamento del Cesar  y sabe que ahora con mayor apoyo podrá cumplir con su sueño de organizar un gran almacén pues él está dispuesto a apoyarla.
Se siente orgullosa de ser negociante,  porque ha crecido personalmente y con ello ha sacado adelante a su familia, sobre todo en épocas en que su esposo no estaba trabajando. También está agradecida con la Fundación y dice que piensa adquirir su vivienda en villas de San Pablo, al igual que su gran almacén y de poner a estudiar a su hijo en la universidad  los cuales son 3 grandes desafíos. Una de sus metas mas cercanas es la de comprar un enfriador nuevo, porque también vende refrescos, mariscos  que almacena en su nevera y ya le esta quedando pequeña para los requerimientos del mercado.
texts.en:
Nubia I. González lives with her husband and three children, 12, 14 and 15, in Costa Hermosa. She is an exemplary woman and very good in business. She has been selling merchandise for the last 10 years when her mother inspired her and showed her the business. She likes to work independently and doesn’t picture herself as an employee in a company. Currently she is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 to put together with some savings that she has and buy items that were requested, like a washing machine, irons, air-conditioning units, and supplies, that she will sell according to the requests by her main customers, housewives. 10 years ago she worked with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and was an excellent client. But she had gone to live in Bogota and only two years ago returned to this organization to be able to help her business continue growing. With the working capital she has received, she has been able to increase the services she offers to her customers, and put the money into the business. She could take out enough to educate her children and even buy them a computer. She purchased this so that they would be knowledgeable about technological advances. Currently she is very happy because her husband has a good job in Cesar department and she knows that now, with more support, she can fulfill her dream of setting up a big store because he is ready to help her. She feels proud to be a businesswoman, because she has grown personally and has been able to help her family get ahead, especially in the periods when her husband wasn’t working. She is also grateful to the Foundation and says that she plans to build a house in the San Pablo development, along with her big store. Also she will send her son to the university. These are her three goals. One of her first needs is to buy a new refrigerator because she sells soft drinks and shellfish that she needs to store in the refrigeration. The one that she has is too small for the demands of the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household domestic goods requested, such as a washing machine, irons, air-conditioning units and supplies.

loans.name: Junica's Group

texts.en:
Junica B. is 25 years old and from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Junica is married and has two infant children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the market. Junica has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Junica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Junica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jesus El Salvador En Chaclacayo Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal Jesús el salvador en Chaclacayo se caractiza por tener socios emprendedores y optimistas, es el caso D. la Sra. Elena ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza hace varios años su objetivo es que sus hijos puedan tener sus estudios profesionales.
Iginia realiza su trabajo ambulatoriamente ella venD. sabanas, cubrecamas y ropa interior según el pedido, este trabajo no le aporta muchos ingresos es por eso que ella realiza trabajo en casa para poder ayudar a su familia.
La venta D. menú ayuda a Zara con la educación y mantención D. sus hijos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes, además y utensilios para su cocina ya que desea aperturar una tienda en el mercado, 
El grupo  agradece a KIVA y EDAPROSPO por los créditos recibidos. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
The savings group "Jesús El Savador" in Chaclacayo is characterized by having entrepreneurial, optimistic members. This is the case for Elena, who has been selling beauty products for a number of years. Her objective is to enable her children to study and be professionals. Iginia travels to sell sheets, bed spreads, and underwear to order. This work does not bring her much income so she also does domestic work in order to help her family. Selling food helps Zara with her education and caring for her children. She will use the loan to buy groceries as well as cooking untensils as she wishes to open a store in the market. The group is grateful to Kiva and EDAPROSPO for the loans they have received. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Sammilyn

texts.en: Sammilyn L. is from the village of San Jose. She is 32 years old. Sammilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sammilyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sammilyn has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 90,000 Philippine pesos per harvest. In 2005, Sammilyn joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sammilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Sammilyn is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Sammilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Sophan Yet Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people located in Thmey village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sophan Y. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use part of the loan to buy something that can support their businesses. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for growing crops to sell to support her family. She is also a pig breeder but her problem is that she does not have a place for her pig. So to improve her pig breeding, Mrs. Sophan Y. is applying for a loan to build a pigsty. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Phorn, is a fisherman. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a security guard for a private company, another is a laborer and the remainder are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To build a pigsty

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rolly A., 47, a jeepney driver, they are blessed with four children. Managing her own rag-making business for four years now, Stephanie makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that her family can have a better life. 

Luzviminda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently paying her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. Luzviminda will buy replenishment stock for her variety store. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a education for her children and be able to live a well-off life.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying additional threads, clothes and other related materials for sewing round rags.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch H. is 39 years old and is the village bank president. She was selected by its sixteen members who are located in Prey Phav village in Takeo province. With the loans, each member of this group will use the money to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Touch H. is a grocery seller who owns a small store through which she is able to earn a small income to support her famiL.. In order to increase her income, which will improve the famiL.'s standard of living, Mrs. Touch H. decided to ask for a loan.  It will be used to buy more groceries to enlarge her business, while the rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food for her new business. Her husband is a laborer where he receives a small salary to support his famiL.. This couple has five children; one is laborer, three are students and the youngest is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou M. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Marilou is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Marilou runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa se dedica a las labores del hogar, su esposo el señor José Margarito trabaja como obrero en una maquiladora. Tienen 3 hijos pequeños y una hija grande que también trabaja como obrera en una maquiladora, ella contribuye en los gastos de la casa. Sus tres hijos pequeños están en la escuela y la Señora Felipa necesita comprar los Útiles Escolares y Uniformes para los tres niños, es por eso que ella pide el apoyo de ustedes, para poder solventar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Felipa is a housewife and her husband, Sr. Jose Margarito, works in a "maquiladora" (a factory in a free-trade zone). They have four children: three school-aged children and one grown daughter who also works in a maquiladora. The oldest daughter contributes to the family budget. The three younger children are in school and Sra. Felipa needs to buy school supplies and uniforms for them. It's for this purpose that she is asking for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Ma. Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ma. Del Rosario, trabaja en una empresa ayudando en la limpieza, es una persona muy trabajadora, también vende ropa usada los fines de semana, la señora Ma. Del Rosario se divorcio hace tiempo, y ahora vive sola en su vivienda, ella quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes, pero el dinero que tiene ahorrado no le alcanza para surtir la tienda, es por eso que pide este crédito, para comprar todo lo necesario para la tienda, y así poder dejar el trabajo de limpieza y dedicarse solo a estar en su casa atendiendo la tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ma. Del Rosario, works in a private business where she helps with the cleaning. She is a hardworking person, and also sells used clothing on the weekends. Ma. Del Rosario has been divorced for some time and now lives alone. She wants to set up a small grocery store in her house, but hasn't saved enough to be able to fully stock the store. That's why she is requesting this loan, to buy everything necessary. She will then be able to leave her custodial job and dedicate herself completely to the grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment.

loans.name: Desimforados

texts.en:
Desimforados D. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 children: two are adult-aged and two are school-aged. To make a living, Desimforados owns & operates a general store. Desimforados has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Desimforados joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Desimforados has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Desimforados is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Desimforados from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret W. is forty two years old, single, and does not have any children yet. Her business is located at Juja, a busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She has been selling vegetables such as kales, potatoes, tomatoes, spinach, onions and cabbages for the last ten years to the local people, including shop owners, passers-by and students. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same business as hers. Customers are not loyal, as they are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to purchase a plot and build a residential house. She describes herself as God-fearing and honest.

loans.use: Vegetables.

loans.name: Matilde Angélica

texts.es: Matilde Angélica T. A. de 55 años de edad, trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos de primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ilopango, en el departamento de San Salvador. Matilde es una madre de familia muy responsable la cual vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 17 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Matilde desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que de esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, de esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para Matilde su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja de poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a su familia.
texts.en: Matilde Angélica T. A. is 55  years old and works in her own business, which is a store where she sells basic products such as bread, water, propane gas, medicines, and a few sweets. Her business is located in her house, in the municilpality of Ilopango, in the department of San Salvador. Maltide is a very responsible mother who lives with her husband and a daughter that is 17 years old and who is studying. Matilde wants very much to be able to stock her store well, because this way she could sell more and have more income. This is why she is requesting a loan, which she could use to buy all the products necessary to provide everything that her customers need. This way she could provide better service, which would be rewarded with more customers. Matilde’s business is very important to her because it is located in her home, which allows her to tend to it and at the same time be together with her family.

loans.use: Compra de productos comerstibles.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto Antonio M. él es Trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como conductor tiene  seis años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Roberto Antonio M. has been actively working as a driver for the San Rafael del Sur City Hall for six years.  He has had three loans through CEPRODEL and he has used the money from each one to buy building supplies to make improvements to his house.  This has benefited him very much because it’s allowed him to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Hannah Ekua Awotwe

texts.en: Hannah Ekua Awotwe O. sells smoked fish at Asenadze near Abura. Hannah has junior high educational background. She is married and has four children. She has been selling smoked fish for five years. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. She plans to build a house from the additional income from the loan received.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Bartola Ceferina

texts.es:
Bartola de 48 años, tiene un criadero de pollos para venderlos. Vive con su esposo e hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 8 años en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 13 años ella escogió vender pollos para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que su esposo es obrero y así poder pagar la educación de sus hijos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Su trabajo es criar a los pollos hasta que crezcan y venderlos a un mayor valor en la actualidad tiene 200 pollos pequeño que los cría y le da de comer balansiado para que crezcan sanos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos recién nacidos para poder criarlos y venderlos económicamente. En el futuro quiere comprar una pollera para vender a mayor volumen sus pollos.
texts.en:
Bartola is 48 years old.  She has a chicken farm where she raises chickens to sell.  She lives with her husband and her children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8 in Playas canton.  It is a tourist destination in Ecuador and has a wide range of seafood.

13 years ago Bartola chose to sell chickens so that she could spend more time with her children since her husband is a laborer and this way she could pay for her children's education.  She currently works from 6.00am to 9.00pm every day.  She raises chickens until they are grown and then she sells them for a higher price.  She currently has 200 small chickens which she is raising and she gives them balanced feed so that they grow up healthy.

She would like to use her loan to buy newborn chicks in order to raise them and sell them cheaply.  In the future, she would like to buy a henhouse so that she can sell more chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco, de 20 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Esté joven y trabajador hombre, hace un años que abrió su restaurante en sociedad con su padre. Por las mañanas vende platos a la carta y mariscos, ya por las tardes bebidas calientes, como café y mates. El negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias a Marco, diariamente vende 60 platos de comida, sin contar las bebidas calientes por las noches, que todo poblador de Palca consume, ya que el frío en ese lugar es insoportable. Con el pasar de los meses Marco, compró un televisor y un equipo de sonido, de esta manera hace más acogedor su restaurante. Pero las ambiciones de este joven, son mayores, ahora quiere abrir, un centro de diversiones, donde pueda poner música, pista de baile y bebidas de toda clase.  Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta segura de ser responsable en cada uno de los pagos para así seguir trabajando con su banco comunal. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado en el alquiler de un local espacioso, donde pueda poner su centro de diversiones.
texts.en:
Marco is 20 years old.  He lives with his parents and siblings in their own home which is in the town of Palca.  This hard-working young man opened his own restaurant with his father a few years ago.  In the mornings he sells à la carte dishes and seafood and in the afternoons he serves hot drinks such as coffee and herbal teas.

Marco's business is very profitable.  He sells 60 dishes a day, without counting the hot drinks that he serves in the evenings and which all residents of Palca drink since the cold in this place is unbearable.  As the months have passed, Marco has bought a television set and sound equipment which has made his restaurant more inviting.  However, this young man's ambitions are even greater.  Now he would like to open a recreation center where he can play music, install a dance floor and serve all kinds of drinks.

This is Marco's first loan from MFP and he is certain that he will be responsible in each of his payments so that he can continue working with his community bank.  He is planning to use his loan to hire spacious premises where he can set up his recreation center.

loans.use: To hire spacious premises where he can install his recreation center

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik M’BÔ âgé de 37 ans marié et père de quatre  enfants habitant avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du mali) .
Il exerce l’activité d’achat et vente de Prêt à Porter depuis environ quatorze ans après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter un deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier. 
Ce deuxième lui permettra d’acheter 15 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualité différentes, 15 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, 5 complets de sous-vêtement, etc.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr. Malik M'Bô, 37 years old, married and the father of four, lives with his family in Sanoubougou I-Sikasso (the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).

He has been practicing the purchase and sale of ready-to-wear clothing for about fourteen years, after having led several businesses without success. Given the growth of his customer base and the fact that his own resources cannot satisfy the demand from his customers, he believed it would be useful to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to seek a second individual loan, having properly repaid the first without difficulty.

This second loan will allow Mr. M'Bô to buy 15 assorted shirts, 17 pairs of pants of various quality, 15 assorted pairs of shoes (dress shoes, Ferardine shoes, etc.), 5 suits, 10 t-shirts, 5 sets of underwear, etc.

Mr. M'Bô purchases his stock in Bamako in order to re-sell it in his shop located at the very center of the bus station in Sikasso, to a customer base made up largely of travelers and freight operators.

Mr. M'Bô hopes to make a monthly profit of 140,000 CFA francs, which will allow him to expand his business, but also to honor his responsibilities to Soro Yiriwaso and to cover other family expenses.

loans.use: Buying clothing.

loans.name: Elba De Jesus

texts.es:
Elba De Jesus B. M. tiene 47 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Elba De Jesus se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y seguir trabajando.

Le gusta la costura.
texts.en:
Elba De Jesus B. M. is 47 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 4 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Elba De Jesus is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the García and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her home and to continue working.

Elba De Jesus likes sewing.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Hilda Leopoldina

texts.es:
Hilda Leopoldina C. F., tiene 22 años, es soltera, vive con  los hijos en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Hilda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa y terreno para que los hijos tengan un futuro.

Le gusta salir hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
