Hilda Leopoldina C. F. is 22 years old, she is single and she lives with her children in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 3 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Hilda engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying a house and some land to grant a future to her children.

She likes practicing sports with her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Vilma Doris M. tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella.
Vilma se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo y siempre se levanta temprano para atender a sus clientes.
muchas personas la prefieren ya que atiende muy amablemente y es una mujer de principios morales.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su pulperia.
su meta a corto plazo es que su negocio sea mas grande y su mayor sueño es que sus familiares sean exitosos en todo lo que emprendan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma Doris M. is 57 years old, single and has no dependent children.

She sells daily use products out of the grocery store she has in her home.  She gets up early in the morning to attend to customers Monday through Sunday.  Many people prefer to shop at her store because she is kind and has high moral standards.

She plans to use the loan to buy goods for her grocery store.  Her short-term goal is to expand her business.  Her dream is for her family to be successful at everything they do.

loans.use: To buy softdrinks, cheese, butter, margarine, oil, lard, beens, rice, beef, chicken, sausage, corn and wheat flour, sweets, soap, toilet tissue, feminine hygiene products, tortillas, bread, cookies, coffee, candles

loans.name: Rejina

texts.es:
Rejina, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Rejina tiene su propio carro y su esposo trabaja con el carro brindando servicio público en la ciudad del Cusco. Ella requiere el préstamo para ahorrar el dinero  para luego abrir un taller mecánico. 

Rejina pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rejina is 26 years old, has a son and lives in Cusco, Peru.  She has her own automobile and her husband works with a public armoured car service in the city of Cusco.  She needs the loan to save money so she can open an auto repair shop.

Rejina is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To save money to open an auto repair shop

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
La  señora Johana C. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria de Managua. Ella  se dedica al comercio general el cual inicio con la venta de truchas, luego fue aumentándolo poco a poco. En la actualidad vende desde ropa, zapatos, carteras etc.
Ella con el préstamo comprara ropa de temporada.
texts.en: Mrs. Johana C. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman from Managua.  She sells general merchandise.  She started out selling trout.  Gradually she added other items.  Currently she sells clothes, shoes, purses, etc.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es divorciada, tiene 41 años y 02 hijos, ambos viven con ella.

Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y familia, hicieron que iniciara su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará: Conservas de pescado en cajas de diferentes marcas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche en tarros; otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar detergentes, jabón de tocador y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Su sueño es tener un Mini-Marquet y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que estaba esperando para poder salir adelante y poder cumplir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the 'Las Moralinas' community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province and department.  She is 41 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who both live with her. 

Through her strength and desire to get her family ahead, Vilma managed to set up her own grocery store business.  She gradually increased her business and gained experience, becoming very well-known and well-liked by her customers.

Vilma will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy boxes of different brands of canned fish, sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles and cans of milk.  She will invest the rest of her money in buying detergents, soap and personal care products so that she can continue improving her service to her customers.

Vilma's dream is to own a mini-mart.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing her with the opportunity that she was hoping for, enabling her to get ahead and fulfil her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy products to sell retail: detergents, canned food, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Del Rosario G. le está haciendo falta pintar y acondicionar su vivienda por el interior y exterior de la casa.
No cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejorar la vivienda donde vive ella y sus dos hijos quien esta bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene como empleada de limpieza de unas oficinas. 
Desea el bienestar y la seguridad de sus hijos y ella cuando estén en su casa.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Maria Del Rosario G. is lacking paint. The interior and exterior of her house also need to be remodeled. However, she does not have the necessary funds to make these home improvements. She lives with her two young children who are her responsibility since she is a single mother.

Maria plans to repay this loan with part of the income she earns from her job cleaning offices. She wants to provide for the welfare and safety of her children while she is at home with them.

loans.use: To remodel the interior and exterior of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with one parent. He has owned a carpentry shop since 2000. He works upon clients' requests and he also collaborates with some galleries. He produces a variety of unique wood designs which is the best method of attracting customers.  His business income is very important because he is responsible for paying the household expenses. 

 He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with punctual payments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood products. He is working on new designs and needs these purchases to complete the work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business operation by taking on bigger projects and working with construction entrepreneurs to improve his business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood products.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne J. K. is a woman of thirty years, married to Gilbert Tirop, and they have three children.  They live in Leltot, in the outskirts of Elodret.  Anne does maize and wheat farming and has been doing so for three years.  She gets a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be Anne's second loan from KADET LTD.  She repaid all other loans successfully.  With this loan, she plans to buy maize seeds, wheat seeds, and fertilizer for her farm.  With the income that she is going to get, she plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production so that she can add to her income. 

In the future, she would like to be a large-scale farmer, and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesús María tiene  55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 01 hijo. Cuenta con casa propia ubicada  en un caserío a 10 kilómetros del Distrito Las Lomas, cuenta con Luz eléctrica pero no con agua y desagüe.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual ella atiende hace 5 añps.  Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Jesus Maria  ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles.

Jesus Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 55 years old and lives with her husband and one child.  She owns her own home which is located in a small village, 10 kilometers from Las Lomas district.  Her home has electricity but not piped water or sewerage.

Jesús María has a small grocery store set up in her home which she has run for five years.  She sells staple goods, basic household products and groceries to her neighbors and local customers.  Her business is very popular.  She also sells iced treats from a cart as an itinerant street vendor.  Through these businesses, she helps her husband to financially support their family.

As a result of the growing demand that her grocery store has been experiencing recently, Jesús María decided to expand it by acquiring more products.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Jesús María is a hard-working, very good-natured woman.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.en:
Mirzo is an active 51 year old father. His wife is a housewife. He is a farmer and he has been in this business for 11 years. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his family of one child and his wife. Mirzo would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer, seeds, fuel and lubricating materials. In addition to this he would like to buy cattle. Mirzo has requested a loan of 12,000 TJS for this purpose. Let’s help him with this purchase.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, cattle, fuel, and lubricating materials.

loans.name: Winsor

texts.es:
El Señor Winsor, curso solo hasta el nivel primario, es padre de un hijo al cual apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, ellos son de bajos recursos, su pareja se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante con lo cual genera un poco de ingreso para el sustento de su familia, el se dedica al servicio de venta de lomito en el restaurante LOS AMIGOS en la localidad de Ivirgarzama este es un restaurante que vende platos populares, es un lugar estratégico porque es una parada de flotas  y la demanda de pasajeros es regular, el señor Winsor trabaja hace más de 6 años demostrando experiencia en su actividad, el trabaja para mantener a su familia y darles lo mejor.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para una venta de ropa donde su pareja podrá ofrecer sus productos y así  ayudar con algún ingreso a su familia.
Winsor y su pareja son personas emprendedoras que están siempre en busca de generar mejor estabilidad económica para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Winsor only finished elementary school.  He is the father of a son who he supports and helps to educate together with his spouse.  They are of limited resources.  His spouse is a clothes street vendor which generates a bit of family income.  He sells “lomito” (pork sandwiches) at the Los Amigos Restaurant in Ivirgarzama.  This is a restaurant that sells popular dishes located in a strategic spot that’s a stop for transport lines and demand from passengers is constant.  Winsor has worked for over 6 years so has experience in the area.  He works to support his family and to give them the best.

This is the first time the client has gotten a loan from our institution.  It’s destined to buy merchandise so his spouse can sell clothes and help the family with a bit of income.

Winsor and his spouse are enterprising people always looking to generate better economic stability to provide a better quality of life for his son.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
Maria Eusebia tiene 46 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Mauro de 19 años y Evelyn de 11 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para cumplir con las metas de ver a mis hijos profesionales.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Maria Eusebia is 46 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their children, Mauro, 19, and Evelyn, 11. He lives in El Cantón Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos.

This village bank is named V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE. It can be found located in Recinto Las Blancas, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This village bank has ten members who are dedicated to short-cycle farming work, planting maize, rice and beans.

Maria is dedicated to farming, especially planting maize, rice and beans. She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and sells them in the market of the same town.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. The support of the loan would help her economically to supply the necessities and expand production. She does not face important disadvantages. Her dream is to continue working to achieve her goals to see her children become professionals.

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a 48-year-old man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda and desires to educate his children up to the university level. He has been in the poultry business for two years. He started with 150,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as his working capital. Ephraim's hardships are power shortages and diseases which result to death of chicken. His dream is to own 1000 birds and to install a solar system as a constant power supply. 

Ephraim intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
María Luz de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan actividades agrícolas, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace 2 años aproximadamente María Luz se ha dedicado a la venta de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, bebidas, etc) y de ropa, ambos negocios lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, además puede atender a su clientela a la hora que desee, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus obligaciones y mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia.

María Luz desea ampliar su negocio, por lo que a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y al aumentar sus ingresos podrá brindarle otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Luz, age 26, lives with her husband and children in their own home. They only have electricity services. Their home is located in the Morrope district, which belongs to the Lambayeque department. This zone is characterized by the fact that its residents work in agriculture, livestock and tourism.

For approximately two years, Maria Luz has sold basic staples such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, drinks, etc.; and clothing. She runs both businesses from her home for her own comfort and security--but this also means that she can serve her customers at their convenience. With her income from the sales of her products, she tries to cover all of her obligations and improve her family's living standards.

Maria Luz wants to expand her business. For this reason she has decided to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise to satisfy the needs of her customers and increase her income in order to offer her children other opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of merchandise.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Julia, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella atienD. un negocio donD. ofrecer artículos D. primera necesidad, lo tiene instalado en su vivienda y lo inicio hace 14 años; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, juntos unen los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la adquisición D. mercadería, como jabón, detergentes, aceite, frijoles y arroz, también dará una parte a su esposo para la compra D. fertilizantes para el cultivo.
Con la inversión podrá mejorar el nivel del negocio, tendrá suficiente mercadería para atender a la clientela, el propósito D. ella es que con las mejoras en el negocio también mejore su condición económica, y que el cultivo D. su esposo produzca buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Julia, who lives with her husband and their two children, runs a business selling consumer staples like beans, rice, and cleaning supplies. She has been running this business out of her home for 14 years. Her husband works in agriculture, and together they are able to cover their household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to purchase merchandise like soap, detergents, cooking oil, beans, and rice. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase fertilizers for her husband's crops.

With this investment she will be able to improve her business because she will have enough inventory to fulfill her customers' needs. Her goal is to improve her business and her financial situation and for her husband to have a good crop this year.

loans.use: purchase merchandise like soap, detergent, cooking oil, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona, 30, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jose Ramy, an Overseas Filipino Worker. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Chona operates a rug-making business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes door mats out of excess textile cloth she bought from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She directly sells her products to her neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Chona hopes to grow her business to be able to help in the construction of their house in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and make microloan repayments.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of raw materials she needs in her business

loans.name: Artak

texts.ru:
Артаку 28 лет, он родился в деревне Срашен, Сьюникского региона. Артак получил среднее образование. Он живет с женой, 3-х летней дочерью, 84-х летней бабушкой пенсионеркой и братом, который учится в средней школе соседнего села Шикаох (Shikahogh). Жена  Артака работает в Шикаохской средней школе учительницей.
Артак занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Срашен уже 5 лет. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур и свиней, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Жена Артака помогает ему на ферме после окончания ее рабочего дня. Так как сельское хозяйство является основным источником дохода их семьи, они работают очень усердно, стараясь, чтоб их семья не нуждалась ни в чем. Выращенные овощи и фрукты, а также говядину, свинину, молоко и яйца Артак реализует в городе Капане. Также он арендует землю, на которой выращивает пшеницу, которую также продает. 
Сумма кредита в 600.000 драм необходима Артаку для проведения посевных работ, покупки 2 быков и 2 свиней.
texts.en:
Artak is twenty-eight.  He was born in the small village of Srashen in the Syuniksky region and has a high school education.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter, his retired eighty-four-year-old grandmother and his brother, who is in high school in the neighboring village of Shikaokh.  Artak's wife is a high school teacher in Shikaokh. 

For five years Artak has made his living in agriculture in Srashen.  He raises big horned cattle, chickens, and pigs.  He also grows fruits and vegetables.  His wife helps him out on the farm when she gets home from work.  Since farming is the family's main source of income, they work very hard so the family doesn't need for anything.  Artak sells the ripe produce, beef, pork, milk, and eggs in the city of Kapan.  He also rents land where he grows wheat that he sells. 

Artak needs a loan of 600 drams for the growing season, and to buy two bulls and two pigs.

loans.use: to buy two bulls, two pigs and to use during the growing season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. Over five years, she has been managing dairy farming to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to increase the number of cows. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 37-year-old enterprising business lady. She is married to David who is a businessman. They are blessed with four children aged between 9 and 14 years. She has been selling tomatoes for the past six years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. 


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Martha will use the loan to buy more tomatoes to add to her stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes are to buy commercial land and build rental houses which will help her educate her children up to university level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es: Milton Antonio de 47 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposa de 50 años y su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad. Milton ha  trabajado toda su vida  para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honesto y sobre todo emprendedor. Hace 15 años que logro establecer un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la zona donde habita en el cual vende diversidad de antojitos tales como: atol,  tamales, yuca frita, pasteles, enchiladas, etc. Es un hombre increíblemente creativo y carismático. Ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas y cada día su cartera de clientes crece más. Su negocio es el número uno en venta de antojitos ya que para Milton lo más importante son los clientes y siempre trata de mantenerlos satisfechos con los productos que él ofrece.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (yuca, maíz, condimentos, aceite, repollo, azúcar, sal, etc.) para elaborar diversidad de deliciosos antojitos que permitan atraer más clientes con el fin de mejorar su nivel de ventas así como el nivel de ingresos de tal manera que pueda  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Milton Antonio, 47, lives in his own house with his 50-year-old wife and little 7-year-old daughter.  Milton has worked his entire life to support his beloved family.  He is noted for being a hardworking, honest and, above all, enterprising man.  

Fifteen years ago he managed to set up a stand in his local market where he sells a variety of fast food snacks like: “atol” [corn-based beverage], tamales, fried manioc, cakes, enchiladas, etc.  He is an extremely creative and charismatic man.  He’s known how to win over people’s trust and every day is client portfolio grows more.  His business is number one in sales of fast food snacks because for Milton the most important thing is his customers and he always tries to keep them satisfied with the products he offers.

He decided to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to invest in the business buying needed raw materials (manioc, corn, condiments, oil, cabbage, sugar, salt, etc.) to prepare the delicious variety of fast food snacks that will attract more customers in order to increase his sales to improve his and his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy raw materials: manioc, corn, condiments, oil, cabbage, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ulziitogtoh

texts.en:
Ulziitogtoh is 35 years old and lives with her mother, sister and daughter in ger (tent like structure), in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  She is divorced and her daughter goes to school. 

She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter in a market.  Her counter is filled with fashionable clothes and accessories.  Many of her customers visit the market just to see her products. 

She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "Now that my business is going well, I want to build my house for my daughter and me."  She is requesting 3,000,000 to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.use: to buy a construction materials.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Nico como de cariño tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales la mayor estudia la secundaria y el menor la primaria.  Ella es originaria de una comunidad donde la principal fuente de empleo es el cultivo de maíz, aguacate y guayaba. Platica que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de temporada, surte sus frutas a diario en la central de abastos a las 4 de la mañana ya que es la fruta y la verdura mas fresca y sale a venderla en el mercado, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para invertirlo en sus verduras. Abecés ella cultiva, el maíz, chayotes, calabaza, rábanos para así ganarle un poco mas de ganancias. Esta muy contenta con el crédito que le harán por que surtirá un poco mas de frutas y legumbres, la meta que tiene es poner un negocio estable ya que anda con sus cubetas ofreciendo por el mercado y eso abecés la cansa.
texts.en: Doña Nico, as she is affectionately known, is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is in middle school and the youngest is in primary school. She is from a community where the main source of income is growing corn, avocados and guayaba. She remarks that she sells fruits and vegetables in season. She stocks her fruit every day from the distribution center at 4 a.m., since the freshest fruit is there. She goes to sell it in the market. She is asking for  loan to invest in her produce. Sometimes she grows corn, chayote squash, pumpkins, and radishes to make a little more income. She is happy with the loan that she will take out which will stock her fruit and vegetables a little more. Her goal is to have a stable business, since she goes around selling with her buckets in the market and sometimes this is tiring.

loans.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. She has one additional family member. Ruth lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Ruth sells secondhand bags at the market on a wholesale basis. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. Ruth has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more secondhand bags. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Ruth's goals and hopes are to become a wholesaler, to start importing secondhand bags and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand bags

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 47 years old and lives with his wife and children in the province of Isabela. He has been a farmer for 20 years. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice for sale. His business earns PHP 20,000 every harvest season. His wife has also managed their hog-raising business for five years. The most tiresome part is clearing the piggery and taking care of the hogs day after day. They both work hard to meet their family's daily needs and to give their children daily allowances. At this time, Julie is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he has requested, and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is a 33-year-old married father of four children. He runs a welding business in Mnarani, Kilifi and has been in the business for the last four years. The business is doing well and he has been able to support his family well.

This marks Paul’s third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business, and with the money, he plans to purchase more metals for welding. 

With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay his KADET loan and to expand his business even further, and also to improve his family’s living standards. In future, Paul hopes to open up new ventures in Kilifi and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more metals for welding

loans.name: Nancy Rosa

texts.es:
Nancy Rosa tiene 43 años de edad es soltera tiene 4 hijos, vive con los hijos de 17, 16,11 y 3 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Sector del hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Nancy tiene un negocio compra y venta de arroz. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas y las ventas lo hace en la tienda que tiene.

Solicita el crédito para incrementar más el negocio, comprar más arroz. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a los hijos.
El sueño es que los hijos sigan estudiando y que sean profesionales.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy Rosa, age 43, is single and has four children.  She lives with her children; ages 17, 16, 11, and 3; in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of “Las Brisas” (The Breezes) communal bank.  It is located in the hospital sector of the Ventanas canton.  They devote themselves to general commerce.

Nancy has a business buying and selling rice.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas, and she sells it in the store that she has.

She is requesting the loan to increase her business by purchasing more rice.  With the help of the loan she will be able to have greater income and support her children.

Her dream is that her children continue with their education and become professionals.  

She has not had any type of problems.

In her free time she likes to go on walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy rice to increase her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alex is a 55-year-old a business man.  He is married to Colleta. They are blessed with two children, aged 7 and 5 years. He has been running a hotel  for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

Alex is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for his hotel.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build a shed for his livestock and open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice for his hotel

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: A sus 34 años, la señora Sandra Patricia se dedica desde hace un año a la confección de camisas y ropa interior en un pequeño taller adecuado en la sala de su casa de lunes a sábado. Gracias a esta actividad, la señora Sandra Patricia puede conseguir el sustento diario para su esposo y dos hijos. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas, requiere de la compra de una maquina recubridora que le permita incrementar la calidad de sus productos y elaborar nuevas prendas. El sueño de la señora Sandra Patricia es poder ampliar su taller de confección y brindarles empleo a las madres cabeza de hogar de su comunidad.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Sra. Sandra Patricia has been manufacturing shirts and undergarments for the past year. She has a small workshop set up in the living room of her house where she works Monday through Saturday. Thanks to this business, Sandra Patricia is able to provide for the daily needs of her husband and two children.

In an effort to improve her sales, Sandra needs a loan to buy a cover stitch machine so that she can improve the quality of her products and manufacture new types of garments. Her dream is to expand her sewing workshop so that she can provide more jobs for female heads of household in her community.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay has been living and raising some piglets in Baray district. Besides her pig-fattening business, Svay is also involved in selling fish in a local market of the province to make additional income. She typically earns around $3.20 per day through her businesses. She now has three single children who are attending school and are under her care. 

Mrs. Svay is taking out a loan from lenders to purchase extra piglets, around 10 of them, to sustain her pig-raising business. And with any balance of the loan, she will buy potatoes in bulk from the villagers for future sale. In the future, Mrs. Svay wishes to own a potato plantation herself.

loans.use: to purchase extra piglets and to buy potatoes in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Ayanle Abdirashid

texts.en: Ayanle is 18 years old. He studies human resource management and leadership at New Generation University College. He is a very cleaver student but his effort is reduced by the lack of a laptop, as he misses assignment deadlines and sometimes class presentations. He thanks Kiva and KAABA who enabled him to get the laptop loan. He will pay the loan in monthly installments. Ayanle hopes to work as an HR manger for a local NGO.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled asked his son to  take his place in the picture as he is taking this loan for the son's study fees. 

Khaled was born in 1968. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his wife and three sons. He currently works as an electrician and is trying his best to provide his children with the best education. One of his sons is studying for the Bachelors’ degree, majoring in Marketing and Hotel Management, and he is in his second year. His son is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. 

But because Khaled is currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping him to pay for his sons’ upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio has a spot at a local market where he sells jewelry, laces and other items. He buys the merchandise in whole sale packages from a local distributor. Antonio has been watching his parents in this type of activity from a very young age. They owned a stand at a local market where Antonio would always visit and help out. Eventually, his father provided him with $50 worth of merchandise in order to get Antonio started in his own business.

He sells all his products for $1 or less because he works in very poor communities where people cannot afford to pay more. Antonio is seeking the loan so he may purchase at larger quantities from wholesalers. He is hoping to invest in new and different products that are still affordable to his clients.

Antonio is only 22 years old. He is currently a student at a local college. His business helped him cover the expense from finishing high school and attending college. He hopes to continue running his business until he graduates when he wants to open a much a larger operation.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Antonio is seeking the loan so he may purchase at larger quantities from wholesalers.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She takes care of three children left by her sister who died of AIDS. Sesilia owns two stalls at the Tandika market, which is a famous  market in Dar es Salaam selling used clothes. She sells used clothes for both men and women. Sesilia is planning to increase the size of her stalls and stock of clothes. 

This plan will help her earn extra income to pay for school fees for the children and meet family expenses. Sesilia is an ambitious person and she can’t let an opportunity go. She recently realized that the shoe business is profitable. She wants to open a shoe outlet. She is in need of USD 550 to execute her plan.

loans.use: to add stocks of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling soup

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Its not the shop, it’s the stock in the shop. Being a twenty nine year old mother and wife, Veronika F. was able to start a small retail shop with her husband. Although it was a hard start, at the moment, it is prospering and she is grateful for S.P.B.D. because the financial assistance has given her more money to stock up the shop. She is hoping that another loan would be granted so that her shop can go from small to a bigger one and be able to compete with others in the area.

loans.use: Veronika would like to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is a local from the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. He is married, 47 years old, has 4 children. He has been running his trading shop for 7 years. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro to help his business.  He is asking for $1100 loan from Normicro to expand his foodstuff business and to increase the volume and variety of goods. He intends to increase his business turnover.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elnur has his own farm and 4 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $950 to buy pesticides and fertilizer. He plans to develop his farming business and increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti is 30 years old and has one son. She owns a small store in which she sells snacks and various kinds of groceries. Siti earns about $10 per day while her husband, A., sells fish and usually earns $20 per day. She has come to us for a loan of $75 to buy more items to sell in her store, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. lives in Mayack village near Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 56 years old, married, and has four children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding. Ali has ten years' experience at this business. Every Sunday Ali goes to the livestock market of Beylagan, sells some of his sheep there, and purchases other sheep. (Ali is pictured at the livestock market.) He increases his business capital this way. Now he needs a loan in the amount of $800, with which sum he plans to buy a calf.

loans.use: To expand his livestock business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: O. Daniel is 32 years old, is married and has a child. She lives in Benin-City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells rice and beans in her retail store, and has been in business for 2 years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more rice and beans, to  meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
Juan Angel T. is originally from the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. For the past ten years, he has tended to his pharmacy business which he runs out of his own home.

He has four children, three of whom are still in school and for whom he struggles to provide for all their needs. To improve his financial situation, he has asked for credits in Ceprodel which, to date, has provided him with a total of nine loans. He has used these to purchase products to sell and, in this way, continue to support his humble household and provide an education for his children. He has a record of nine loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Angel T. es un caballero originario del municipio Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al negocio de farmacia teniendo su establecimiento en su propia casa de habitación.

Es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que tiene que esforzarse por brindarles todo lo que necesitan. Para mejorar su situación económica, ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel quien hasta este momento le ha brindado un total de 9 créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos para comercializarlos y así seguir manteniendo su humilde hogar y además brindarle el estudio a sus hijos. Su record crediticio es de 9 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceutical supplies.

loans.name: Raya's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Raya is 34 years old and is a married woman with 7 children, whose ages range from 1-18 years old. Raya owns a small clothing shop, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her shop.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing A. is a single man. He is 30 years old. He started his business in 2002. He is a photographer and also a sells handsets. Blessing is highly innovative and hardworking. He is requesting for a loan of  $525 to buy more handsets (cell phones) and film to enhance his business. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: To buy more handsets (cell phones) and films for sales

loans.name: Moung

texts.en:
Moung S., 40, has worked as a Khmer traditional massage girl since 2000. She earns $3 per day. (Moung is pictured.)

Her husband earns $5 per day from his motor taxi business. This couple has 6 children: 2 are married and live away from home; the others are students. She and her husband work very hard to support the children's education expenses. They spend almost $2 per day for their children to go to school.

To earn more money for the family, they are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase and raise pigs. They plan to use the rest of money to finish construction of their house.

loans.use: To raise pigs, and complete construction of their house.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi N., aged 54, is a member of TYM Fund. She has been using the loans from TYM Fund to invest into the business of buying and selling poultries in the market. Mrs. N. also provides services for weddings, funerals and other religious events etc. Because Mrs. N. has many years of experience in this business, the numbers of customers keep increasing. Mrs. N. has three children, all of whom graduated from high school and are working with an average income between 2.000.000 VND and 3.000.000 VND. In the next loan level, Mrs. N. wishes to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($ 600) to invest into her business. Her family’s income is 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Nhạt 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn gia đình chị đã lựa chọn hoạt động kinh doanh buôn bán gia cầm, mua gia cầm sống về giêt mổ bán tai chợ, ngoài việc bán tại chợ gia đình chị còn nhận phục vụ các gia đình có công việc như hiếu, hỷ, tết..... Trải qua nhiều năm trong nghề kinh doanh măt hàng này nên gia đình chị thu hút được lượng khách hàng rất đông, chị có 3 con đều học hết phổ thông trung học hiện nay các con chị đều có công ăn viêc làm ổn định, hàng tháng thu nhâp từ 2.000.000đ đến 3.000.000đ phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán giết mổ gia cầm.

Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The community of Atahui is located approximately one hour from the Huancapi district. This farming community is comprised of approximately 50 families, who grow cereals such as wheat, barley, corn, and peas, as well as tubers such as potatoes, mashua, olluco, etc. The community is in the Cayara district, located two kilometers from the highway that connects Huancapi to Cayara. The community is a little isolated, but it does business in the Districts of Cayara, Huancapi, and Ayacucho.

Rosa B. buys cereals and tubers, and transports them to Ayacucho to sell. Rosa’s husband and children help her with her business. Rosa also brings groceries from Ayacucho and sells them in the local markets of nearby communities. Rosa wants to improve and grow her business, so that she can earn enough to keep her children in school and they can become professionals. They study in the city of Ayacucho and Rosa would be proud to see them become better than her. Rosa says that the community bank meetings have taught her to save, to love herself, and to value herself as a person. She also established a better understanding with her husband and children, and she doesn’t want her children to work on the farm.

Bronita is a nurse, but because of the economic conditions in the country she doesn’t practice this traD.. Instead, Bronita started a business selling cereals and vegetables in Huancapi and Alcamenca. She also promotes good health by selling OMNILIFE products in nearby communities. Bronita would like to have a pharmacy so that her children can study and become professionals. She’d like her children to have better opportunities than she had. Bronita would like to earn enough to buy a house in Ayacucho, and her husband is happy because he also wants to save. Bronita says that her experiences with the communal bank have taught her that people learn to be more responsible and punctual when they work in groups. Bronita also learned to share her family problems, and found the support to overcome them, and to not fear the future.

Elyana buys and sells young livestock., traveling to the remote areas of the local communities to buy the animals. Elyana also buys and sells shoes and clothes that are in style, and she sometimes trades these for animals. Elyana would like to buy a car, which she would use to transport her livestock more efficiently from Ayacucho, thereby improving her business. Before Elyana joined the community bank, she didn’t know how to save, but now she has the opportunity to think about her future. At Bancomunal Elyana has learned to respect herself, and she now earns more than her spouse, and contributes more to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad D. Atahui, esta ubicado aproximadamente a una hora del distrito D. Huancapi, esta Comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente con 50 familias que viven en la comunidad, los comuneros se dedican a la siembra D. cereales como trigo, cebada, maíz, arveja y tubérculos como papa, mashua, olluco, etc. La comunidad esta a 2Km D. la carretera D. Huancapi a Cayara, esta comunidad pertenece al distrito D. Cayara y esta un poco aislado al mercado y D. ferias, pero realizan sus negocios en Distrito D. Cayara, Huancapi y Ayacucho

ROSA B., compra todo tipo D. cereales, tubérculos y lleva a Ayacucho para comercializar, pero lo hace con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos. También trae abarrotes D. Ayacucho y los lleva a las ferias D. las comunidades y/o anexos donD. la gente le compra. Rosa, quiero mejorar su trabajo, hasta este momento les va bien pero quiere salir capitalizándome un poco mas y hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, ellos estudian en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y quiero que sean mejores que yo , mi familia tendrá ese orgullo. Rosa B. dice que con las reuniones D. los Bancomunales ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, pero a la vez lleguó a comprenderse mas con su esposo y a sus hijos que no quiere que estén en la chacra.

Bronita, es enfermera técnica, pero no la ejerze por la situación que hay en el país, pero realizo negocio D. cereales y verduras que lleva a Huancapi y Alcamenca . Tambien es promotora D. salud y sale a las comunidades vecinas a ofertar sus productos D. OMNILIFFE. Bronita, quiero tener una farmacia propia, hacer estudiar a mis hijos para que sean profesionales, quiero que tengan mejores oportunidades que yo. Pienso comprar una casa en Ayacucho, mi esposo esta feliz por que el también quiere ahorrar.. Bronita dice que estando en el bancomunal ha aprendido que las personas estando juntas aprenden a tener mayores responsabilidades y ser muy puntuales, pero aprendí a compartir mis cosas y mis problemas familiares, pero encuentro una orientación como superarlos y no tener miedo D. las cosas que vienen al futuro.

Elyana, compra y venD. animales menores, va a los anexos D. las comunidades y los compra. También venD. zapatos y ropas para la época y a veces realizo el cambio con los animales. Elyana, quisiera comprarse un carro para poder hacer mejor mi negocio, antes D. entrar al bancomunal no sabia ahorrar, ahora tiene la oportunidad y pensar en su futuro. Ella desea comprarse un carro, para poder viajar a Ayacucho y llevar los animales y así mejorar mi negocio. En su bancomunal ha aprendido a respetarse a si misma y que también tiene las mismas facultades que los varones, hace bien su negocio y tiene más dinero que su esposo, ella aporta más a la casa en los gastos.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 400 soles, while some need 100 soles, for a total of 1,800 soles for the community bank to run its businesses.

loans.name: Francis Raquel

texts.es:
Francis lives in the neighborhood of Riguero de Managua. With her own efforts and the support of her family, she was able to start a store in her house. She has already had her small business for five years. She has had difficulty with low sales, but has managed to do well. Her husband is a merchant and he is the head of the family. At 34 years of age, she only has a girl of 1 ½ years of age. The loan is needed to invest in the store. She will buy basic grains, delicacies, and cleaning products for the home, in order to have an assortment and thus to be able to satisfy the demands of her clientele. She works very hard daily to be able to obtain income that will help with the maintenance of the family, as well as the daily fight of having to keep the business always working, in spite of the difficulties that the Nicaraguans suffer these days.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francis habita en el barrio Riguero de Managua, con esfuerzos propios y apoyo de su familia logró para poner una pulpería en su casa ya tiene cinco años de tener su pequeño negocio, ha tenido dificultad con las ventas bajas, pero ha logrado salir adelante. Su esposo es comerciante y está pendiente de la familia, a sus 34 años de edad, solo tiene una niña de 1 ½ de edad. El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la pulpería, comprará granos básicos, golosinas, productos de limpieza para el hogar, con el fin de tener surtido y así poder satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Diariamente trabaja muy duro para poder obtener ingresos que le ayuden a la manutención de la familia, así como la lucha diaria de tener el negocio siempre trabajando, a pesar de las dificultades que sufren en estos días los nicaragüenses.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cleaning products and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Julieta

texts.es: La Señora Blanca M. D. Rondon es cliente D. Emprender desD. al año 2003, ella comenzó	solicitando un credito con el monto D. 150 dólares en un grupo solidario D. tres personas, posteriormente despues D. cuatro secuencias decidió individualzarse para optar a créditos con mayor monto. Ella es propietaria D. un salón D. peluquería desD. hace 20 años, por lo que cuenta con una amplia clientela que solicita sus servicios, en particular en el campo D. la depilación pues esta es su especialidad. Cabe  señalar que la señora tiene una hija profesional y fruto D. sus esfuerzos continúa apoyandola para comenzar con su profesión, la cual se desenvuelve en el campo D. la salud. La señora Blanca M., se encuentra en su novena secuencia con crédito individual,demostrando	responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca M. D. Rondon has been a client of Emprender since 2003. Her first loan was for $150 as a member of a three-person solidarity group. After completing four loan cycles with the group, she decided to take out a larger, individual loan. She has run a hair salon for the past 20 years, and has a wiD. range of customers who request her services, particularly for waxings, which is her specialty. It should be noted that her daughter is a young professional, and thanks to Mrs. M.'s continual support she is launching her career in the field of medicine. Mrs. Blanca M. is now taking out her ninth individual loan. She has always been very repsonsible making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for hair salon

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is 35, married, and she lives in Bukovica, a village near Doboj in Bosnia. Her husband earns 400KM/month (equivalent to roughly $260USD). Nada has three children, and this level of income is not high enough to support her family. Nada grows vegetables and raises chickens. She sells the vegetables and eggs at the local market, earning about 300KM/month (equivalent to roughly $200USD).

Nada requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy cattle. She hopes to save the additional income she earns from selling the cow`s milk and milk products, so her family has a financial reserve if it ever experiences difficult times.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
La señora Rayda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el PSJ. Coronel Bustamante Nº 13, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad y es madre soltera con 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa y con la confección de prendas de vestir, el cual le brinda ganancias para cumplir con el pago del préstamo correspondiente.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 cajas de leche, ½ saco de arroz y azúcar, ¼ de huevos y telas para sus prendas de vestir.

Rayda manifiesta que la ayuda recibida de Manuela Ramos es muy gratificante para ella. Se siente contenta porque su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Rayda belongs to the Bellavista Community Bank, located at 13 PSJ. Coronel Bustamante, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Uyacali. She is 51 years old and is a single mother with four children, three of whom are grown up while one is still dependent on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of candy and snacks. She has worked with the community bank for four years. Currently she has a small store in her house, and she is able to pay back the corresponding loan with the earnings from making items of clothing for sale. With this loan of S/. 2000, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 2 boxes of milk, half a sack of rice and of sugar, a quarter of a box of eggs, and fabric to sew items of clothing for sale. Rayda is very thankful for the help received from Manuela Ramos. She feels happy because her business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 boxes of milk, half a sack of rice and of sugar, a quarter of a box of eggs, and fabric.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. He is a workman and also he owns an entertainment store where he has a baby football table and billiard games. He has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new billiards and baby football games. This is the first time that Mohammed has requested a loan.

Mohammed decided on opening his entertainment store because being a workman didn’t help him earn enough money. His clients are friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to improve the store in order to get more return.

loans.use: to purchase baby football tables and  billiard games

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and a father of a one-year-old daughter. He runs a cellphone booth. He has been in business since 1998. Emmanuel started bartering second-hand clothing for fish. He liked that business because it made more profit. Unfortunately he had to stop it to continue his university studies.

After his university studies in 2005, he decided to start his own business. He then opened a cellphone booth with accessories and also sells purified water. Emmanuel is working hard because his ambition is to open a small factory to produce purified water. As he wants to develop and diversify his business, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups in August 2008. He makes a profit of about $30 per day. Emmanuel has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase new cellphone accessories

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Pat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of seventeen members, is located in Hang Chhouk village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. S. P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kam Mom, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. S. P. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while other is too young to work or study. 

Thirteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to increase crop production

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Mrs. Florita L. has been a recognized member of Paglaum under our microfinance program since May 29, 2007. She is 53 years old, married, and blessed with three children all of them already married. She’s living at Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. Her husband is a carpenter and engaged in farming. She admits that it is not easy for them to live nowadays because the income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs, especially food. There are also times that her husband has no work. She decided to put up a Sari-Sari Store; in that way she can help her husband support the family. But she has only a little amount of money for starting capital.

She heard from her friend that Paglaum is offering credit services at a very low interest rate. She did not hesitate to join because she said to herself, maybe Paglaum is the answer to our needs especially for finances. She received a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 as her 1st loan, used as additional capital for the Sari-Sari Store.

She says Paglaum helps her small business grow, and helps her to develop herself as a person. As a member, she also obtains information regarding savings and investment, insurance, and how to manage a business.

Florita is now on her 3rd loan and is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store to purchase additional grocery items such as rice, canned goods, assorted bath & laundry soaps.

Her hopes and aspiration in life are to be able to expand and develop her business and earn enough income to build a decent home and have always a harmonious family life.

loans.use: Additional grocery materials such as food, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Wazir

texts.en:
This is M. Wazir, the son of F. M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is a married man who has  three children. He is a butcher, and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has been involved in his butcher shop for more than 10 years. There he works hard. He wakes up early in the morning to sell more and to have a high monthly income. 

He would like to expand his business and make his shop larger. That is why he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months.

He is grateful to the lenders who bring the opportunity for the entrepreneurs to support themselves and their families through Kiva's process.

loans.use: To expand his butcher shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is 62 years old. She is married and has seven children who are all currently working. Elizabeth trades traveling bags and suitcases at the local market of central market of cape coast, a town where she lives. She buys her bag supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She requests a loan to increased her stock of school bags, traveling bags and suitcases. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase savings, expand her shop, and to rent a shop to house her excess goods.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of traveling bags and suitcase.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a market collector in the public market of Cauayan City. AsiD. from that, she also sells chicken meat and sometimes she also offers vegetables. Her weekly net income of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $41) is quite enough to support their needs. She wants to pursue her vending business and for this she would like a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital.

She is married to Carlos and they have three children: Charles Daryl - 21 years old, a college undergraduate; Randal Roy - 19 years old, a third year college student, and John Carlo - 11 years old, a graD. school student. She hopes that her business will become more productive to further help her husband improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales auxquels elle a associé la vente de boissons locales, ce commerce marche bien pour elle. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1992, ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce secteur. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un premier crédit qu'elle a déjà remboursé, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour acheter 07sacs de maïs et 05 bidons de boissons locales afin d'augmenter son stock .
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman's income generating activity is the sale of cereals along with the sale of local beverages. This business has been doing well. She started this business in 1992, thus she is an expert in this field. She was granted a first loan from WAGES, and she is requesting a second loan to increase her stock to buy 7 bags of corn and 5 jugs of local beverages. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and local beverages

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Son S. is a borrower who has been recruited to be leader of the group loan by the other borrowers.

Son S. is a 45-year-old widowed woman, and is the mother of five children, three of whom are employed at different jobs: her first child is a carpenter; the second child is a massage staff person; and the third child works as a chef in a restaurant.

At present, Son S. sells a few snack cakes and desserts to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. Because the family's house is too old and often breaks down, Son S. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva in order to hire a housing repairer to repair her old house.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are:

C., a single lady, who sells fish and vegetables in the market. She is applying for a loan as business capital to increase the size of her business.

N., who will be using her loan to repair her old house and to use as capital in her business of selling food.

loans.use: To hire a housing repairer to repair her old house

loans.name: Kindé Yvette

texts.fr:
A. Kindé Yvette est née vers les années 1967 à OUIDAH, l’une des villes historiques et touristiques du Bénin. Kindé Yvette est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. Mais Kindé Yvette est veuve depuis 2006. Depuis  2003 Kindé Yvette réside AKPAKPA  un quartier populaire de la ville de  Cotonou,  Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin et elle y mène son activité. Kindé Yvette est dans le secteur de la restauration. C’est Kindé Yvette elle-même qui gère son restaurant. 

Grâce aux revenus de son activité de restauration,  Kindé Yvette arrive à  subvenir à ses besoins. Kindé Yvette a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Kindé Yvette veut  mieux développer les activités de son restaurant  en vue d’une meilleure prestation envers sa clientèle dont le nombre ne cesse de croitre. C’est pourquoi Kindé Yvette sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Kindé Yvette was born around 1967 in OUIDAH, one of the historic and touristic cities of Benin. She is married and the mother of two, but she has been a widow since 2006. Since 2003, Kindé Yvette has been living in AKPAKPA, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin, where she operates her business. She is in the restaurant business. She herself manages the restaurant. Thanks to the revenues from this business, Kindé Yvette manages to support herself. She has already benefited from several loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was able to use the loans to raise her business to a higher level. She wants to improve her restaurant business with the aim of providing improved offerings and services to her customers, who are ever-growing in number. This is why she is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 50-kg sacks of rice, three 500-mg boxes of macaroni, 25 kilos of beans, two 100-kg sacks of corn, and a 25-L drum of peanut oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops in bulk

loans.name: Manuela Ramos De Iscuchaca Anta Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “MANUELA RAMOS DE ISCUCHACA ANTA”, están situados en el distrito de Iscuchaka Anta de la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura (papa. Granos, cereales),  la ganadería (vacunos y ovinos) y con el comercio minorista, ellos venden frutas y comida en el mercado, otros socios se dedican ala albañilería, otras socias compran y venden ropa de casa en casa, todos nuestros socios son gente muy emprendedora con deseos de superación, para lo cual siguen trabajando con mucho empeño y ahora solicitan el préstamo en razón de utilizarlo como capital de trabajo e invertir en sus mismos negocios.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “MANUELA RAMOS DE ISCUCHACA ANTA” community bank are located in the district of Iscuchaka Anta, in the province and region of Cusco.
Our members divide their time between household activities and work in agriculture (potatoes, grains, and cereals), raising livestock (cattle and sheep) and retail business, selling fruits and food in the market. Some members are bricklayers and others buy clothing and sell it door to door. All of our members are very enterprising people who want to improve their lives, which is why they work hard. They are now requesting a loan to use as working capital and to invest in their businesses.
Our members are grateful for and value this loan granted through Kiva, and are committed to making their repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Omotosho

texts.en:
Omotosho is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Omotosho sells food items and drinks. 
She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She lives in Lagos. She is requesting for a loan i the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more food items and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 45 years old and married with four children. She has a medicine store and hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and married to Edgar, a farmer. Farming is the major source of livelihood in their village in General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with three children: Maryjane - 18, Roderick - 17, and Edward – 16 years old. Clara feels sad because she was not able to provide them financial assistance to pursue their college education.

Clara is a hog raiser. She engaged in this kind of business to be able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She is now applying for business capital of PHP 5,000 that she will use for the maintenance of her hog-raising business.

Her dream to become productive motivates Clara to work harder and to use money wisely. She believes that the improvement of her business also depends on hard work and perseverance, aside from financial capital that she is requesting. Clara is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 36 years old and is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. He is married to Judith and they are blessed with six children: Angelou, 13 years old, a high school freshman; Avelyn, 11 years old, a grade school student; the twins, Roderick and Rodrigo, who are now 9 years old and are also in grade school; Radolfo, 2 years old; and the youngest is Rodolfo Jr., 1 year old.

Rodolfo helps his wife in her vending business, especially when he is not busy tilling their farm. His wife sells different vegetables and processed food like longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) in the village. Rodolfo is also the one who plants vegetables in their farm which they also sell after harvesting.

However, lack of capital hinders them from improving their business. With this in mind, Rodolfo volunteered to assist his wife in looking for financial support from Kiva lenders. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that will be used to purchase more processed foods and additional vegetables that they believe will result in increased income.

loans.use: To purchase more processed foods and additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis A. is married and has four dependents. He has received schooling through junior high.

Francis is fisherman in Abotoase, which he has done for ten years. His wife is a fishmonger. Francis uses his income to pay the children’s school fees and to pay utility bills.

Francis will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment such as a net and a larger boat to go fishing with. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment such as a net and a larger boat

loans.name: To Time Group

texts.en:
Meet Kadieyatu B., Mohamed K. and Adama K., the three members of the To Time Group. They are seeking a loan of 1.4 million LE from SMT (a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone, Waterloo) and Kiva lenders in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Kadieyatu is the group’s leader, and she is married to a carpenter with whom she has three children. For the past twelve years she has sold a variety of materials including palm oil, wood, and soap. Recently, Kadieyatu constructed a store from which she hopes to start selling building materials. She is planning to use her portion of the loan in order to purchase her starting inventory.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new store

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
La señora Zaida es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años y es una orgullosa madre de dos hijos. Zaida se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la Municipalidad de Pucallpa. Zaida forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos”, desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar artículos de pasamanería. 
Con este crédito de 1200 soles, lo utilizará para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos e implementar su bodega. La meta de la señora Zaida es tener una bodega bien implementada en un ambiente amplio para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zaida is a dynamic partner and collaborator. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and is a proud mother of two children. Zaida dedicates herself to the sale of groceries. She counts on the support of her husband who works in the Municipality of Pucallpa. Zaida has been part of the Municipal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos” for eight years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles ($100), which she used to buy trim items for drapes and upholstery. With this loan of 1200 soles ($425), she will buy products like rice, sugar, and pasta and set up her store. Zaida’s goal is to have a well-run store in a spacious environment for better service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items like rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
