El Sr. Jesús G. V. tenía su domicilio en casa de un hermano y poco a poco fue juntando dinero para poder construir unos cuartos, para irse con su familia ahora después de 2 años ya tiene 2 cuartitos.

El Sr. G. nos comenta “Me urge poner un baño completo ya que el que tenemos es de pozo y resulta muy antihigiénico para mi y mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la instalación de un baño.

loans.use: Installation of a full bathroom

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina comes from the locality of Linares in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is a widow with three children. They were the motivation for her when she started eight years ago with the sale of cosmetics. Her children were studying outside the locality and without a husband, she had to continue covering those costs. Fortunately the good quality of the products that she sells and her taste for sales has permitted her business to grow.

To be able to cover the orders of her clients, Alejandrina is requesting a credit for $250 that she will employ in the purchase of merchandise. She offers to repay this amount in three months. In your hands is the well-being of this family, contributing to the growth of this business; think no more and decide to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es originaria de la localidad de Linares en el estado de Nuevo León, es viuda y tiene tres hijos, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual hace ocho años inició con la venta de cosméticos, sus hijos estaban estudiando fuera de la localidad y al faltar su esposo ella tenía que seguir cubriendo estos costos, afortunadamente la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa y su gusto por las ventas le ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes Alejandrina está solicitando un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en tres meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Fanny Yamileth

texts.es:
My name is Fanny R.. I dedicate myself to selling sausages, different types of pig and chicken meats, and milk-derived products. I've had this business for two years and my clients are great because they really like my products. The products are very sanitary and taste good because they come from the Olancho department, where great meats and milk-derived products are produced. My aim is to attain more products because the demand is high and all that I manage to procure sells very fast. With the funds I obtain I will be able to buy a bigger refrigerator to not only preserve more products, but more importantly, to maintain my family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fanny R. me dedico a la venta de carnes de res, cerdo, pollo, chorizos, y lacteos en general, tengo mi negocio hace un par de años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta mucho mi producto, ya que es muy higienico y de muy buen sabor porque es producido en el departamento de Olancho en donde porducen muy buenos lacteos y las carnes son muy buenas, mi proposito es tener mas producto porque la demanda es muy grande y lo que ajusto a comprar se me vende rapido, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar un refrigerador mas grande para mantener mas producto y lo mas importante mantener mi familia.

loans.use: The purchase of chicken and pig meats, sausages, tripe, cheese, and butter

loans.name: Aam

texts.en: Aam is 45 years old and married with two children, aged 22 and 20. She runs a business selling medicinal herbs. Occassionally, she assists as a midwife with a neighbour's childbirth, and also earns some income from rendering this service. As a widow, Aam is the only person left to fight and provide for her and her children's lives. She is requesting a loan  to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adelphina

texts.en:
This is Mama Rich, so named not because she is rich but in reference to her youngest son Richard, 13, who is preceded by Fadhili, 16, and Peter, 14. However, I’m sure the nickname is prophetic. Since 2003, Mama Rich has run a grocery store in the rural town of Mailimoja, where she sells fruit and vegetables, rice, oil, and countless other food and non-food items. She requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional food stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca Sanchez has been dedicating herself to the sales of stationary products and photocopy services at the market of Del Israel Lewites in Managua. Before dedicating herself to this business, she sold water in different places. As soon as she knew that the business didn’t support her financially, she decided she had to do something about it, so she began saving her money to finally start her own business and buy stationary products. Blanca Sanchez is a single mother with three children to support. This is why she needs a loan to help her buy the right equipment for her business. She has already received 3 microloans through Ceprodel. With these loans she was able to improve her business with the purchase two glass cases to display her products in and also a small photocopier. She needs enough money to buy a new photocopy machine. Her goal is to keep restocking her business with great selections of products and acquire a new photocopy machine since the one she has now needs to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca S. desde hace 27 largos años se dedica a la venta de productos de librería y servicios de fotocopiado en el mercado del Israel Lewites en Managua.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, vendía agua en diferentes lugares, pero al darse cuenta de que este negocio no le beneficiaba en lo absoluto decidió realizar ahorros por mucho tiempo hasta realizar compras de los productos de librería.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Blanca S. es madre soltera y con tres hijos que mantener. Por este motivo es que ella decide realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (3 prestamos actualmente) el cual le han beneficiado para la compra de dos vitrinas para colocar sus productos y a la vez, para la adquisición de una pequeña fotocopiadora. Su meta es seguir surtiendo su negocio con mayores cantidades de productos y a la vez adquirir una nueva fotocopiadora ya que la que posee actualmente necesita ser cambiada.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for sale and establish a business location

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José David is a young man whose business is the transport of people throughout the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has been doing this for a living for 4 years, starting with a small investment of his own with which he purchased a used bicycle, and over time he has continued to fix and refurbish it.

He is father to a newborn girl and thus now bears the responsibility to provide for all of her expenses. It must be emphasized that this young man works very hard at this business, transporting people from morning until dusk. The improvement to his bicycle taxi has been carried out with support obtained through Ceprodel, loans which he has invested in the repair of the bicycle in order to offer improved service to his clients. Now his need is the acquisition of resources to provide for corrective maintenance to his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio del joven José David es la transportación de personas en todo el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años iniciando con un pequeño capital propio con el que compró una bicicleta usada y a través del tiempo la ha venido remodelando.

Es padre de una pequeña niña con el deber de brindarle apoyo en todos los gastos ya que es recién nacida. Es necesario destacar que este joven trabaja arduamente en este negocio, transportando personas desde la mañana hasta el atardecer. La mejora de sui medio de transporte loa ha realizado con el apoyo obtenido por Ceprodel el cual ha invertido estos créditos en la reparación de la bicicleta para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición de recursos para darle el mantenimiento correctivo a su medio de transporte.

loans.use: Repair of his bicycle taxi

loans.name: Rahma's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, aged 9-17 years old. Rahma is a bites and coconut oil seller, who started the business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
The Perseverancia Microfinance Institute is a bank that is just starting out with 20 members.

The members partake in different businesses, such as food, firewood, grains, clothing, provisions, small animals, maize beverages, flowers, and bread.

The members need varying loan amounts, from 300 to 600 Peruvian Soles, totaling 9,000 soles in loans from this bank.

They will invest the loan money in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables.

The members’ dreams are for their businesses to grow, their children to become professionals, and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Perseverancia es un banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, leña, cereales, ropa, abarrotes, animales Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas. menores, chicha, F. y panes.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 9,000 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios sean grandes, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. B. Thi Ngo, 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2002 with the goal of expanding her business. In previous funding rounds, her family invested in raising pigs and chicken. She is an empathic and hard working person who is always willing to learn. Her family is very successful at raising livestock, the family’s finances have improved steadily and they have been able to afford more necessities like a vehicle, refrigerator, etc. Besides the income from raising livestock, the family also has a steady income from her husband’s herbal medicine business; having this reliable income encouraged the family to go with the weekly payment borrowing method, since it fit their needs well. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising pigs and chicken. The family’s average income is 2,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngọ Thị Bốn, năm nay 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002, với mục đích vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, các vòng vốn trước gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Với bản chất chịu thương chịu khó ham học hỏi, gia đình chị chăn nuôi rất thuận lợi, từ đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển và đã mua sắm được các trang thiết bị cần thiết cho gia đình như xe máy, tủ lạnh .......Ngoài việc thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, gia đình chị còn có nguồn thu đều đặn chồng chị làm nghề bốc thuốc bắc, chính từ nguồn thu đều đặn này mà gia đình chị thấy việc hoàn trả theo tuần là rất phù hợp. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư tiếp vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 2.000.000đ/tháng.

loans.use: feed pigs

loans.name: Idania

texts.es:
Mrs. Idania C. is a mother of four (three of her children are still studying).That is why she puts a great effort in her tortilla business, which she runs from her home in the Ciudad Sandino county in Managua.

She has come to Ceprodel in order to request a loan so that she can buy all the ingredients needed to make her delicious tortillas so that she can sell them from her home. She is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and has obtained 3 loans with them which she has timely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Idania C. es madre de cuatro pequeños hijos de los cuales tres de ellos se encuentran estudiando y por dicho motivo ella se esfuerza en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar la material prima para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas y así venderlas en su casa de habitación. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel por lo que ha obtenido tres créditos habiéndolos cancelado de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es:
Esperanza works as a cleaning lady in a business of the city of Managua. She lives in the North laurels neighborhood, characterized by its high poverty rate. Esperanza is a single mother that has dedicated herself most of her life to trying to do well for herself and her children. According to her account, Doña Esperanza's plans for her family are: "To give a home to my children, to educate them, to give them good examples, to try to prepare them so that their life is not as hard as mine". The loan will be used to buy zinc and to put it in ¼ part of its dwelling. She will also try to begin the construction of a front wall in her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza se desempeña como afanadora en una empresa de la ciudad de Managua, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte caracterizado por su alto índice de pobreza. Esperanza es una madre soltera que la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado a tratar de salir adelante ella y sus hijos. Los planes de Doña Esperanza para su familia según ella cuenta son: “Hacerle la casa a mis hijos, educarlos, darles buenos ejemplos, tratar de que ellos se preparen para que la vida no sea tan dura como la mía”. El crédito lo usará para comprar zinc y ponerlo en ¼ parte de su vivienda. También tratará de empezar la construcción de un muro delantero en su vivienda.

loans.use: To put a ceiling on 1/4 part of her house.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con su hija Susan de 12 años.
Es una mujer independiente, que pese a los maltratos de la vida, ha sabido superar con fortaleza cada golpe, ella tiene una carpintería en su casa, en la cual trabaja fabricando muebles.Este pequeño negocio viene funcionando desde hace 20 años y Maruja le pone mucho empeño en que siga produciendo y creciendo cada vez más, usualmente trabaja por las mañanas y parte de las tardes, lo cual se le hace difícil, ya que también tiene que velar por su hija Susan que está estudiando. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que es muy concurrido y la venta es muy buena.
Maruja quiere ver a su hija profesional y que no dependa de nadie para salir adelante.
Con el dinero que obtendrá comprará material (madera y otros) para producir más muebles y en el futuro tener un gran taller de fabricación de muebles con sucursales en toda la región.
texts.en:
Maruja, 32, is single. She lives with her 12-year old daughter, Susan. She is an independent woman who, despite many hardships, has overcome every blow with great fortitude. She has a carpentry shop in her house where she works making furniture. Maruja has operated the business for 20 years and she makes great efforts to maintain the business and grow it bit by bit. She usually works mornings and parts of afternoons, something that's difficult for her because she also has to care for her daughter, Susan, who is still in school.

What Maruja most wants for her business is many customers and big revenues. She wants to see her daughter settled in a professional career so that she doesn't have to depend on anyone else to get ahead. With the money that she will borrow, she will buy materials (wood and other materials) to make more furniture. In the future, she'd like to have a large furniture workshop with outlets around the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for furniture making business.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise F., 52, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells taro, taamu, and bananas to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be Tala (~300 USD). Lise's husband helps her operate the business.

Lise has 3 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy things she needs for her business, including knives, fertilizers, pesticides, and taro tubers.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, knives, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his parents. He owns a taxi and also works as a tile polisher. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to help purchase a school bus. Fadi has been an Al Majmoua client since 2004 and he paid back all his previous loans on time.

loans.use: Fadi wants a loan to help purchase a school bus

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 32 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años tiene su propio negocio, una tienda, la cual administra de manera independiente, con ella, cada día logra el sustento para sus hijos, la atención que ofrece es diaria, incluso los domingos, realiza sus pedidos de mercadería a las casas distribuidoras para abarrotarla de productos de pan llevar, para ella es una ventaja, porque dispone de su propio tiempo, además abrió su tienda cercana a un centro de estudios y tiene buena clientela. Uno de los riesgos es el robo, por lo cual atiende con todas las medidas de seguridad. Está satisfecha, y sigue adelante porque sus hijos son lo más importante para ella. En el caso de Olinda, es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, con el cual se compromete a devolverlo porque es una persona responsable. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá adquirir más mercadería para su tienda como bebidas y otros víveres.
texts.en:
Olinda is 32 years old and lives with her 3 children. She has owned her own business for the past 10 years, a store which she runs independently. Thanks to her business, she is able to take care of her children's basic needs. Her store is open every day, even on Sundays, which allows her to place orders with distributors of agricultural products. This gives her an advantage as she can manage her own time. In addition, her store is near a school zone and she has a good client base. One of the risks of her business is robbery, so she must be very vigilant. She is satisfied, and continues forging ahead because her children are her highest priority. This will be Olinda's first loan, which she will repay because she is a responsible person. She is requesting this loan so that she can acquire more merchandise for her store, such as beverages and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Koffi Marius

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur de 39 ans réside dans le quartier d’Agoè cacavéli au nord de la ville de Lomé (Togo). Ce monsieur travaille dur pour satisfaire sa famille, il est chaudronnier à une boutique qu’il a appelé FONDATION MARIUS. il  travaille ce métier depuis 1993. il a déjà obtenu 03 prêt de WAGES qu’il a bien remboursé, il demande ce quatrième prêt pour acheter 200 pièces de cordes, 30 tuyaux et 20 coffrets.
Il  est marié avec une dame qui est revendeuse et ont ensemble 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Koffi Marius A. is 39 years old. He lives in the "Cacavéli" neighborhood of Agoe located to the north of the city of Togo. He works in order to provide for his family. He is a boilermaker and has a store called "Fondation Marius" (Marius Foundation). He has been in this business since 1993. He has already obtained 3 loans previously that he was able to successfully pay back. He is looking to obtain a 4th loan in order to purchase 200 pieces of rope, 30 pieces of pipe and 20 boxes. He is married and has 1 child. His wife is a sales woman.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rope, piping and boxes

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia Nyarkwaa is a 48-year-old trader. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently, four attend school in the village. She trades in onions, tomatoes and peppers, etc. on a table-top in a village market at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and retails them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says that through this business she has endeavored to support two of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests the loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to grow her business to boost profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education, to give them future and hope.

Afia is convinced that with her 25 years trade experience, when the loan is given to her she will have more resources to expand her business growth. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kristo nti’ which means 'Christ Sake'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchase of increased stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn T. a hardworking 45 years old woman is married and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Mis. Occ. She has 7 children, and her husband is a carpenter. She desires to help her husband by opening a small grocery store to support her family’s needs. The store began as a snack vender for her neighbors & friends, but eventually grew into a prosperous business. In order to expand her business, Mrs. T. joined Paglaum Cooperative last July 2004. She was then able to begin and return her 1st loan. From then on, she had returned her loans as early as the 13th cycle. She was able to renovate her house because of the prosperity that Paglaum brought her.  Now, she is applying for a loan in order to buy basic commodities for her grocery store. In the future, she wants to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities  for sari-sari store

loans.name: Syeda Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Syeda baji, the wife of S. A., runs a tea stall in Vehari, Pakistan. Syeda baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. Syeda baji is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is an electrician and the younger son works in a factory on a monthly wage. Syeda baji is applying for a loan to buy tea, sugar and milk for her husband’s tea stall. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Afzal baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy goats for her livestock business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tea stall

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu A. sells clothing for babies and ladies wear at the sea shore in Elmina.  Ayishatu has a senior high education.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a teacher.  Ayishatu has been selling since 2008.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Her loan will be used to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of clothing for babies and ladies wear, to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.name: Hamamata

texts.en:
Hamamata L. is 36 years old. She is divorced and the mother of two children; one has completed senior high and is awaiting his results whilst her last born is still in school.

Hamamata is resourceful and enterprising. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like "diewuo". Diewuo is prepared from powdered maize mixed with dried cassava powder taken with soup. It is enjoyed as breakfast and lunch and normally it is prepared by the Muslims who live in the Zongo communities in Ghana.

She has a strategic business location, giving her favorable sales. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional working capital into the business to scale up production and increase her income level. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like maize powder, cassava powder, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to facilitate her food production. Hamamata belongs to a village bank called Jeremiah. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like maize powder, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  es socia del bancomunal Grandioso  Milagro.
Elizabet es casada tiene 45 años, seis hijos de 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 y 10 años, estos dos últimos están estudiando  en la escuela estatal.  
Elizabeth  trabajaba cocinando pero la despidieron, se quedo sin trabajo, tenía que aportar a su casa, entonces tuvo la idea de vender en su casa cerveza y gaseosa, ella vende a puerta cerrada, su esposo es albañil, y no siempre tiene trabajo, solo por temporadas.    
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de 20 cajas de cerveza y 10 cajas de  gaseosa. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, puede invertir en su negocio y sus hijos pueden estudiar en un instituto superior.  
El sueño de Elizabeth es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. Elizabeth is married, is 45 years old and has six children ages 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 and 10. The latter two are studying at public school. Elizabeth worked as a cook but was left without work. She had to support her household so she had the idea of selling beer and soft drinks from her home. She sells behind a closed door. Elizabeth's husband is a mason and doesn't always have work, only seasonally. Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 soles to buy 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks. Since she has been with FINCA, her income has improved, she can invest in her business and her children can study at a better school. Elizabeth's dream is that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Абдулло житель района Пяндж.  Женат и имеет одного ребенка . Работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует одеждой и парфюмерией.Местность в которой он живет находиться далеко от центра, поэтому товар быстро расходится.В связи с этим Абдулло решил получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот.Это поможет обеспечить рынок необходимыми товарами, что поможет населению приобретать товар , не выезжая за приделы района.
texts.en:
M. Abdullo is a resident of the Pyandj region. He is married and has one child. He works in the business sphere. He sells clothing and perfume. The area where he lives is located far from the center and because of this his products sell quickly. Because of this, Abdullo decided to get a loan and increase his turnover. This will help to provide the market with necessary products, which will help the population to get products without having to leave the borders of the area.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: A livestock breeder for eight years, S. Salim was born in 1968 in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and responsible for three people including his wife and two children. Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and repair his enclosure. This will enable him to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, some of whom buy animals from more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Salim is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more small cattle for his developing business

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie M. has requested a 500,000 Rwandan franc (FRW) loan to help her expand her business. She is 42 years old, and the married mother of three children. She sells non-alcoholic beverages in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, and has been in the business for four years. She currently makes a monthly profit of 200,000 FRW. This is her first loan, with which she hopes to expand her product offering.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are still in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. 

Mary trades in smoked fish. She buys from the northern part of the country and sells at the local market square. She says she supplies to food vendors, to people in her community and treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav D. is 52 years old and lives with her 54-year-old husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She grows various vegetable on a small piece of land that she owns in the town. She mostly grows potatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions, and tomatoes. After seasonal harvests, she retails her vegetable at the local food market.

She has been growing and retailing vegetable since 2006 and she has done quite well with her agribusiness. She started with little capital, just 150,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) and now her business capital has increased to 800,000 MNT. She says that she would like to open a small wholesale market for various vegetables in the town. In that way it would be easier to sell her products and cheaper for locals to buy them. She requests a loan to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To grow more vegetables

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Agoè Atsanvé à Lomé et a ouvert depuis 2003 dans sa maison une boutique de produits alimentaires  et congelés qui alimente tout le quartier et ses environs. Elle est mariée et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, des produits congelés, des pâtes alimentaires et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Agoé Atsanvé area of Lomé and, in 2003, she opened a store in her house selling food and frozen products that feed the entire area and its surroundings. She is married, and this business allows her to provide for her 2 children. To replenish her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 3 cans of oil, 5 bags of rice, frozen products, food pastes, and various other products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He sell plank.He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria and has been business for long. He hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more plank to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more plank to sell

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad C. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Solidad is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Solidad owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Solidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Solidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” said Carol. She is patiently maintaining a food vending business in their village and sometimes also offers catering service for additional source of income.  For her to expand her business, she is now requesting to avail a loan amount of PHP7,000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help in assisting her to purchase more commodities she needed in cooking foods. 

Carol is 38 years old, married to Armando who is sacrificing to work in another country to provide a better life for his family.  Their two children are: Jhun Karl - 6 years old and Edrick James - 4 years old. Their children are about to study next school year.

loans.use: Additionla capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: B. Antoinette est née en 1963 et vit depuis cinq ans à Louho, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à HOUNNOU Casimir, un enseignant, et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Antoinette  a abandonné l’école au cours primaire et s’est mise depuis vingt cinq ans à vendre des divers (conserves, savons, lait, sucre, insecticides, galette d’arachide, etc.) ainsi que de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Antoinette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Antoinette  est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a antérieurement bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Antoinette B. was born in 1963 and has lived for five years in Louho, a neighborhood of Porto Novo, political capital of Benin. Antoinette is married to Casimir Hounnou, a teacher, and is the mother of five children who all attend school, four of whom are in her care. The couple share the family expenses. Antoinette left primary school and has dedicated herself for twenty-five years to selling various provisions (canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, insecticides, groundnut cookies, etc.) as well as vegetable oil from her residence. Antoinette purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Antoinette is a former customer of ALIDé that earlier benefitted from two loans, which she repaid well to ALIDé. In order to increase her working capital and better satisfy her clientele, Antoinette requests a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various provisions (soap, sardines, tomato in cans, milk, sugar packages) and alcohol.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is single and has three children. She has received junior high school education. Agnes sells smoked fish at Elmina near Bantama, which she has been doing since 2000. She uses her income to pay school fees, utility bills and apartment rent.

Agnes will use the loan to buy fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Amicollé

texts.fr: Amicollé D. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF depuis 7 ans. Elle développe un petit commerce de fruits de saison (mangues, pastèques, oranges etc.) cette activité lui procure des bénéfice qui lui permet de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Amicollé D. is 51 years old, and she is married with nine children. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Bayouf for 7 years. She has developed a small business selling seasonal fruit (mangoes, watermelons, oranges, etc.). This business generates profits for her, which allow her to participate in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Madame TITUS T. 39 ans est marié mère de deux enfants et un autre à sa charge elle est membre à la caisse de liberté 6 et habite à dieupeul non loin de la caisse. Son activité principale est l'aviculture elle achete des poussins qu'elle éleve  pour les revendre  sur le marché. Son expérience dans ce domaine lui vaut un deuxième crédit de 500 000 F CFA sur une durée de 12 mois elle compte sur ce crédit pour accroitre ses activités et aider son mari sur les depenses familialles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Titus T. is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has two children of her own and takes care of a third child. She is a member of the Liberté 6 bank branch and lives in Dieupeul, not far from the bank. She is primarily a poultry farmer. She buys chicks, raises them, and resells them at the market. With her experience, she is asking for a second loan of 500,000 FCFA over a period of 12 months. She is counting on this loan to increase her business and help her husband with the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a New Hen House

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine L. is 38 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She is married and has a school-aged daughter. Karine and her husband have their own business, which they run in their own carriage-shop, where they sell a variety of products: food, household goods and clothes. Karine also helps her husband with farm work. Thus, thanks to their shop and farm, they support their family. Karine asks 1,000,000 AMD to buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
K. Charles is a businessman, thirty-five years old. He has a cosmetics shop located four kilometers away from Zanna. He started his business six years ago.

Charles is using the loan to purchase cosmetics such as jelly, crème, lotions, etc., to expand his business. His future dream is to buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Juana Amanda

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana Amanda L.  a sus 75 años de edad se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma en su establecimiento donde a diario oferta la ropa a sus clientes que le visitan y siempre está en busca de mantenerse ya que ella es soltera y los ingresos percibidos del negocio son para su sustento.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa y es por este motivo que espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio que ella tiene en buen dirigir.
texts.en:
In the El Bisne market of Chinandega department, the 75 year old Juana Amanda Lopez works at the sale of clothing which she markets herself in her establishment, where she offers the clothes daily to her customers who visit. She is always seeking to support herself, as she is single and the income of the business is her livelihood. She is requesting this credit to invest in purchasing the clothing. For this reason she hopes that said credit will be granted in order to enable her to continue improving the condition of her business, which she has well in hand.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana B. is from the village of Olango. She is 46 years old. Susana is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Susana is married and has 2 adult children. Susana owns & operates a livestock business raising pigs for sale. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Susana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: German

texts.es: El German vive en la localidad de El Torno distante a 40 Km. de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, Esta casado el es carpintero de profesión, su esposa la Sra. Epifania , se dedica a la venta de comida, en el mercado central, tiene tres hijo de los cuales dos de ellos están a su cargo, y pasando estudios superiores, el Sr. German es una persona responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es de ver a sus hijos profesionales,el destino del crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital  de trabajo que fue reducido, cuando su madre enfermo y al final falleció esto fue un golpe muy duro para el, pero supo salir adelante por su familia; el se siente contento por la confianza que emprender y Kiva le ha dado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
German lives in El Torno, 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is married and is a carpenter by profession. His wife Epifania sells food in the central market. They have three children, two of which they still support and who are completing their higher education. German is a hard working responsible person and he hopes to someday see his children become professionals. He will use the money from this loan to increase his working capital, which was reduced when his mother became ill and passed away. This was a difficult time for him, but he knew how to move his family ahead. He appreciates the trust that Kiva has placed in him by helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 53 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijas mayores de edad, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Cèsar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueva Guinea desde hace 32 años, se caraceteriza por ser una mujer responsable honesta y muy trabajadora, su hija mayor vive con ella, y como se encuentra desempleada le ayuda hacer los quehaceres del hogar,  con este prestamo pretende construir una habitaciòn, para tener mejor comodidad en el hogar y privacidad ya que solamente tiene una habitaciòn en la casa, el sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda con los crèditos y ayudar a su familia en lo que mas pueda ya que son de escasos recursos econòmicos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 53 years old single mother of two adult daughters. She has worked as a teacher in the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueva Guinea School for 32 years. She is known as a responsible and very hardworking woman. Her older daughter lives with her because she finds herself unemployed, and her daughter helps her with housework. With this loan she intends to construct a room that will improve the comfort and privacy in her home. The house only has one room right now. The dream is to improve her house little by little with her credit and help her family as much as possible with the little economic resources she has.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Las reuniones del Banco Comunal San Andrés las vienen realizando en la parroquia Picoaza a 10 minutos de la capital manabita, la María Natividad Gloria pertenece a este Banco como socia fundadora.

María es soltera de 42 años se dedica a la guardería en la misma parroquia donde vive, ella es la encargada de preparar los alimentos para los niños de la guardería, pero nuestra socia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y por ello tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende colas, cervezas, galletas golosinas a encargada de atender la tienda es la mamá, mientras la señora María Natividad en la guardería trabaja desde las 8 am hasta las 4pm una vez que sale de ahí se dedica a vender Avon con este negocio inicio hace 10 años y con la tienda 1 año.

Con este nuevo préstamo que va a recibir nuestra socia, invertirá en productos de Avon y en cervezas que es lo que más se vende.

El  mayor anhelo de la señora María Natividad es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The meetings of the San Andrés Communal Bank are held in Picoaza Parish, which is ten minutes away from the capital of Manabita. María Natividad is one of the founding members of this Communal Bank.

She is 42 years old, single, and manages a nursery school in the same parish where she lives. María is in charge of preparing the meals for the children. She is also a woman who enjoys working, so she set up a store in her home where she sells soft drinks, beer, cookies, and candy. Her mother looks after the store while she works at the nursery school from 8am until 4pm. In addition, Maria sells Avon products, which she started ten years ago after she opened her store the previous year.

With this new loan, she will invest in Avon cosmetics and beer, the product that sells the most. Her greatest wish is to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Avon products and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isabel C. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años su negocio es de venta de refrescos, gaseosas, pan, tajadas  etc, esta ubicado de la farmacia santa lucia 1c al norte 1/2c al oeste.
Es madre de dos hijos solo uno de ellos depende de ella la otra hija de ya es mayor de edad pero le ayuda a vender en su negocio, tiene  3 años de trabajar con ceprodel con 17 créditos siempre nos ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y que se esfuerza por el bienestar de su hijo manifestándonos que gracias a ceprodel a mejorado su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Reyna Isabel C. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años su negocio es de venta de refrescos, gaseosas, pan, tajadas etc, esta ubicado de la farmacia santa lucia 1c al norte 1/2c al oeste. Es madre de dos hijos solo uno de ellos depende de ella la otra hija de ya es mayor de edad pero le ayuda a vender en su negocio, tiene 3 años de trabajar con ceprodel con 17 créditos siempre nos ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y que se esfuerza por el bienestar de su hijo manifestándonos que gracias a ceprodel a mejorado su casa y su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de gaseosas, plátano, bisutería

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Mahamudu is 25 years old and single.  He has been running a small stand selling second-hand clothes and shoes since 2008.  He works from 7:30 am until 7 pm six days a week and earns about $200 a month in profits. Mahamudu dreams of expanding his business, and he will use this loan to increase his stock by purchasing additional styles and sizes of clothes and shoes.  

This will be Mahamudu’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Mahamudu is a member of the Saranga Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  Mahamudu is the only man in the group and can be seen in the back row wearing a hat.

loans.use: To increase his second hand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Shanta T. is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are studying in higher secondary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Mrs. T. is engaged in the cow-raising business. She already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition. Shanta T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.

She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Shanta plans to use her loan to purchase a jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: to buy another young  cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and two children. Fourteen years ago he opened his own aluminum molding factory.

He is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase new tools for the business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Jurynda

texts.en:
Jurynda R. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jurynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jurynda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Nol Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Sdok Prei village in Takeo province consists of sixteen people who has been selected Mrs. Mao N. is a village bank president who was born in 1953. All the members are made up a village bank loan and they will use portion of their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mao N. is a grass seller at her home where she is able to earn some money to support her family. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a sugar palm seller, another is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other one is helping her to sell grass, and the other is attending in local public school. Her problem is that she did not have a motorbike to support all her family members’ businesses. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Mao N. is seeking for a loan to make more money to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike
